 21359                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21360                                  
 21361                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21362                                  
 21363                                  modify_spc:
 21364 00003373 50                      	push	ax			; ax = sectors per cluster
 21365 00003374 52                      	push	dx
 21366 00003375 F7E1                    	mul	cx			; bytes per sector
 21367                                  	;cmp	dx,0
 21368 00003377 21D2                    	and	dx,dx
 21369 00003379 7503                    	jnz	short mspc_1
 21370 0000337B 3D0040                  	cmp	ax,16384		; 16 kilobytes (per cluster)
 21371                                  					; ***
 21372                                  					; actual disk size limit
 21373                                  					; without invalidating cluster counts is
 21374                                  					; 2 GB (512K clusters * 8 sectors per cluster)
 21375                                  					;      (128K clusters * 32 sectors per cluster)
 21376                                  mspc_1:
 21377 0000337E 5A                      	pop	dx
 21378 0000337F 58                      	pop	ax
 21379 00003380 760E                    	jbe	short mspc_3		; bytes per cluster <= 16 KB
 21380                                                                          ; ***
 21381                                                                          ; bytes per cluster > 16 KB
 21382 00003382 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; 0
 21383 00003384 BBFEFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFEh		; (invalidated)
 21384 00003387 09F6                    	or	si,si			; hw of free cluster count
 21385 00003389 7404                    	jz	short mspc_2		; si = 0
 21386 0000338B 89FE                    	mov	si,di			; si = 0
 21387 0000338D 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx			; dx = bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated)
 21388                                  mspc_2:
 21389 0000338F C3                      	retn
 21390                                  
 21391                                  mspc_3:
 21392 00003390 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1			; sectors per clust = sectors per clust * 2
 21393                                  					; (ax <= 32768) -modified spc limit-
 21394 00003392 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; cluster count = cluster count /2
 21395                                  					; di:bx = modified value of total clusters
 21396                                  mspc_4:
 21397 00003394 D1DB                    	rcr	bx,1
 21398 00003396 D1EE                    	shr	si,1			; free clusters = free clusters / 2
 21399 00003398 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1			; si:dx = modified value of free clusters
 21400                                  
 21401                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21402                                  
 21403                                  	; 03/02/2024
 21404                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7431h
 21405                                  
 21406                                  modify_cluster_count:
 21407 0000339A 09FF                    	or	di,di			; hw of cluster count
 21408 0000339C 75D5                    	jnz	short modify_spc
 21409 0000339E C3                      	retn
 21410                                  
 21411                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21412                                  
 21413                                  ; write FSINFO sector onto disk
 21414                                  
 21415                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21416                                  ; --------------------------------
 21417                                  ; FAT32 FSInfo Sector Structure
 21418                                  ; --------------------------------
 21419                                  ; ref: Microsoft FAT32 File System Specification (2000)
 21420                                  
 21421                                  struc FSINFO		; Offset ;
 21422 00000000 ????????                .LeadSig:	resb 4	  ; 0		; Value 0x41615252. Lead Signature.
 21423 00000004 <res 1E0h>              .Reserved1:	resb 480  ; 4		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21424 000001E4 ????????                .StrucSig:	resb 4	  ; 484		; Value 0x61417272. Fields Signature.
 21425 000001E8 ????????                .Free_Count:	resb 4	  ; 488		; Last known free cluster count. (*) 
 21426 000001EC ????????                .Nxt_Free:	resb 4	  ; 492		; Start clus for free clus srch. (**)
 21427 000001F0 <res Ch>                .Reserved2:	resb 12	  ; 496		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21428 000001FC ????????                .TrailSig:	resb 4	  ; 508		; Value 0xAA550000. Trail Signature.
 21429                                  .size:
 21430                                  endstruc
 21431                                  
 21432                                  ; (*) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then the free count is unknown
 21433                                  ;     and must be computed.
 21434                                  ; (**) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then free cluster search must be started
 21435                                  ;     from cluster 2.
 21436                                  ; Lead Signature, Fields (Structure) Signature and Trail Signature
 21437                                  ; are used to validate FSInfo sector.
 21438                                  
 21439                                  ; --------------------------------
 21440                                  
 21441                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21442                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7436h
 21443                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7227h)
 21444                                  
 21445                                  update_fat32_fsinfo:
 21446 0000339F 51                      	push	cx
 21447 000033A0 52                      	push	dx
 21448 000033A1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21449                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+25h]
 21450 000033A3 268B5625                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FSINFO_SECTOR]
 21451                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],cx
 21452 000033A7 26394E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],cx ; 0
 21453                                  				; (16bit FAT size field = 0 for FAT32 fs)
 21454 000033AB 7505                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_1
 21455 000033AD 83FAFF                  	cmp	dx,0FFFFh ; -1
 21456 000033B0 7508                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_2
 21457                                  
 21458                                  u_fat32_inf_1:
 21459 000033B2 5A                      	pop	dx
 21460 000033B3 59                      	pop	cx
 21461                                  	;and	byte [es:bp+18h],0F4h
 21462 000033B4 26806618F4              	and	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],0F4h ; clear bit 0,1 and 3
 21463                                  					; bit 0 - FSINFO update (dirty) bit
 21464                                  					; bit 1 - BPB_RootClus update bit
 21465                                  					; bit 3 - BPB_ExtFlags update bit
 21466 000033B9 C3                      	retn
 21467                                  
 21468                                  u_fat32_inf_2:
 21469 000033BA 50                      	push	ax
 21470 000033BB 53                      	push	bx
 21471 000033BC 57                      	push	di
 21472 000033BD 56                      	push	si
 21473 000033BE 1E                      	push	ds
 21474 000033BF 36803E[7900]00          	cmp	byte [ss:BuffInHMA],0	; is buffers in HMA?
 21475 000033C5 740A                    	jz	short u_fat32_inf_3	; no
 21476 000033C7 36C53E[7A00]            	lds	di,[ss:LoMemBuff]	; read it into scratch buffer
 21477                                  	;sub	di,24
 21478 000033CC 83EF18                  	sub	di,BUFINSIZ		; space for buffer header
 21479                                  					; (buffer header size = 24)
 21480                                  	;clc
 21481 000033CF EB0E                    	jmp	short u_fat32_inf_4
 21482                                  
 21483                                  u_fat32_inf_3:
 21484 000033D1 06                      	push	es
 21485 000033D2 55                      	push	bp
 21486 000033D3 E83531                  	call	GETCURHEAD		; ds:di = first buffer in queue
 21487 000033D6 52                      	push	dx
 21488 000033D7 E89433                  	call	BUFWRITE		; BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk,
 21489                                  					;  if it's dirty.
 21490 000033DA 5A                      	pop	dx
 21491 000033DB 5D                      	pop	bp
 21492 000033DC 07                      	pop	es
 21493                                  ;u_fat32_inf_4:
 21494 000033DD 726A                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21495                                  u_fat32_inf_4:
 21496 000033DF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21497                                  	;lea	bx,[di+24]
 21498 000033E1 8D5D18                  	lea	bx,[di+BUFINSIZ]	; buffer data address
 21499                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],18h
 21500 000033E4 36C606[4B03]18          	mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 21501 000033EA 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21502 000033EF 41                      	inc	cx			; cx = sector count = 1
 21503                                  					; es:bp = DPB
 21504 000033F0 53                      	push	bx			; ds:bx = buffer (data) address
 21505 000033F1 52                      	push	dx			; HIGH_SECTOR:dx = disk sector address
 21506 000033F2 E8800A                  	call	DREAD		 	; read fs info sector
 21507 000033F5 5A                      	pop	dx
 21508 000033F6 5B                      	pop	bx
 21509 000033F7 7250                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21510                                  
 21511                                  	;cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig],5252h	
 21512 000033F9 813F5252                	cmp	word [bx],5252h		; 'RR'
 21513 000033FD 754A                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21514                                  	;cmp	word [bx+2],4161h	; 'aA' ; (NASM syntax)
 21515 000033FF 817F026141              	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig+2],4161h
 21516 00003404 7543                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21517                                  	
 21518                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E4h],7272h	; 'rr' at offset 484
 21519 00003406 81BFE4017272            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig],7272h
 21520 0000340C 753B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21521                                  
 21522                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E6h],6141h	; 'Aa' at offset 486
 21523 0000340E 81BFE6014161            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig+2],6141h
 21524 00003414 7533                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21525                                  
 21526                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1FEh],0AA55h	; boot signature at offset 510
 21527 00003416 81BFFE0155AA            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.TrailSig+2],0AA55h
 21528 0000341C 752B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21529                                  	
 21530                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+1Fh]
 21531 0000341E 268B461F                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT]
 21532                                  	;mov	[bx+1E8h],ax 
 21533 00003422 8987E801                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count],ax ; at offset 488
 21534                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+21h]
 21535 00003426 268B4621                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 21536                                  	;mov	[bx+1EAh],ax
 21537 0000342A 8987EA01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count+2],ax
 21538                                  
 21539                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+39h]
 21540 0000342E 268B4639                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE]
 21541                                  	;mov	[bx+1ECh],ax
 21542 00003432 8987EC01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free],ax	; at offset 492
 21543                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+3Bh]
 21544 00003436 268B463B                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2]
 21545                                  	;mov	[bx+1EEh],ax
 21546 0000343A 8987EE01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free+2],ax
 21547                                  
 21548 0000343E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21549 00003440 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21550 00003445 41                      	inc	cx	; 1
 21551 00003446 E8910A                  	call	DWRITE
 21552                                  
 21553                                  u_fat32_inf_5:
 21554 00003449 1F                      	pop	ds
 21555 0000344A 5E                      	pop	si
 21556 0000344B 5F                      	pop	di
 21557 0000344C 5B                      	pop	bx
 21558 0000344D 58                      	pop	ax
 21559 0000344E E961FF                  	jmp	u_fat32_inf_1

 21561                                  ;============================================================================
 21562                                  ; ISEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 21563                                  ;============================================================================
 21564                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21565                                  
 21566                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_SEARCH - Internal SEARCH calls for MS-DOS
 21567                                  ;	NAME	DOS_SEARCH
 21568                                  
 21569                                  ;**	Low level routines for doing local and NET directory searches
 21570                                  ;
 21571                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21572                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT
 21573                                  ;	RENAME_NEXT
 21574                                  ;
 21575                                  ;	Revision history:
 21576                                  ;
 21577                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 21578                                  ;	    A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 21579                                  ;	    A001	PTM 3564 -- search for fastopen
 21580                                  
 21581                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 21582                                  
 21583                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21584                                  ;
 21585                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21586                                  ;
 21587                                  ; Inputs:
 21588                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 21589                                  ;		terminated)
 21590                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 21591                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 21592                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 21593                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 21594                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 21595                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 21596                                  ;	[DMAADD] Points to 53 byte buffer
 21597                                  ; Function:
 21598                                  ;	Initiate a search for the given file spec
 21599                                  ; Outputs:
 21600                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 21601                                  ;	    The 53 bytes ot DMAADD are filled in as follows:
 21602                                  ;
 21603                                  ;	LOCAL
 21604                                  ;	    Drive Byte (A=1, B=2, ...) High bit clear
 21605                                  ;		NEVER STORE DRIVE BYTE AFTER  found_it
 21606                                  ;	    11 byte search name with Meta chars in it
 21607                                  ;	    Search Attribute Byte, attribute of search
 21608                                  ;	    WORD LastEnt value
 21609                                  ;	    WORD DirStart
 21610                                  ;	    4 byte pad
 21611                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21612                                  ;	NET
 21613                                  ;	    21 bytes First byte has high bit set
 21614                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21615                                  ;
 21616                                  ;	CARRY SET
 21617                                  ;	    AX = error code
 21618                                  ;		error_no_more_files
 21619                                  ;			No match for this file
 21620                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 21621                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 21622                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 21623                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 21624                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 21625                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21626                                  
 21627                                  ; 11/05/2025
 21628                                  ; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 21629                                  ; 24/01/2024
 21630                                  %if 0
 21631                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21632                                  GET_FAST_SEARCH:
 21633                                  	; 22/07/2018
 21634                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21635                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21636                                  	OR	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],(SEARCH_FASTOPEN>>8)  ; 04h
 21637                                  	;OR	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],SEARCH_FASTOPEN  ; 400h
 21638                                  					;FO.trigger fastopen ;AN000;
 21639                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21640                                  	;retn
 21641                                  	; 24/01/2024
 21642                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21643                                  	;jmp	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21644                                  %endif
 21645                                  
 21646                                  	; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21647                                  	; DOSCODE:6C22h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21648                                  
 21649                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 21650                                  	; DOSCODE:74E9h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)

 21676

 21681 00003467 B81B11                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|27
 21682 0000346A CD2F                    	INT	2FH
 21683 0000346C C3                      	retn
 21684                                  ;ENDIF

 21686                                  LOCAL_SEARCH_FIRST:
 21687 0000346D E828E4                  	call	ECritDisk
 21688

 21690                                  	;; MSDOS 6.0

 21697                                  	;;or	byte [FastOpenFlg],1

 21699

 21702

 21705                                  %if 0

 21718                                  	jz	short NO_Question	;AN000;;FO. yes

 22084                                  ;============================================================================
 22085                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22086                                  ;============================================================================
 22087                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22088                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22089                                  
 22090                                  ;**
 22091                                  ;
 22092                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 22093                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 22094                                  ;
 22095                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 22096                                  ;
 22097                                  ;   Modification history:
 22098                                  ;
 22099                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 22100                                  ;
 22101                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 22102                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 22103                                  ;
 22104                                  
 22105                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 22106                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22107                                  ;
 22108                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 22109                                  ;
 22110                                  ; Inputs:
 22111                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 22112                                  ; Function:
 22113                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 22114                                  ; Returns:
 22115                                  ;       None
 22116                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 22117                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22118                                  
 22119                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22120                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7685h
 22121                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:74F4h) 
 22122                                  
 22123                                  DOS_ABORT:
 22124 00003597 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 22125 0000359C 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 22126                                  reset_free_jfn:
 22127 000035A1 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 22128 000035A3 51                      	PUSH    CX
 22129 000035A4 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 22130                                  
 22131 000035A5 E8F63D                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 22132 000035A8 59                      	POP     CX
 22133 000035A9 E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 22134                                  
 22135                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 22136                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 22137                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 22138                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 22139                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 22140                                  ;
 22141                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 22142                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 22143                                  ;
 22144                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 22145                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 22146                                  ; up after this process.
 22147                                  ;
 22148                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 22149                                  
 22150                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 22151 000035AB 16                      	push	ss
 22152 000035AC 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 22153                                  
 22154                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 22155 000035AD B81D11                  	mov	ax,111Dh
 22156 000035B0 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 22157                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 22158                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 22159                                  ;if installed
 22160 000035B2 FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 22161                                  ;else
 22162                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 22163                                  ;endif
 22164                                  
 22165                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 22166                                  ; counts.
 22167                                  					; SS override
 22168 000035B6 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 22169                                  
 22170                                  	;;;
 22171                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22172                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22173                                  SFTFCB_check:
 22174 000035BB 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 22175 000035BD 09F9                    	or	cx,di
 22176 000035BF E325                    	jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22177 000035C1 57                      	push	di
 22178                                  SFTFCB_OK:
 22179                                  	;;;
 22180                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 22181 000035C2 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 22182                                  	;jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22183                                  	; 27/06/2024
 22184                                  	;;;
 22185 000035C6 E315                    	jcxz    SFTFCB_check2	
 22186                                  	;;;
 22187                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 22188 000035C8 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 22189 000035CB 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22190                                  FCBTest:
 22191                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22192 000035CF 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 22193 000035D3 7503                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 22194                                  
 22195                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22196                                  %if 0
 22197                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22198                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; yes, blast ref count
 22199                                  %else
 22200                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22201                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22202 000035D5 E87A13                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22203                                  %endif
 22204                                  
 22205                                  FCBNext:
 22206 000035D8 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 22207 000035DB E2F2                    	loop    FCBTest
 22208                                  
 22209                                  	; 27/06/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22210                                  	;;;
 22211                                  SFTFCB_check2:
 22212 000035DD 5F                      	pop	di
 22213 000035DE 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di]
 22214 000035E1 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22215 000035E4 75D5                    	jne	short SFTFCB_check
 22216                                  	;;;
 22217                                  
 22218                                  FCBScanDone:
 22219                                  
 22220                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 22221                                  
 22222 000035E6 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 22223                                  Scan:
 22224 000035E8 53                      	push    bx
 22225 000035E9 E82E3D                  	call	SFFromSFN
 22226 000035EC 5B                      	pop     bx
 22227                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 22228                                  	;retn
 22229                                  
 22230                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22231                                  	;jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 22232                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22233 000035ED 7232                    	jc	short RET2
 22234                                  
 22235                                  ;M038
 22236                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 22237                                  
 22238                                  Scan1:
 22239                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 22240                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 22241                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22242 000035EF 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 22243                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 22244                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 22245 000035F3 7517                    	jnz	short scan_next ; no
 22246                                  ;
 22247                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 22248                                  ;
 22249 000035F5 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22250                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22251 000035F9 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 22252 000035FD 750D                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22253 000035FF 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 22254                                  	;sub	ax,[es:di+2Fh] ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 03/02/2024
 22255                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 22256 00003603 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 22257 00003607 7503                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22258                                  
 22259                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 22260                                  
 22261                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22262                                  %if 0
 22263                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22264                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 22265                                  %else
 22266                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22267                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22268 00003609 E84613                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22269                                  %endif
 22270                                  
 22271                                  scan_next:
 22272 0000360C 43                      	inc     bx
 22273 0000360D EBD9                    	jmp     short Scan
 22274                                  
 22275                                  ;============================================================================
 22276                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22277                                  ;============================================================================
 22278                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22279                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22280                                  
 22281                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 22282                                  ;
 22283                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 22284                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 22285                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 22286                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 22287                                  ;
 22288                                  ;	Revision history:
 22289                                  ;
 22290                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 22291                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 22292                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 22293                                  
 22294                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 22295                                  
 22296                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 22297                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22298                                  ;
 22299                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 22300                                  ;
 22301                                  ; Inputs:
 22302                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 22303                                  ; Function:
 22304                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 22305                                  ; Returns:
 22306                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 22307                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22308                                  ;	Carry set if error
 22309                                  ;	    AX has error code
 22310                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22311                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22312                                  
 22313                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 22314                                  
 22315                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22316                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22317                                  
 22318                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22319                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22320                                  
 22321                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 22322                                  
 22323                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22324                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:76FEh
 22325                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7579h) 
 22326                                  
 22327                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 22328 0000360F C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22329                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 22330 00003613 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22331                                  
 22332                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 22333                                  
 22334                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 22335                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 22336                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22337                                  	;test	bh,80h
 22338 00003617 F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 22339 0000361A 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 22340                                  
 22341                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 22342 0000361C B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 22343 0000361F CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 22344                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22345                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22346                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22347                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22348                                  RET2:		; 03/02/2024
 22349 00003621 C3                      	retn
 22350                                  
 22351                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 22352                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 22353                                  ;
 22354                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 22355                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 22356                                  
 22357                                  LocalClose:
 22358 00003622 E873E2                  	call	ECritDisk
 22359 00003625 E87301                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 22360 00003628 E8F600                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 22361                                  
 22362                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 22363                                  	;Context DS
 22364 0000362B 16                      	push	ss
 22365 0000362C 1F                      	pop	ds
 22366                                  
 22367 0000362D 50                      	push	ax
 22368 0000362E 53                      	push	bx
 22369 0000362F E8834A                  	call	ShareEnd
 22370 00003632 5B                      	pop	bx

 22771                                  ;
 22772                                  ; Procedure Name : FREE_SFT
 22773                                  ;
 22774                                  ; ES:DI -> SFT. Decs sft_ref_count. If the count goes to 0, mark it as busy.
 22775                                  ; Flags preserved. Return old ref count in AX
 22776                                  ;
 22777                                  ; Note that busy is indicated by the SFT ref count being -1.
 22778                                  ;
 22779                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 22796                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22797                                  ;
 22798                                  ; Procedure Name : DirFromSFT
 22799                                  ;
 22800                                  ;   DirFromSFT - locate a directory entry given an SFT.
 22801                                  ;
 22802                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 22803                                  ;		DS = DOSDATA
 22804                                  ;   Outputs:
 22805                                  ;		EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk
 22806                                  ;		CurBuf points to buffer
 22807                                  ;		Carry Clear -> operation OK
 22808                                  ;		    ES:DI point to entry
 22809                                  ;		    ES:BX point to buffer
 22810                                  ;		    DS:SI point to SFT
 22811                                  ;		Carry SET   -> operation failed
 22812                                  ;		    registers trashified
 22813                                  ;   Registers modified: ALL
 22814                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22815                                  
 22816                                  	; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 22850                                  	;;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h

 22920 00003781 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - COMMIT REMOTE FILE
 22921                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22922                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22923                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22924                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22925                                  localcommit_retn: ; 18/12/2022	
 22926 00003783 C3                      	retn
 22927                                  ;ENDIF
 22928                                  
 22929                                  ; Perform local commit operation by doing a close but not releaseing the SFT.
 22930                                  ; There are three ways we can do this. One is to enter a critical section to
 22931                                  ; protect a potential free. The second is to increment the ref count to mask
 22932                                  ; the close decrementing.
 22933                                  ;
 22934                                  ; The proper way is to let the caller's of close decide if a decrement should
 22935                                  ; be done. We do this by providing another entry into close after the
 22936                                  ; decrement and after the share information release.
 22937                                  
 22938                                  ; DOSCODE:6FA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22939                                  ; DOSCODE:6F8Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 22940                                  
 22941                                  LOCAL_COMMIT:
 22942 00003784 E811E1                  	call	ECritDisk
 22943                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22944 00003787 E80EE1                  	call	ECritDisk	;PTM.
 22945 0000378A E80E00                  	call	SetSFTTimes
 22946 0000378D B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 22947 00003790 E8A1FE                  	call	CloseEntry
 22948                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22949 00003793 9C                      	PUSHF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 22950 00003794 E80C17                  	call	DEV_OPEN_SFT	;PTM.  increment device count	;AN000;
 22951 00003797 9D                      	POPF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 22952                                  	;call	LCritDisk	;PTM.				;AN000;
 22953                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22954 00003798 E92AE1                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 22955                                  ;localcommit_retn:
 22956                                  ;	retn

 22958                                  ;Break	<SetSFTTimes - signal a change in the times for an SFT>
 22959                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22960                                  ;

 22962                                  ;
 22963                                  ;   SetSFTTimes - Examine the flags for a SFT and set the time appropriately.
 22964                                  ;   Reflect these times in other SFT's for the same file.
 22965                                  ;
 22966                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 22967                                  ;		BX = sf_flags set appropriately
 22968                                  ;   Outputs:	Set sft times to current time if File & dirty & !nodate
 22969                                  ;   Registers modified: All except ES:DI, BX, AX
 22970                                  ;
 22971                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22972                                  
 22973                                  	; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22974                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM

 22977

 22985                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device

 23003 0000379F 75E2                    	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 23004                                  %endif
 23005

 23007 000037A2 53                      	push	bx

 23009                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax

 23018                                  ;	call	ShSU
 23019                                  ;endif

 23046                                  ;BREAK <DOS_MkDir - Make a directory entry>
 23047                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23048                                  ;
 23049                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_MkDir
 23050                                  ;
 23051                                  ; Inputs:
 23052                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23053                                  ;		terminated)
 23054                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23055                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23056                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23057                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23058                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 23059                                  ; Function:
 23060                                  ;	Make a new directory
 23061                                  ; Returns:
 23062                                  ;	Carry Clear
 23063                                  ;		No error
 23064                                  ;	Carry Set
 23065                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23066                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23067                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 23068                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 23069                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 23070                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23071                                  ;			Already exists, device name
 23072                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23073                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23074                                  
 23075                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 23076                                  
 23077                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23078                                  ; DOSCODE:6FC6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23079                                  
 23080                                  ; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23081                                  ; DOSCODE:78FFh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)

 23095                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory

 23097                                  			; CF clear if successful

 23695                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 23696                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 23697                                  
 23698                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 23699                                  ;
 23700                                  ;	SWAPCON
 23701                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 23702                                  ;	DOS_READ
 23703                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 23704                                  ;	get_io_sft
 23705                                  ;	DirRead
 23706                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 23707                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 23708                                  ;	FATSecRd
 23709                                  ;	DREAD
 23710                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 23711                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK
 23712                                  ;
 23713                                  ;	Revision history:
 23714                                  ;
 23715                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 23716                                  ;
 23717                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23718                                  ;
 23719                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 23720                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 23721                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 23722                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 23723                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 23724                                  ;
 23725                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23726                                  ;
 23727                                  
 23728                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 23729                                  
 23730                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 23731                                  
 23732                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 23733                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23734                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 23735                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 23736                                  ;
 23737                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 23738                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 23739                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23740                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23741                                  
 23742                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 3CF8h
 23743                                  
 23744                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23745                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23746                                  
 23747                                  ; DOSCODE:71CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23748                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23749                                  
 23750                                  SWAPBACK:
 23751 000039E4 C606[5703]00            	MOV	BYTE [CONSWAP],0	; signal no conswaps
 23752 000039E9 C3                      	retn
 23753                                  
 23754                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23755                                  ;
 23756                                  ; Procedure Name : SWAPCON
 23757                                  ;
 23758                                  ;   Copy ThisSFT to CONSFT for use by the 1-12 primitives.
 23759                                  ;
 23760                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT as the sft of the desired file
 23761                                  ;		DS is DOSDATA
 23762                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set.  CONSFT = ThisSFT.
 23763                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23764                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23765                                  
 23766                                  SWAPCON:
 23767                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 23768                                  	;push	es
 23769                                  	;push	di
 23770                                  	;mov	byte [CONSWAP],1
 23771                                  	;les	di,[THISSFT]
 23772                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT],di
 23773                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT+2],es
 23774                                  	;pop	di
 23775                                  	;pop	es
 23776                                  	;retn
 23777                                  
 23778                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23779 000039EA C606[5703]01            	mov	byte [CONSWAP],1	; ConSwap = TRUE
 23780 000039EF 50                      	push	ax
 23781 000039F0 A1[9E05]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT]
 23782 000039F3 A3[E605]                	mov	[CONSFT],ax
 23783 000039F6 A1[A005]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT+2]
 23784 000039F9 A3[E805]                	mov	[CONSFT+2],ax
 23785 000039FC 58                      	pop	ax
 23786 000039FD C3                      	retn
 23787                                  
 23788                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23789                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23790                                  
 23791                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 23792                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23793                                  ;
 23794                                  ; Inputs:
 23795                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 23796                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 23797                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 23798                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 23799                                  ; Function:
 23800                                  ;	Perform read operation
 23801                                  ; Outputs:
 23802                                  ;    Carry clear
 23803                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 23804                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 23805                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 23806                                  ;    Carry set
 23807                                  ;	AX is error code
 23808                                  ;	CX = 0
 23809                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 23810                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 23811                                  ;
 23812                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23813                                  
 23814                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is be set up.
 23815

 24015                                  ; We are going to do a cooked read on some character device. There is a
 24016                                  ; problem here, what does the data look like? Is it a terminal device, line

 24018                                  ; a ^Z at the end which is data, or is the ^Z not data?  In any event we're
 24019                                  ; going to do this: Read in pieces up to CR (CRs included in data) or ^z (^z
 24020                                  ; included in data). this "simulates" the way con works in cooked mode

 24356                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 24357                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24358                                  ;
 24359                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 24360                                  ;
 24361                                  ; Inputs:
 24362                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24363                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24364                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 24365                                  ; Function:
 24366                                  ;	Perform write operation
 24367                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 24368                                  ;		to current sf_position
 24369                                  ; Outputs:
 24370                                  ;    Carry clear
 24371                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24372                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 24373                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24374                                  ;    Carry set
 24375                                  ;	AX is error code
 24376                                  ;	CX = 0
 24377                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24378                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24379                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24380                                  	
 24381                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24382                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24383                                  
 24384                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24385                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24386                                  
 24387                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24388                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7D8Fh
 24389                                  
 24390                                  DOS_WRITE:
 24391 00003BFF C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24392                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 24393 00003C03 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 24394                                  	;;and	al,0Fh

 24402                                  BadMode:
 24403 00003C0D E96304                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 24404                                  
 24405                                  ; NOTE: The following check for writting to a Read Only File is performed
 24406                                  ;	    ONLY on FCBs!!!!
 24407                                  ;	We ALLOW writes to Read Only files via handles to allow a CREATE
 24408                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 24409                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 24410                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 24411                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 24412                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 24413                                  ;	    to a read-only file.
 24414                                  
 24415                                  Check_FCB_RO:
 24416                                  	;;test	word [es:di+2],8000h
 24417                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB
 24418                                  	;JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24419                                  	
 24420                                  	;test	byte [es:di+3],80h
 24421 00003C10 26F6450380              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode+1],(sf_isFCB>>8)
 24422 00003C15 7407                    	JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24423                                  
 24424                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],1

 24426 00003C1C 75EF                    	JNZ	short BadMode 		; Can't write to Read_Only files via FCB

 24431                                  
 24432                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 24433                                  ;	transfer NET_WRITE
 24434                                  ;ELSE
 24435                                  	;mov	ax,1109h
 24436 00003C26 B80911                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|9
 24437 00003C29 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - WRITE TO REMOTE FILE
 24438                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 24439                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 24440                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 24441                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes written
 24442 00003C2B C3                      	retn
 24443                                  ;ENDIF

 24685                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24686                                  ;
 24687                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 24688                                  ;
 24689                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 24690                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 24691                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 24692                                  ;
 24693                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24694                                  
 24695                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24696                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24697                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24698                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24699                                  
 24700                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 24701                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 24702 00003D50 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 24703 00003D56 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 24704                                  GetNormal:
 24705 00003D58 16                      	push	ss
 24706 00003D59 1F                      	pop	ds
 24707 00003D5A 06                      	PUSH	ES
 24708 00003D5B 57                      	PUSH	DI
 24709 00003D5C E8A535                  	call	SFFromHandle
 24710 00003D5F 7206                    	JC	short RET44P
 24711 00003D61 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 24712 00003D63 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 24713 00003D65 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 24714                                  RET44P:
 24715 00003D67 5F                      	POP	DI
 24716 00003D68 07                      	POP	ES
 24717 00003D69 C3                      	retn
 24718                                  GetRedir:
 24719 00003D6A 83FB01                  	CMP	BX,1
 24720 00003D6D 77E9                    	JA	short GetNormal
 24721 00003D6F 36C536[E605]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CONSFT]
 24722 00003D74 F8                      	CLC
 24723                                  get_io_sft_retn:
 24724 00003D75 C3                      	retn

 24726                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 24727                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24728                                  ;
 24729                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 24730                                  ;
 24731                                  ; Inputs:
 24732                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 24733                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 24734                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 24735                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 24736                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 24737                                  ; Function:
 24738                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 24739                                  ; Outputs:
 24740                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 24741                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 24742                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 24743                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 24744                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 24745                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 24746                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24747                                  
 24748                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 24749                                  
 24750                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24751                                  
 24752                                  DIRREAD:
 24753                                  
 24754                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 24755                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 24756                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 24757                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 24758                                  
 24759 00003D76 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 24760                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24761 00003D78 3916[DC0A]              	cmp	[DIRSTART_HW],dx
 24762 00003D7C 7509                    	jnz	short SubDir
 24763                                  	;CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 24764                                  	; 21/09/2023
 24765 00003D7E 3916[C205]              	cmp	[DIRSTART],dx ; 0
 24766 00003D82 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 24767 00003D84 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 24768 00003D85 EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 24769                                  
 24770                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 24771                                  
 24772                                  SubDir:
 24773 00003D87 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 24774                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 24775 00003D89 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 24776                                  
 24777                                  ;	(DX) = sector-in-cluster
 24778                                  
 24779                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 24780 00003D8D 268A4E05                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 24781 00003D91 D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 24782                                  
 24783                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 24784                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 24785                                  
 24786                                  DoRead:
 24787 00003D93 8816[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],DL
 24788 00003D97 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 24789 00003D99 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 24790                                  
 24791                                  ;	(CX) = number of clusters to skip.
 24792                                  ;	(AH) = remainder
 24793                                  
 24794                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24795                                  
 24796                                  ; 08/02/2024
 24797                                  %if 0
 24798                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24799                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC+2]	     	  ;>32mb
 24800                                  	;MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	  ;>32mb
 24801                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC]
 24802                                  	;ADD	DL,AH
 24803                                  	;ADC	DH,0
 24804                                  	;ADC	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	  ;>32mb
 24805                                  	; 21/09/2023
 24806                                  	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 24807                                  	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 24808                                  	add	dl,ah
 24809                                  	adc	dh,bl ; 0
 24810                                  	adc	bx,[DIRSEC+2]
 24811                                  	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],bx
 24812                                  
 24813                                  	MOV	BX,[CLUSNUM]
 24814                                  	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 24815                                  	JCXZ	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24816                                  %else
 24817                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24818 00003D9B 8B1E[DE0A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSNUM_HW]
 24819 00003D9F 891E[E00A]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM_HW],bx
 24820 00003DA3 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 24821 00003DA7 8B16[C005]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC+2]
 24822 00003DAB 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx
 24823 00003DAF 8B16[BE05]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 24824 00003DB3 00E2                    	add	dl,ah
 24825 00003DB5 80D600                  	adc	dh,0
 24826 00003DB8 8316[0706]00            	adc	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0
 24827 00003DBD 8B1E[BC05]              	mov	bx,[CLUSNUM]
 24828 00003DC1 891E[DC05]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM],bx
 24829 00003DC5 E339                    	jcxz	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24830                                  %endif
 24831                                  
 24832                                  SKPCLLP:
 24833 00003DC7 E86921                  	call	UNPACK
 24834 00003DCA 72A9                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 24835                                  	;;;
 24836                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24837 00003DCC FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 24838 00003DD0 8F06[F20A]              	pop	word [CLUSTERS_HW]
 24839 00003DD4 FF36[EC0A]              	push	word [CCONTENT_HW]
 24840 00003DD8 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 24841                                  	;;;
 24842 00003DDC 87FB                    	XCHG	BX,DI
 24843 00003DDE E82921                  	call	IsEOF			; test for eof based on fat size
 24844 00003DE1 7302                    	JAE	short HAVESKIPPED
 24845 00003DE3 E2E2                    	LOOP	SKPCLLP
 24846                                  HAVESKIPPED:
 24847 00003DE5 891E[DC05]              	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 24848                                  	;;;
 24849                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24850 00003DE9 8B1E[E80A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 24851 00003DED 891E[E00A]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM_HW],bx
 24852                                  	;
 24853 00003DF1 8B1E[F20A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTERS_HW]
 24854 00003DF5 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 24855                                  	;;;
 24856 00003DF9 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI
 24857 00003DFB 88E3                    	MOV	BL,AH
 24858 00003DFD E8FA17                  	call	FIGREC
 24859                                  
 24860                                  	;entry	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24861                                  
 24862                                  FIRSTCLUSTER:
 24863                                  	; 22/09/2023
 24864                                  	;;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 24865                                  	;MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL ; *
 24866                                  	;XOR	AL,AL ; *	; Indicate pre-read
 24867                                  	;call	GETBUFFR
 24868 00003E00 E87827                  	call	GETBUFFER ; *	; pre-read
 24869                                  	;jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 24870                                  	; 08/02/2024
 24871 00003E03 720C                    	jc	short dirread_retn
 24872

 24874                                  
 24875                                  SET_BUF_AS_DIR:
 24876                                  
 24877                                  ;	Set the type of CURBUF to be a directory sector.
 24878                                  ;	Only flags are modified.
 24879                                  
 24880 00003E05 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 24881 00003E06 56                      	PUSH	SI
 24882 00003E07 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 24883                                  	;or	byte [si+5],4
 24884 00003E0B 804C0504                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_isDIR	; Clears carry
 24885 00003E0F 5E                      	POP	SI
 24886 00003E10 1F                      	POP	DS
 24887                                  dirread_retn:

 24891                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24892                                  ;
 24893                                  ; Procedure Name : FATSECRD
 24894                                  ; Inputs:
 24895                                  ;	Same as DREAD
 24896                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 24897                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 24898                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number
 24899                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 24900                                  ; Function:
 24901                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform FAT read.
 24902                                  ; Outputs:
 24903                                  ;	Same as DREAD
 24904                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24905                                  
 24906                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24907                                  	; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24908

 24911                                  FATSECRD:
 24912                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24913                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],18h
 24914 00003E12 36C606[4B03]18          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL
 24915 00003E18 89CF                    	MOV	DI,CX
 24916                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+8]
 24917 00003E1A 268A4E08                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_COUNT]
 24918                                  	; MSDOS 3.3

 24924 00003E1E 268B460F                	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE] ;>32mb
 24925 00003E22 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH
 24926                                  	;;;

 24929 00003E26 7509                    	jnz	short FATSECRD_cont	; not FAT32
 24930                                  	;test	byte [es:bp+23h],80h

 24934 00003E2F B101                    	mov	cl,1

 24936 00003E31 36FF36[0706]            	push	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 24937                                  	;;;

 24991                                  ;Break	<DREAD -- DO A DISK READ>
 24992                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24993                                  ;
 24994                                  ; Procedure Name : DREAD
 24995                                  ;
 24996                                  ; Inputs:
 24997                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 24998                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 24999                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	      (LOW)
 25000                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25001                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25002                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case call to HARDERR needed
 25003                                  ; Function:
 25004                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk read. If BIOS reports
 25005                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25006                                  ; Outputs:
 25007                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILED to INT 24)
 25008                                  ; DS,ES:BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25009                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25010                                  
 25011                                  	;entry	DREAD
 25012                                  DREAD:
 25013 00003E75 E85200                  	call	DSKREAD
 25014 00003E78 7497                    	jz	short dirread_retn	; Carry clear
 25015                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25016 00003E7A 36C606[7505]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],0	; Read
 25017 00003E80 E89A00                  	call	HARDERRRW
 25018 00003E83 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 25019 00003E85 74EE                    	JZ	short DREAD
 25020                                  
 25021                                  fail_ignore:	; 09/02/2024
 25022 00003E87 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3			; Check for FAIL
 25023 00003E89 F8                      	CLC
 25024 00003E8A 7501                    	JNZ	short NO_CAR		; Ignore
 25025 00003E8C F9                      	STC
 25026                                  NO_CAR:

 25044                                  ;
 25045                                  ; Inputs:
