 25048                                  ; Function:
 25049                                  ;	check write lock

 25059                                  CHECK_WRITE_LOCK:
 25060                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25061                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],8
 25062 00003E95 26F6450408              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],attr_volume_id ;volume id
 25063                                  	;JZ	short write_cont			     ;no
 25064                                  	;;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25065                                  	;;retn

 25069                                  	;jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS

 25072                                  	;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25073                                  	;retn
 25074                                  	; 16/12/2022
 25075 00003E9C E9D201                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25076                                  
 25077                                  write_cont:				;
 25078 00003E9F 51                      	PUSH	CX			;save reg
 25079 00003EA0 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;
 25080 00003EA2 7501                    	JNZ	short Not_Truncate	;
 25081 00003EA4 49                      	dec	cx			;(cx) = -1; check for lock on whole file
 25082                                  Not_Truncate:				;
 25083 00003EA5 B080                    	MOV	AL,80H			;check write access
 25084 00003EA7 E86B41                  	call	LOCK_CHECK		;check lock
 25085 00003EAA 59                      	POP	CX			;restore reg
 25086 00003EAB 7305                    	JNC	short WRITE_OK		;lock ok
 25087 00003EAD E87301                  	call	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION	;issue I24
 25088 00003EB0 73ED                    	JNC	short write_cont	;retry
 25089                                  WRITE_OK:				;
 25090 00003EB2 C3                      	retn				;

 25139                                  ;	TITLE	DISK2 - Disk utility routines
 25140                                  ;	NAME	Disk2
 25141                                  
 25142                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 25143                                  ;
 25144                                  ;	DskRead
 25145                                  ;	DWRITE
 25146                                  ;	DSKWRITE
 25147                                  ;	HarderrRW
 25148                                  ;	SETUP
 25149                                  ;	BREAKDOWN
 25150                                  ;	READ_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25151                                  ;	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25152                                  ;	DISKREAD
 25153                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25154                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR
 25155                                  ;	SETSFT
 25156                                  ;	SETCLUS
 25157                                  ;	AddRec
 25158                                  ;
 25159                                  ;	Revision history:
 25160                                  ;
 25161                                  ;		AN000 version 4.00 Jan. 1988
 25162                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk read/write optimization
 25163                                  
 25164                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25165                                  ; DOSCODE:7699h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 25166                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25167                                  ; DOSCODE:7685h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 25168                                  
 25169                                  ;Break	<DSKREAD -- PHYSICAL DISK READ>
 25170                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25171                                  ;
 25172                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKREAD
 25173                                  ;
 25174                                  ; Inputs:
 25175                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25176                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25177                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25178                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25179                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25180                                  ; Function:
 25181                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25182                                  ; Outputs:
 25183                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25184                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25185                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25186                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25187                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 25188                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 25189                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25190                                  
 25191                                  DSKREAD:
 25192 00003ECA 51                      	PUSH	CX
 25193                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 25194 00003ECB 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 25195                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 25196 00003ECF 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 25197 00003ED3 53                      	PUSH	BX
 25198 00003ED4 06                      	PUSH	ES
 25199 00003ED5 E8CD10                  	call	SETREAD
 25200 00003ED8 EB22                    	JMP	short DODSKOP
 25201                                  
 25202                                  ;Break	<DWRITE -- SEE ABOUT WRITING>
 25203                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25204                                  ;
 25205                                  ; Procedure Name : DWRITE
 25206                                  ;
 25207                                  ; Inputs:
 25208                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25209                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25210                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25211                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25212                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25213                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case HARDERR called
 25214                                  ; Function:
 25215                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk write. If BIOS reports
 25216                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25217                                  ; Output:
 25218                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently, user FAILed to I 24)
 25219                                  ; BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25220                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25221                                  
 25222                                  	;entry	DWRITE
 25223                                  DWRITE:
 25224 00003EDA E81100                  	CALL	DSKWRITE
 25225 00003EDD 74EA                    	jz	short dw_ret_label	; Carry clear (retz)
 25226                                  
 25227                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25228 00003EDF 36C606[7505]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],1	; Write
 25229 00003EE5 E83500                  	call	HARDERRRW
 25230 00003EE8 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 25231 00003EEA 74EE                    	JZ	short DWRITE
 25232                                  
 25233                                  ; 09/02/2024
 25234                                  %if 0
 25235                                  	CMP	AL,3			; Check for FAIL
 25236                                  	CLC
 25237                                  	JNZ	short NO_CAR2 		; Ignore
 25238                                  	STC
 25239                                  NO_CAR2:
 25240                                  dw_ret_label:
 25241                                  	retn
 25242                                  %else
 25243                                  	; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 25244 00003EEC EB99                    	jmp	short fail_ignore
 25245                                  %endif
 25246                                  
 25247                                  ;Break	<DSKWRITE -- PHYSICAL DISK WRITE>
 25248                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25249                                  ;
 25250                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKWRITE
 25251                                  ;
 25252                                  ; Inputs:
 25253                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25254                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25255                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25256                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25257                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25258                                  ; Function:
 25259                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25260                                  ; Outputs:
 25261                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25262                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25263                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25264                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25265                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)

 25267                                  ;
 25268                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 25361                                  ;Break	<SETUP -- SETUP A DISK READ OR WRITE FROM USER>
 25362                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25363                                  ;
 25364                                  ; Procedure Name : SETUP
 25365                                  ;
 25366                                  ; Inputs:
 25367                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT (value also in THISSFT)
 25368                                  ;	DMAAdd contains transfer address
 25369                                  ;	CX = Byte count
 25370                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 25371                                  ;   WARNING Stack must be clean, two ret addrs on stack, 1st of caller,
 25372                                  ;		2nd of caller of caller.
 25373                                  ; Outputs:
 25374                                  ;	    CX = byte count
 25375                                  ;	    [THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters if file
 25376                                  ;		      = Pointer to device header if device or NET
 25377                                  ;	    ES:DI Points to SFT
 25378                                  ;	    [NEXTADD] = Displacement of disk transfer within segment
 25379                                  ;	    [TRANS] = 0 (No transfers yet)
 25380                                  ;	    BytPos = Byte position in file
 25381                                  ;
 25382                                  ;	The following fields are relevant to local files (not devices) only:
 25383                                  ;
 25384                                  ;	    SecPos = Position of first sector (local files only)
 25385                                  ;	    [BYTSECPOS] = Byte position in first sector (local files only)
 25386                                  ;	    [CLUSNUM] = First cluster (local files only)
 25387                                  ;	    [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector within first cluster (local files only)
 25388                                  ;	    [THISDRV] = Physical unit number (local files only)
 25389                                  ;
 25390                                  ;      RETURNS ONE LEVEL UP WITH:
 25391                                  ;	   CX = 0
 25392                                  ;	   CARRY = Clear
 25393                                  ;	IF AN ERROR IS DETECTED
 25394                                  ; All other registers destroyed
 25395                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 26122                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 26123                                  ;Break   <DskRdBufScan -- Disk Read Buffer Scan>
 26124                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26125                                  ;
 26126                                  ; Procedure Name : DskRdBufScan
 26127                                  ;
 26128                                  ; Inputs:
 26129                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
 26130                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 26131                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 26132                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
 26133                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 26134                                  ;
 26135                                  ; Function:
 26136                                  ;	The Buffer Queue is scanned: the contents of any dirty buffers are
 26137                                  ;	"read" into the transfer memory block, so that the transfer memory
 26138                                  ;	reflects the most recent data.
 26139                                  ;
 26140                                  ; Outputs:
 26141                                  ;       Transfer memory updated as required.
 26142                                  ;
 26143                                  ; Uses:
 26144                                  ;       DS,AX,BX,CX,SI,DI destroyed.
 26145                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 26146                                  ;
 26147                                  ; Notes:
 26148                                  ;       FIRST_BUFF_ADDR is set-up to contain the LAST buffer to check, rather
 26149                                  ;	than the FIRST.
 26150                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26151                                  ;M039: Created
 26152                                  
 26153                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26154                                  ; DOSCODE:78F0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 26155                                  
 26156                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26157                                  ; DOSCODE:78DCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 26158                                  
 26159                                  ; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26160                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8313h
 26161                                  
 26162                                  ;procedure DskRdBufScan,NEAR
 26163                                  ;
 26164                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 26165                                  
 26166                                  DskRdBufScan:
 26167 0000415C 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0 ; Any dirty buffers?
 26168 00004162 743C                    	je	short bufx		     ; -no, skip all work.
 26169                                  
 26170 00004164 368B1E[0706]            	mov     bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 26171 00004169 89DE                    	mov     si,bx
 26172 0000416B 01D1                    	add     cx,dx
 26173 0000416D 83D600                  	adc     si,0
 26174                                  
 26175 00004170 E89823                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> 1st buf in queue.
 26176                                  	;mov	ax,[di+2]
 26177 00004173 8B4502                  	mov     ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]
 26178 00004176 36A3[1711]              	mov     [ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],ax
 26179                                  		
 26180                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 26181                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 26182                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 26183                                  	; 15/12/2022
 26184 0000417A 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 26185                                  
 26186                                  ;       BX:DX = Extent start.
 26187                                  ;       SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 26188                                  ;          AL = Drive #.
 26189                                  ;       DS:DI-> 1st buffer in queue.
 26190                                  ;[FIRST_BUFF_ADDR] = Address offset of last buffer in queue.
 26191                                  
 26192                                  bufq:	
 26193                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 26194 0000417E 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 26195 00004181 7514                    	jne	short bufq1        	;  -no, jump.
 26196                                  
 26197                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26198                                  ;       ja	short bufq1		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 26199                                  
 26200                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 26201 00004183 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26202 00004186 7503                    	jne	short bufq01
 26203                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 26204 00004188 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26205                                  bufq01:
 26206 0000418B 770A                    	ja	short bufq1
 26207                                  
 26208                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26209                                  ;       ja	short bufq2		;Jump if Extent end >= buffer sector.
 26210                                  
 26211                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 26212 0000418D 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26213 00004190 7503                    	jne	short bufq02
 26214                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]

 27326                                  ;Break   <DskWrtBufPurge -- Disk Write Buffer Purge>
 27327                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27328                                  ;
 27329                                  ; Procedure Name : DskWrtBufPurge
 27330                                  ;
 27331                                  ; Inputs:
 27332                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
 27333                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 27334                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 27335                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 27336                                  ;
 27337                                  ; Function:
 27338                                  ;       Purge the Buffer Queue and the Secondary Cache of any buffers which
 27339                                  ;	are in Extent; they are being over-written.
 27340                                  ;
 27341                                  ; Outputs:
 27342                                  ;       (Same as Input.)
 27343                                  ; Uses:
 27344                                  ;       All registers except DS,AX,SI,DI preserved.
 27345                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 27346                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27347                                  ;M039: Created
 27348                                  
 27349                                  ;procedure   DskWrtBufPurge,NEAR
 27350                                  ;
 27351                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 27352                                  
 27353                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27354                                  ; DOSCODE:7C0Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27355                                  
 27356                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27357                                  ; DOSCODE:7BD4h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27358                                  
 27359                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27360                                  ; DOSCODE:8714h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27361                                  
 27362                                  ; NOTE: Secondary (Buffer) Cache is not used in PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27363                                  
 27364                                  ; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:BB93h)
 27365                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - DOSCODE:7C0Eh)
 27366                                  
 27367                                  DskWrtBufPurge:
 27368                                  	;SaveReg <bx,cx>
 27369 0000452C 53                      	push	bx
 27370 0000452D 51                      	push	cx
 27371                                  
 27372 0000452E 368B1E[0706]            	mov	bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]	;BX:DX = Extent start (sector #).
 27373 00004533 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 27374 00004535 01D1                    	add	cx,dx
 27375 00004537 83D600                  	adc	si,0                    ;SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27376                                  
 27377                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27378                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 27379                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 27380                                  	; 15/12/2022
 27381 0000453A 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 27382                                  
 27383                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27384                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27385                                  %if 0
 27386                                  
 27387                                  ;	BX:DX = Extent start.
 27388                                  ;	SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27389                                  ;	AL = Drive #
 27390                                  
 27391                                  	cmp	word [ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT],0 ;Secondary cache in-use?
 27392                                  	je	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27393                                  
 27394                                  ;	If any of the sectors to be written are in the secondary cache (SC),
 27395                                  ;	invalidate the entire SC. (This is an optimization; we really only
 27396                                  ;	need to invalidate those sectors which intersect, but that's slower.)
 27397                                  
 27398                                  	cmp	al,[ss:CurSC_DRIVE]	;Same drive?
 27399                                  	jne	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27400                                  
 27401                                  	push    ax
 27402                                  	mov     ax,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR]
 27403                                  	mov     di,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR+2]	;DI:AX = SC start.
 27404                                  
 27405                                  	;Cmp32	si,cx,di,ax		;Extent end < SC start?
 27406                                  	;jbe	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27407                                  
 27408                                  	cmp	si,di
 27409                                  	jne	short sc01
 27410                                  	cmp	cx,ax
 27411                                  sc01: 
 27412                                  	jbe	short sc5
 27413                                  
 27414                                  	add	ax,[ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT]
 27415                                  	adc	di,0                    ;DI:AX = SC end + 1.
 27416                                  	
 27417                                  	;Cmp32	bx,dx,di,ax             ;Extent start > SC end?
 27418                                  	;jae	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27419                                  
 27420                                  	cmp	bx,di
 27421                                  	jne	short sc02
 27422                                  	cmp	dx,ax
 27423                                  sc02:
 27424                                  	jnb	short sc5
 27425                                  
 27426                                  	mov	word [ss:SC_STATUS],0	;Extent intersects SC: invalidate SC.
 27427                                  sc5:	
 27428                                  	pop     ax
 27429                                  
 27430                                  %endif
 27431                                  
 27432                                  ;	Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
 27433                                  ;	written.
 27434                                  
 27435                                  nosc:	
 27436 0000453E E8CA1F                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> first buffer in queue.
 27437                                  
 27438                                  _bufq:	
 27439                                  	;cmpo	al,[di+4]
 27440 00004541 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 27441 00004544 7527                    	jne	short bufq5		; -no, jump.
 27442                                  
 27443                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27444                                  ;       ja	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 27445                                  
 27446                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 27447 00004546 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27448 00004549 7503                    	jne	short bufq04
 27449                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 27450 0000454B 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27451                                  bufq04:
 27452 0000454E 771D                    	ja	short bufq5
 27453                                  
 27454                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27455                                  ;       jbe	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent end < buffer sector.
 27456                                  
 27457                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 27458 00004550 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27459 00004553 7503                    	jne	short bufq05
 27460                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 27461 00004555 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27462                                  bufq05:
 27463 00004558 7613                    	jbe	short bufq5
 27464                                  
 27465                                  ;	Buffer's sector is in Extent, so free it; it is being over-written.
 27466                                  
 27467                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 27468 0000455A F6450540                	test	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ;Buffer dirty?
 27469 0000455E 7403                    	jz	short bufq4		; -no, jump.
 27470 00004560 E8BF22                  	call	DEC_DIRTY_COUNT		; -yes, decrement dirty count.
 27471                                  bufq4:
 27472                                  	;mov	word [di+4],20FFh
 27473 00004563 C74504FF20              	mov     word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],((buf_visit<<8)|0FFh)
 27474                                  
 27475 00004568 E8B21F                  	call	SCANPLACE
 27476 0000456B EB02                    	jmp     short bufq6
 27477                                  bufq5: 
 27478 0000456D 8B3D                    	mov     di,[di]
 27479                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 27480                                  bufq6: 
 27481 0000456F 363B3E[1711]            	cmp	di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 27482 00004574 75CB                    	jne	short _bufq		; --no, go do next buffer.
 27483                                  	
 27484                                  	;RestoreReg <cx,bx>
 27485 00004576 59                      	pop	cx
 27486 00004577 5B                      	pop	bx
 27487 00004578 C3                      	retn
 27488                                  
 27489                                  ;EndProc DskWrtBufPurge
 27490                                  
 27491                                  ;Break   <DIV32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT DIVIDE>
 27492                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27493                                  ;
 27494                                  ; Procedure Name : DIV32
 27495                                  ;
 27496                                  ; Inputs:
 27497                                  ;       DX:AX = 32 bit dividend   BX= divisor
 27498                                  ; Function:
 27499                                  ;       Perform 32 bit division:  DX:AX/BX = CX:AX + DX (rem.)
 27500                                  ; Outputs:
 27501                                  ;       CX:AX = quotient , DX= remainder
 27502                                  ; Uses:
 27503                                  ;       All registers except AX,CX,DX preserved.
 27504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27505                                  ;M039: DIV32 optimized for divisor of 512 (common sector size).
 27506                                  
 27507                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27508                                  ; DOSCODE:7C94h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27509                                  
 27510                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27511                                  ; DOSCODE:7C5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27512                                  
 27513                                  DIV32:
 27514 00004579 81FB0002                	cmp	bx,512
 27515 0000457D 7515                    	jne	short div5
 27516                                  
 27517 0000457F 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 27518 00004581 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax           ; CX:AX = Dividend
 27519 00004583 81E2FF01                	and	dx,(512-1)      ; DX = Remainder
 27520 00004587 88E0                    	mov	al,ah
 27521 00004589 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 27522 0000458B 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch
 27523 0000458D 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 27524 0000458F D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 27525 00004591 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 27526 00004593 C3                      	retn
 27527                                  div5:	
 27528 00004594 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 27529 00004596 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 27530 00004598 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27531 0000459A F7F3                    	div	bx              ; 0:AX/BX
 27532 0000459C 91                      	xchg	cx,ax
 27533 0000459D F7F3                    	div	bx              ; DX:AX/BX
 27534 0000459F C3                      	retn
 27535                                  
 27536                                  ;Break   <SHR32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT SHIFT RIGHT>
 27537                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27538                                  ;
 27539                                  ; Procedure Name : SHR32
 27540                                  ;
 27541                                  ; Inputs:
 27542                                  ;	DX:AX = 32 bit sector number
 27543                                  ; Function:
 27544                                  ;       Perform 32 bit shift right
 27545                                  ; Outputs:
 27546                                  ;	AX = cluster number
 27547                                  ;	ZF = 1 if no error
 27548                                  ;	   = 0 if error (cluster number > 64k)
 27549                                  ; Uses:
 27550                                  ;       DX,CX
 27551                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27552                                  ; M017	- SHR32 rewritten for better performance
 27553                                  ; M039	- Additional optimization
 27554                                  
 27555                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27556                                  ; DOSCODE:7CBBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27557                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27558                                  ; DOSCODE:7C81h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27559                                  
 27560                                  SHR32:
 27561                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 27562 000045A0 268A4E05                	mov	cl,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 27563 000045A4 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch	    ;ZF=1
 27564 000045A6 E306                    	jcxz	norota
 27565                                  rotashft2:
 27566 000045A8 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1	    ;ZF reflects state of DX.
 27567 000045AA D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1	    ;ZF not affected.
 27568 000045AC E2FA                    	loop	rotashft2
 27569                                  norota:
 27570 000045AE C3                      	retn
 27571                                  
 27572                                  ;============================================================================
 27573                                  ; DIR.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 27574                                  ;============================================================================
 27575                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27576                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27577                                  
 27578                                  ;	TITLE	DIR - Directory and path cracking
 27579                                  ;	NAME	Dir
 27580                                  
 27581                                  ;Break	<FINDENTRY -- LOOK FOR AN ENTRY>
 27582                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27583                                  ;
 27584                                  ; Procedure Name : FINDENTRY,SEARCH
 27585                                  ;
 27586                                  ; Inputs:
 27587                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 27588                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 27589                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Starting directory sector number
 27590                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster of directory
 27591                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 27592                                  ;	[NAME1] = Name to look for
 27593                                  ; Function:
 27594                                  ;	Find file name in disk directory.
 27595                                  ;	"?" matches any character.
 27596                                  ; Outputs:
 27597                                  ;	Carry set if name not found
 27598                                  ;	ELSE
 27599                                  ;	Zero set if attributes match (always except when creating)
 27600                                  ;	AH = Device ID (bit 7 set if not disk)
 27601                                  ;	[THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters
 27602                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 27603                                  ;	ES = DOSGROUP
 27604                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer into directory buffer
 27605                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI = Pointer to First Cluster field in directory entry
 27606                                  ;	[CURBUF] has directory record with match
 27607                                  ;	[NAME1] has file name
 27608                                  ;	[LASTENT] is entry number of the entry
 27609                                  ; All other registers destroyed.
 27610                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27611                                  
 27612                                  ;hkn; called from rename.asm and dir2.asm. DS must be already set up at
 27613                                  ;hkn; this point.
 27614                                  
 27615                                  SEARCH:
 27616                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27617                                  	; DOSCODE:7C90h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27618                                  
 27619                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27620                                  	; DOSCODE:7CCAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27621                                  
 27622                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27623                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 45B3h
 27624                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 27625                                  
 27626                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27627                                  
 27628                                  	; 13/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27629                                  	; DOSCODE:8797h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27630                                  
 27631                                  	;entry	FindEntry
 27632                                  FINDENTRY:
 27633 000045AF E8D405                  	call	STARTSRCH
 27634 000045B2 A0[6B05]                	MOV	AL,[ATTRIB]
 27635                                  	;and	al,9Eh
 27636 000045B5 24DE                    	AND	AL,~attr_ignore		; Ignore useless bits
 27637                                  	;cmp	al,8
 27638 000045B7 3C08                    	CMP	AL,attr_volume_id	; Looking for vol ID only ?
 27639 000045B9 7503                    	JNZ	short NOTVOLSRCH	; No
 27640 000045BB E83402                  	CALL	SETROOTSRCH		; Yes force search of root
 27641                                  NOTVOLSRCH:
 27642 000045BE E84C01                  	CALL	GETENTRY
 27643                                  	;JNC	short SRCH

 27816                                  ;
 27817                                  ; Procedure Name : MetaCompare
 27818                                  ;
 27819                                  ; Inputs:
 27820                                  ;	DS:SI -> 11 character FCB style name NO '?'
 27821                                  ;	    Typically this is a directory entry. It MUST be in upper case
 27822                                  ;	ES:DI -> 11 character FCB style name with possible '?'
 27823                                  ;	    Typically this is a FCB or SFT. It MUST be in upper case
 27824                                  ; Function:
 27825                                  ;	Compare FCB style names allowing for ? match to any char
 27826                                  ; Outputs:
 27827                                  ;	Zero if match else NZ
 27828                                  ; Destroys CX,SI,DI all others preserved
 27829                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27830                                  
 27831                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27832                                  	; DOSCODE:7D3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27833                                  
 27834                                  MetaCompare:
 27835 00004687 B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 27836                                  WILDCRD:
 27837 0000468A F3A6                    	REPE	CMPSB
 27838 0000468C 7407                    	JZ	short MetaRet 		; most of the time we will fail.
 27839                                  CHECK_META:
 27840 0000468E 26807DFF3F              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1],"?"
 27841 00004693 74F5                    	JZ	short WILDCRD
 27842                                  MetaRet:
 27843 00004695 C3                       	retn				; Zero set, Match

 27904 000046C7 7223                    	JB	short SAMECLUS

 27988                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27989                                  ;
 27990                                  ; Procedure Name : GETENTRY
 27991                                  ;
 27992                                  ; Inputs:
 27993                                  ;	[LASTENT] has directory entry
 27994                                  ;	ES:BP points to drive parameters
 27995                                  ;	[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[ENTLAST] set for DIR involved
 27996                                  ; Function:
 27997                                  ;	Locates directory entry in preparation for search
 27998                                  ;	GETENT provides entry for passing desired entry in AX
 27999                                  ; Outputs:
 28000                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer to next directory entry in CURBUF
 28001                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:DX = Pointer to first byte after end of CURBUF
 28002                                  ;	[LASTENT] = New directory entry number
 28003                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS] set via DIRREAD
 28004                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28005                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28006                                  
 28007                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28008                                  GETENTRY:
 28009                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28010 0000470D A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 28011                                  
 28012                                  	;entry	GETENT
 28013                                  GETENT:
 28014 00004710 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 28015                                  ;
 28016                                  ; Convert the entry number in AX into a byte offset from the beginning of the
 28017                                  ; directory.
 28018                                  ;
 28019 00004713 B105                    	mov	cl,5			; shift left by 5 = mult by 32
 28020 00004715 D3C0                    	rol	ax,cl			; keep hight order bits
 28021 00004717 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 28022                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28023                                  	;and	ax,0FFE0h
 28024                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28025                                  	;and	ax,~(32-1)		; mask off high order bits
 28026                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28027 00004719 24E0                    	and	al,0E0h ; ~31
 28028 0000471B 83E21F                  	and	dx,1Fh
 28029                                  	;and	dx,32-1			; mask off low order bits
 28030                                  ;
 28031                                  ; DX:AX contain the byte offset of the required directory entry from the
 28032                                  ; beginning of the directory. Convert this to a sector number. Round the
 28033                                  ; sector size down to a multiple of 32.
 28034                                  ;
 28035                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 28036 0000471E 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 28037 00004722 80E3E0                  	and	bl,0E0h
 28038                                  	;AND	BL,255-31		; Must be multiple of 32
 28039 00004725 F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 28040                                  	; 14/02/2024
 28041                                  	;MOV	BX,DX			; Position within sector
 28042                                  				; NOTE: This BX value is not used in DIRREAD
 28043                                  				; Erdogan Tan - 14/02/2024
 28044                                  	;PUSH	BX
 28045 00004727 52                      	push	dx
 28046                                  	;
 28047 00004728 E84BF6                  	call	DIRREAD
 28048 0000472B 5B                      	POP	BX
 28049                                  	;retc
 28050 0000472C 72BD                    	jc	short nextentry_retn
 28051                                  SETENTRY:
 28052 0000472E 8B16[E205]              	MOV	DX,[CURBUF]
 28053                                  	;;;add	dx,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28054                                  	;;add	dx,20 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 28055                                  	;add	dx,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 14/02/2024	
 28056 00004732 83C218                  	ADD	DX,BUFINSIZ
 28057 00004735 01D3                    	ADD	BX,DX
 28058                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+2]
 28059 00004737 26035602                	ADD	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; Always clears carry
 28060                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28061                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS contains a 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:7E15h
 28062                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28063                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM contains 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:8931h
 28064 0000473B F8                      	clc
 28065 0000473C C3                      	retn
 28066                                  
 28067                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28068                                  
 28069                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28070                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8933h
 28071                                  
 28072                                  sft_fcb_table:
 28073 0000473D 00<rep 14h>             	times 20 db 0
 28074                                  sftfcb.cluster:
 28075 00004751 00000000                	dd	0
 28076                                  sftfcb.direntry:
 28077 00004755 0000                    	dw	0
 28078                                  sftfcb_entry_size equ $ - sftfcb.cluster ; = 6
 28079                                  
 28080 00004757 00<rep 72h>             	times 114 db 0	; 6*20 = 120 ; entry size = 6 bytes 
 28081                                  
 28082                                  SRCH_CLUSTER:
 28083 000047C9 0000                    	dw	0
 28084                                  SRCH_CLUSTER_HW:
 28085 000047CB 0000                    	dw	0

 28089                                  ;Break	<SETDIRSRCH SETROOTSRCH -- Set Search environments>
 28090                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28091                                  ;
 28092                                  ; Procedure Name : SETDIRSRCH,SETROOTSRCH
 28093                                  ;
 28094                                  ; Inputs:
 28095                                  ;	BX cluster number of start of directory
 28096                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28097                                  ;	DI next cluster number from fastopen extended info. DOS 3.3 only
 28098                                  ; Function:
 28099                                  ;	Set up a directory search
 28100                                  ; Outputs:
 28101                                  ;	[DIRSTART] = BX
 28102                                  ;	[CLUSFAC],[CLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC] set
 28103                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28104                                  ; destroys AX,DX,BX
 28105                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28106                                  
 28107                                  	;;;
 28108                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28109                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:89C3h
 28110                                  	;;;
 28111                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 28112 000047CD A1[EE0A]                	mov	ax,[ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28113                                  	;cmp	word [ROOTCLUST_HW],0
 28114 000047D0 21C0                    	and	ax,ax	
 28115 000047D2 7504                    	jnz	short SETDIRSRCH_FAT32
 28116                                  	
 28117 000047D4 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 28118                                  	;jz	short SETROOTSRCH
 28119 000047D6 741C                    	jz	short SETROOTSRCH2 ; ax = 0
 28120                                  SETDIRSRCH_FAT32:
 28121                                  	;mov	ax,[ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28122 000047D8 A3[DC0A]                	mov	[DIRSTART_HW],ax
 28123 000047DB A3[E80A]                	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],ax
 28124

 28360 000048F6 07                      	pop	es

 28385                                  				; and used only for FCB calls

 28464                                  ;============================================================================
 28465                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28466                                  ;============================================================================
 28467                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28468                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28469                                  ; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28470                                  
 28471                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 28472                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 28473                                  
 28474                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28475                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28476                                  ;
 28477                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28478                                  ;
 28479                                  ; Inputs:
 28480                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28481                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28482                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28483                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28484                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28485                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28486                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28487                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28488                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28489                                  ; Function:
 28490                                  ;	Crack the path
 28491                                  ; Outputs:
 28492                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28493                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28494                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28495                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28496                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28497                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28498                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28499                                  ;	   Zero set
 28500                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28501                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28502                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28503                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28504                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28505                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28506                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28507                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28508                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28509                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28510                                  ;	ELSE
 28511                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28512                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28513                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28514                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28515                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28516                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28517                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28518                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28519                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28520                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28521                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28522                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28523                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28524                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28525                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28526                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28527                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28528                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28529                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28530                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28531                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28532                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28533                                  
 28534                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28535                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28536                                  
 28537                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28538                                  
 28539                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28540                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8B99h
 28541                                  
 28542                                  GETPATH:
 28543                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28544 0000497A C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28545                                  
 28546                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28547                                  
 28548                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28549                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28550                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 28551                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28552                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28553 00004980 E854C9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 28554                                  	;
 28555 00004983 C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28556                                  
 28557                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28558                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28559                                  
 28560 00004989 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28561                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28562                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28563 0000498D 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'

 28825                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 28826                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28827                                  ;
 28828                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 28829                                  ;
 28830                                  ; Inputs:
 28831                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 28832                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 28833                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 28834                                  ; Function:
 28835                                  ;	Search from root for path
 28836                                  ; Outputs:
 28837                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 28838                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 28839                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 28840                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28841                                  
 28842                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28843                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28844                                  
 28845                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28846                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8C9Dh
 28847                                  
 28848                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:7F82h)
 28849                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:829Eh)
 28850                                  
 28851                                  ROOTPATH:
 28852 00004A37 E8B8FD                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 28853                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28854 00004A3A 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 28855                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 28856 00004A3C 3824                    	cmp	[si],ah ; 0
 28857 00004A3E 7507                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 28858                                  
 28859                                  	;;;
 28860                                  	;; 15/02/2024
 28861                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:82A6h
 28862                                  	;mov	word [CURBUF],0FFFFh
 28863                                  	;;;
 28864                                  
 28865                                  ; Root dir specified
 28866 00004A40 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28867 00004A43 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28868                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28869                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 28870                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 28871 00004A46 C3                      	retn
 28872                                  
 28873                                  ; Inputs:
 28874                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 28875                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 28876                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28877                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 28878                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 28879                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 28880                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 28881                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 28882                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28883                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28884                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28885                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28886                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28887                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 28888                                  ; Function:
 28889                                  ;	Parse path name
 28890                                  ; Outputs:
 28891                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28892                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28893                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28894                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 28895                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28896                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28897                                  ;	   Zero set
 28898                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28899                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28900                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28901                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28902                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28903                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28904                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28905                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28906                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 28907                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28908                                  ;	ELSE
 28909                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28910                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28911                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 28912                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28913                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28914                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28915                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28916                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28917                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28918                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28919                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 28920                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28921                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28922                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28923                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28924                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28925                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28926                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28927                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28928                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 28929                                  
 28930                                  	; 11/05/2025 (MiniDOS v1.0)
 28931                                  
 28932                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28933                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28934                                  
 28935                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28936                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8CAEh
 28937                                  
 28938                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 28939                                  FINDPATH:
 28940 00004A47 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 28941 00004A48 56                      	PUSH	SI
 28942                                  	; 11/05/2025
 28943                                  	;MOV	DI,SI
 28944 00004A49 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 28945 00004A4D 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 28946 00004A52 7415                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 28947                                  	;CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28948                                  	; 11/05/2025
 28949 00004A54 3B36[B605]              	cmp	si,[CURR_DIR_END] 
 28950 00004A58 750F                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 28951 00004A5A C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28952                                  	;;;
 28953                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28954 00004A5E A1[DC0A]                	mov	ax,[DIRSTART_HW]
 28955                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 28956 00004A61 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax
 28957                                  	;;;
 28958                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 28959 00004A65 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory cluster
 28960                                  NOIDS:
 28961                                  
 28962                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 28963                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 28964                                  ;
 28965                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 28966                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 28967                                  ;
 28968                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 28969                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 28970                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 28971                                  
 28972                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 28973                                  	;MOV	ES,AX
 28974                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28975 00004A69 16                      	push	ss
 28976 00004A6A 07                      	pop	es
 28977                                  
 28978                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28979 00004A6B BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28980                                  	;MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 28981                                  	;STOSB
 28982                                  	;STOSW
 28983                                  	;STOSW
 28984                                  	;STOSW
 28985                                  	;STOSW
 28986                                  	;STOSW
 28987                                  	; 11/05/2025 (MiniDOS)
 28988 00004A6E B020                    	mov	al, ' ' ; 20h
 28989 00004A70 B90B00                  	mov	cx, 11
 28990 00004A73 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 28991                                  
 28992                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28993 00004A75 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28994                                  	; 11/05/2025
 28995                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 28996                                  GetNam:
 28997                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28998                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 28999                                  
 29000                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29001                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29002                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !
 29003                                  	
 29004 00004A78 AC                      	LODSB
 29005 00004A79 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 29006 00004A7B 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 29007 00004A7D 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29008 00004A7F 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29009 00004A81 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 29010 00004A83 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29011 00004A85 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 29012 00004A87 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 29013                                  	;OR	AH,1
 29014                                  	; 11/05/2025
 29015 00004A89 80C901                  	or	cl, 1
 29016                                  StoNam: 
 29017 00004A8C AA                      	STOSB
 29018 00004A8D EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 29019                                  _SetExt:
 29020 00004A8F BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 29021                                  GetExt:
 29022 00004A92 AC                      	LODSB
 29023 00004A93 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29024 00004A95 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29025 00004A97 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 29026 00004A99 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29027 00004A9B 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 29028 00004A9D 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 29029                                  	;OR	AH,1
 29030                                  	; 11/05/2025
 29031 00004A9F 80C901                  	or	cl, 1
 29032                                  StoExt: 
 29033 00004AA2 AA                      	STOSB
 29034 00004AA3 EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 29035                                  _GetDone:
 29036 00004AA5 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29037                                  	; 11/05/2025
 29038                                  	;MOV	CL,AH  ; 0 or 1 ; 29/12/2022
 29039 00004AA6 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 29040 00004AA9 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 29041 00004AAA 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29042 00004AAB 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 29043 00004AAD 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 29044 00004AAF E9B500                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 29045                                  check_device:
 29046 00004AB2 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element

 29325                                  ; Procedure Name : STARTSRCH
 29326                                  ;
 29327                                  ; Inputs:

 29347                                  ;BREAK <MatchAttributes - the final check for attribute matching>
 29348                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29349                                  ; Procedure Name : MatchAttributes
 29350                                  ;
 29351                                  ; Input:    [Attrib] = attribute to search for
 29352                                  ;	    CH = found attribute
 29353                                  ; Output:   JZ <match>
 29354                                  ;	    JNZ <nomatch>
 29355                                  ; Registers modified: noneski

 29358                                  MatchAttributes:

 29363 00004B9F F6D0                    	NOT	AL			; AL <- SearchSet'
 29364 00004BA1 20E8                    	AND	AL,CH			; AL <- SearchSet' and FoundSet
 29365                                  	;and	al,16h
 29366 00004BA3 2416                    	AND	AL,attr_all	; AL <- SearchSet' and FoundSet and Important
 29367                                  ;
 29368                                  ; the result is non-zero if an attribute is not in the search set
 29369                                  ; and in the found set and in the important set. This means that we do not
 29370                                  ; have a match. Do a JNZ <nomatch> or JZ <match>
 29371                                  ;
 29372 00004BA5 58                      	POP	AX
 29373 00004BA6 C3                      	retn

 29387                                  ;Break <DevName - Look for name of device>

 29389                                  ;
 29390                                  ; Procedure Name : DevName
 29391                                  ;
 29392                                  ; Inputs:
 29393                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA
 29394                                  ;	Filename in NAME1
 29395                                  ;	ATTRIB set so that we can error out if looking for Volume IDs
 29396                                  ; Function:
 29397                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 29398                                  ; Outputs:
 29399                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 29400                                  ;	ELSE
 29401                                  ;	Zero flag set
 29402                                  ;	BH = Bit 7,6 = 1, bit 5 = 0 (cooked mode)
 29403                                  ;	     bits 0-4 set from low byte of attribute word

 29406                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29407

 29415 00004BAA 50                      	PUSH	AX

 29420 00004BB4 7505                    	JNZ	short NOKTR

 29435 00004BC5 F6440580                	test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVTYP>>8)
 29436                                  	;;test	word [si+4],8000h
 29437                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVTYP
 29438 00004BC9 7410                    	JZ	short SKIPDEV 		; Skip block devices (NET and LOCAL)
 29439 00004BCB 89F0                    	MOV	AX,SI
 29440                                  	;add	si,10
 29441 00004BCD 83C60A                  	ADD	SI,SYSDEV.NAME

 29444 00004BD0 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1

 29479                                  ;BREAK <Build_device_ent - Make a Directory entry>
 29480                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29481                                  ; Procedure Name : Build_device_ent
 29482                                  ;
 29483                                  ; Inputs:
 29484                                  ;	[NAME1] has name
 29485                                  ;	BH is attribute field (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29486                                  ;	[DEVPT] points to device header (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29487                                  ; Function:
 29488                                  ;	Build a directory entry for a device at DEVFCB
 29489                                  ; Outputs:
 29490                                  ;	BX points to DEVFCB
 29491                                  ;	SI points to dir_first field
 29492                                  ;	AH = input BH
 29493                                  ;	AL = 0
 29494                                  ;	dir_first = DEVPT
 29495                                  ;	Zero Set, Carry Clear
 29496                                  ; DS,ES,BP preserved, others destroyed
 29497                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29498

 29504

 29506

 29511

 29513

 29531                                  
 29532                                  ; Fill dir_date

 29557                                  ;   media. If media has been changed, do DOS_Chdir to validate path.
