 33046                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33047                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33048                                  
 33049                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33050                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset
 33051                                  
 33052                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 33053                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33054                                  ;
 33055                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 33056                                  ;
 33057                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 33058                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 33059                                  ;
 33060                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 33061                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 33062                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 33063                                  ;
 33064                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 33065                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 33066                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 33067                                  ;
 33068                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 33069                                  ;
 33070                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 33071                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 33072                                  ;           ELSE
 33073                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 33074                                  ;
 33075                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 33076                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 33077                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 33078                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 33079                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 33080                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 33081                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 33082                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 33083                                  ;   allocated.
 33084                                  ;
 33085                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 33086                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 33087                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 33088                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 33089                                  ;
 33090                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33091                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33092                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33093                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 33094                                  ;   explanation:
 33095                                  ;
 33096                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 33097                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 33098                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 33099                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 33100                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 33101                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 33102                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 33103                                  ;   the
 33104                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 33105                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 33106                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 33107                                  ;
 33108                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 33109                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 33110                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 33111                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 33112                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 33113                                  ;
 33114                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33115                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33116                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33117                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 33118                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 33119                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33120                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 33121                                  ;
 33122                                  ;       EXIT   'C' set if insufficient space
 33123                                  ;                [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 33124                                  ;                CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 33125                                  ;              'C' clear if space allocated
 33126                                  ;                BX = First cluster allocated
 33127                                  ;                FAT is fully updated
 33128                                  ;                sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 33129                                  ;
 33130                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 33131                                  
 33132                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 33133                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 33134                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 33135                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 33136                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 33137                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 33138                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 33139                                  ;callmagic  endp
 33140                                  
 33141                                  ; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33142                                  ;PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9AC5h
 33143                                  
 33144                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC2h)
 33145                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C078h)
 33146                                  
 33147                                  ; 07/03/2025
 33148                                  ; 25/09/2023
 33149                                  %if 0	; 27/02/2024
 33150                                  callmagic:
 33151                                  	push	ds
 33152                                  	push	word [ss:OffsetMagicPatch]
 33153                                  	retf	
 33154                                  %endif
 33155

 33157                                  %if 1
 33158                                  ALLOCATE_X:
 33159 00005632 A3[F00A]                	mov	[CCOUNT_HW],ax
 33160                                  	;jmp	short ALLOCATE
 33161                                  %endif

 33164                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9ACFh
 33165                                  
 33166                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC9h)
 33167                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C07Fh)
 33168

 33765                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 33766                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33767                                  ;
 33768                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 33769                                  ;
 33770                                  ; Inputs:
 33771                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 33772                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33773                                  ; Function:
 33774                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 33775                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33776                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 33777                                  ;
 33778                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33779                                  
 33780                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33781                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D13h
 33782                                  
 33783                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E86h)
 33784                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C27Fh)
 33785                                  
 33786                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33787                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33788                                  RELEASE:
 33789 00005822 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 33790                                  	
 33791                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33792                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33793                                  	;;;
 33794 00005824 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx ; (dx = 0, release)
 33795                                  	;;;
 33796                                  
 33797                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D19h
 33798                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E88h)
 33799                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C285h)
 33800                                  
 33801                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 33802                                  RELBLKS:
 33803                                  
 33804                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 33805                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 33806                                  
 33807 00005828 E80807                  	call	UNPACK
 33808                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33809                                  	;jz	short RELEASE_flush
 33810                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33811 0000582B 7652                            jbe	short RET12 ; jna short RET12
 33812                                  				; CCONTENT_HW:DI= Content of FAT
 33813                                   				; for given cluster (next cluster)
 33814 0000582D 89F8                    	MOV     AX,DI
 33815 0000582F 52                              PUSH    DX
 33816                                  
 33817                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33818                                  	;push	ax
 33819                                  	;;;
 33820                                  
 33821 00005830 E8AF07                  	call	PACK
 33822                                  
 33823                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33824                                  	;pop	ax
 33825 00005833 8B16[EC0A]              	mov	dx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33826 00005837 8916[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx ; next cluster (hw) to be released
 33827 0000583B 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax		 ; next cluster (lw) to be released
 33828                                  	;;;
 33829                                          
 33830 0000583D 5A                      	POP     DX
 33831                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 33832                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33833 0000583E 723F                    	jc	short RET12
 33834                                          
 33835 00005840 09D2                    	OR      DX,DX
 33836 00005842 751F                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 33837                                  
 33838                                  ; 28/02/2024
 33839                                  %if 0
 33840                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 33841                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 33842                                  	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 33843                                          JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 33844                                          INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33845                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33846                                          MOV     BX,AX
 33847                                          dec     ax              	; check for "1"
 33848                                  	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33849                                  %else
 33850                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33851                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33852                                  	;;;
 33853 00005844 3B16[EA0A]              	cmp	dx,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; > 0 ? (delete, release)
 33854 00005848 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC	; no, EOF (allocate, -1), (dx = 0)
 33855                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 33856 0000584A 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 33857                                  					; Free count valid?
 33858 0000584F 7412                    	jz	short NO_DEALLOC	; No (dx = 0)
 33859                                  relblks_ifc:
 33860                                  	;inc	word ptr es:[bp+1Fh]
 33861 00005851 26FF461F                	inc	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 33862 00005855 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2
 33863                                  
 33864                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 33865 00005857 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx
 33866 0000585B 7513                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2	; not FAT32
 33867                                  
 33868                                  	;inc	word [es:bp+21h]
 33869 0000585D 26FF4621                	inc	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 33870 00005861 EB0D                    	jmp	short NO_DEALLOC2
 33871                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 33872                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 33873 00005863 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx	; dx is -1 or 0
 33874                                  					; (valid 16 bit fat size is another number)
 33875 00005867 7507                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2 ; FAT (FAT16 or FAT12)
 33876                                  					; dx = 0, FAT32
 33877                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 33878 00005869 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2],0FFFFh
 33879 0000586E 75E1                    	jnz	short relblks_ifc
 33880                                  NO_DEALLOC2:
 33881 00005870 833E[E80A]00            	cmp	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 33882 00005875 7503                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC3
 33883 00005877 48                      	dec	ax			; check for "1"	
 33884 00005878 7405                    	jz	short RET12		; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 33885                                  NO_DEALLOC3:
 33886                                  	;;;
 33887                                  %endif
 33888                                  
 33889 0000587A E88D06                  	call	IsEOF
 33890 0000587D 72A3                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 33891                                  
 33892                                  	; 16/12/2022
 33893                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 33894                                  ; 28/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33895                                  %if 0
 33896                                  RELEASE_flush:
 33897                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 33898                                  	mov	al,[es:bp]
 33899                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 33900                                  	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 33901                                  	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 33902                                  	push	es
 33903                                  	push	bp
 33904                                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 33905                                  	pop	bp
 33906                                  	pop	es
 33907                                  	pop	cx
 33908                                  	pop	si
 33909                                  %endif		; 28/02/2024
 33910                                  
 33911                                  RET12:
 33912 0000587F C3                      	retn
 33913                                  
 33914                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 33915                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33916                                  ;
 33917                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 33918                                  ;
 33919                                  ; Inputs:
 33920                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 33921                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 33922                                  ;       DS = CS
 33923                                  ; Outputs:
 33924                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 33925                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 33926                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 33927                                  ;
 33928                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33929                                  
 33930                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33931                                  %if 0
 33932                                  GETEOF:
 33933                                  	call	UNPACK
 33934                                          jc	short RET12
 33935                                          PUSH    BX
 33936                                          MOV     BX,DI
 33937                                  	call	IsEOF
 33938                                          POP     BX
 33939                                          JAE     short RET12
 33940                                          MOV     BX,DI
 33941                                          JMP     short GETEOF
 33942                                  %else
 33943                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33944                                  	;;;
 33945                                  GETEOF4:	; **
 33946 00005880 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33947                                  GETEOF1:
 33948 00005884 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 33949 00005886 8916[F20A]              	mov	[CLUSTERS_HW],dx ; CLUSTERS_HW:DI = Cluster Count
 33950 0000588A 58                      	pop	ax
 33951 0000588B 5A                      	pop	dx
 33952 0000588C C3                      	retn
 33953                                  
 33954                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D7Ch
 33955                                  GETEOF:
 33956 0000588D 52                      	push	dx
 33957 0000588E 50                      	push	ax
 33958 0000588F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0	; cluster count = 0
 33959 00005891 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 33960                                  GETEOF2:
 33961 00005893 E89D06                  	call	UNPACK
 33962 00005896 72EC                    	jc	short GETEOF1
 33963                                  		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = next cluster (cluster content)
 33964 00005898 40                      	inc	ax
 33965 00005899 7501                    	jnz	short GETEOF3
 33966 0000589B 42                      	inc	dx
 33967                                  GETEOF3:
 33968 0000589C FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33969 000058A0 53                      	push    bx
 33970                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33971 000058A1 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33972 000058A5 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33973 000058A9 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 33974 000058AB E85C06                  	call	IsEOF
 33975                                  	;pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 33976 000058AE 5B                      	pop	bx
 33977                                  	;jae	short GETEOF1   ; EOF
 33978 000058AF 73CF                    	jae	short GETEOF4 ; ** ; 28/02/2024
 33979                                  	;mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW] ; not EOF
 33980                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33981 000058B1 5B                      	pop	bx	; * ; 28/02/2024
 33982 000058B2 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 33983 000058B4 EBDD                    	jmp	short GETEOF2   ; get next cluster
 33984                                  	;;;
 33985                                  %endif

 34025                                  ;
 34026                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 34027                                  ;
 34028                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34029                                  
 34030                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34031                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34032                                  
 34033                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34034                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9DB0h
 34035                                  
 34036                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8ED3h)
 34037                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8D92h)
 34038                                  
 34039                                  MAKEFCB:
 34040                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34041                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 34042 000058B6 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 34043                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34044 000058B8 368816[4E03]            	mov	[ss:SpaceFlag],dl ; 0
 34045                                  	;test	al,2
 34046 000058BD A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 34047 000058BF 7503                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 34048                                  	;MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 34049                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34050 000058C1 268815                  	mov	[es:di],dl ; 0
 34051                                  DEFDRV:
 34052 000058C4 47                      	INC	DI
 34053 000058C5 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34054                                  	;test	al,4
 34055 000058C8 A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 34056 000058CA 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 34057 000058CB B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34058 000058CD 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 34059 000058CF 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34060 000058D1 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 34061                                  FILLB:
 34062 000058D3 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34063 000058D5 B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 34064 000058D7 F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 34065 000058DA 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 34066 000058DC 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34067 000058DE 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 34068                                  FILLB2:
 34069 000058E0 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34070 000058E2 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 34071 000058E3 AB                      	STOSW
 34072 000058E4 AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 34073 000058E5 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 34074                                  	;test	bl,1
 34075 000058E8 F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 34076 000058EB 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 34077 000058ED E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 34078 000058F0 E81E01                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 34079 000058F3 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 34080 000058F5 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 34081                                  SKPSPC:
 34082 000058F6 E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 34083                                  NOSCAN:
 34084 000058F9 E8EC00                  	CALL	GETLET
 34085 000058FC 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 34086 000058FE 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 34087 00005901 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 34088 00005903 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 34089 00005904 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 34090 00005906 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 34091                                  
 34092 00005908 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34093 00005909 E8961E                  	call	GetVisDrv
 34094 0000590C 58                      	POP	AX
 34095 0000590D 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 34096                                  
 34097                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34098                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34099                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34100 0000590F 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 34101                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 34102 00005915 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 34103                                  BADDRV:
 34104 00005917 B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 34105                                  HAVDRV:
 34106 00005919 AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 34107 0000591A 46                      	INC	SI
 34108 0000591B 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 34109                                  NODRV:
 34110 0000591C 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 34111 0000591D 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 34112                                  
 34113                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 34114                                  NORMSCAN:
 34115 0000591E B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34116 00005921 E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 34117 00005924 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 34118 00005927 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 34119 00005929 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 34120                                  
 34121                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34122                                  	;mov	cx,3
 34123 0000592A B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 34124                                  
 34125                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34126                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34127                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 34128                                  	; 10/06/2019
 34129 0000592C 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 34130 00005932 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 34131 00005934 A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 34132                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34133                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 34134 00005935 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 34135                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 34136                                  VOLOK:
 34137                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 34138                                  contvol:
 34139 00005936 E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 34140                                  NODOT:
 34141 00005939 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 34142                                  
 34143                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34144                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 34145                                  	; 18/12/2022
 34146 0000593B 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 34147                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 34148                                  
 34149 00005941 C3                      	retn
 34150                                  
 34151                                  NONAM:
 34152 00005942 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34153 00005944 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34154 00005945 C3                      	retn
 34155                                  
 34156                                  GETWORD:
 34157 00005946 E89F00                  	CALL	GETLET		
 34158 00005949 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 34159 0000594B 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34160                                  
 34161                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 34162                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 34163                                  
 34164                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 34165 0000594C E89900                  	CALL	GETLET
 34166                                  
 34167                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 34168                                  
 34169                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 34170                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34171                                  ;ENDIF
 34172 0000594F 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 34173                                  
 34174                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34175 00005951 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 34176 00005957 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 34177 00005959 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 34178 0000595B 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 34179                                  
 34180                                  MustCheckCX:
 34181 0000595D E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 34182 0000595F 49                      	DEC	CX
 34183 00005960 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 34184 00005962 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 34185 00005964 B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 34186 00005966 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34187                                  NOSTAR:

 34189 00005969 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"

 34191 0000596D 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 34192 00005970 EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 34193                                  FILLNAM:

 34195 00005974 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34196 00005976 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34197 00005977 C3                      	retn
 34198                                  
 34199                                  SCANB:
 34200 00005978 AC                      	LODSB
 34201 00005979 E89D00                  	CALL	SPCHK
 34202 0000597C 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 34203 0000597E 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34204                                  scanb_retn:
 34205 0000597F C3                      	retn

 34207                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34208                                  ;
 34209                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 34210                                  ;
 34211                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 34212                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 34213                                  ;
 34214                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 34215                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 34216                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 34217                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 34218                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 34219                                  ;
 34220                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34221                                  
 34222                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34223                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34224                                  
 34225                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34226                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9E7Ch
 34227                                  
 34228                                  NameTrans:
 34229                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34230 00005980 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 34231 00005986 16                      	push	ss
 34232 00005987 07                      	pop	es
 34233                                  
 34234                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 34235 00005988 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 34236 0000598B 57                      	PUSH	DI
 34237                                  
 34238                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34239                                  %if 0
 34240                                  	MOV	AX,'  '	; 2020h
 34241                                  	MOV	CX,5
 34242                                  	STOSB
 34243                                  	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34244                                  	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 34245                                  	MOV	DL,AL
 34246                                  %else
 34247                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34248                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34249                                  	;;;
 34250 0000598C B020                    	mov     al, 20h ; ' '
 34251 0000598E B90B00                  	mov     cx, 11
 34252 00005991 F3AA                    	rep stosb               ; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34253 00005993 91                      	xchg    ax, cx
 34254 00005994 99                      	cwd
 34255                                  	;;;
 34256                                  %endif
 34257                                  
 34258 00005995 AA                      	STOSB
 34259 00005996 5F                      	POP	DI
 34260                                  
 34261 00005997 E884FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 34262                                  
 34263                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 34264 0000599A 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 34265 000059A0 75DD                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 34266 000059A2 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 34267 000059A8 C3                      	retn

 34271                                  
 34272                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34273                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34274                                  
 34275                                  ;If TableLook
 34276                                  
 34277                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 34278                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 34279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34280                                  
 34281                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 34282                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 34283                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 34284                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 34285                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 34286                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 34287                                  
 34288                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 34289                                  ;CharType:
 34290                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34291                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 34292                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34293                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 34294                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34295                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 34296                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34297                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 34298                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34299                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 34300                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34301                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 34302                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34303                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 34304                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34305                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 34306                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34307                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 34308                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34309                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 34310                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34311                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 34312                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34313                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 34314                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34315                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 34316                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34317                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34319                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 34320                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34321                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 34322                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 34323                                  ;	      ; # and "
 34324                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 34325                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 34326                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 34327                                  ;	      ; + and *
 34328                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34329                                  ;	      ; - and '
 34330                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 34331                                  ;	      ; / and .
 34332                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34333                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 34334                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 34335                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 34336                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34337                                  ;	      ; = and <
 34338                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 34339                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 34340                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34341                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 34342                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 34343                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 34344                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 34345                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 34346                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 34347                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 34348                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 34349                                  ;	      ; } and |
 34350                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 34351                                  
 34352                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 34353                                  ;					; character in the table
 34354                                  
 34355                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 34356                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter
 34357                                  ;FSPCHK	equ 4		; set if character is not a space or equivalent
 34358                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB
 34359                                  
 34360                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34361                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34362                                  ; DOSCODE:8F76h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34363                                  
 34364                                  CharType: ; 63 bytes
 34365 000059A9 6666666606666666                db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 06h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 0-7
 34366 000059B1 6666666666666666        	db  66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h, 66h ; 8-15
 34367 000059B9 F8F6FFFFFF4FF46E        	db 0F8h,0F6h,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 4Fh,0F4h, 6Eh ; 16-23
 34368 000059C1 FFFFFFFFFF4444F4        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 44h, 44h,0F4h ; 24-31
 34369 000059C9 FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 32-39
 34370 000059D1 FFFFFFFFFF6F66FF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh, 6Fh, 66h,0FFh ; 40-47
 34371 000059D9 FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF        	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh ; 48-55
 34372 000059E1 FFFFFFFFFFFFF4          	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0F4h	   ; 56-62
 34373                                  
 34374                                  CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2
 34375

 34377                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 34380                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F0h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h
 34381                                  ;	db 0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h,0F6h

 34392                                  ;	db 0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh,0FFh

 34416                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34417                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34418                                  
 34419                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34420                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34421                                  
 34422                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34423                                  ;
 34424                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 34425                                  ;
 34426                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 34427                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 34428                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 34429                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 34430                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 34431                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 34432                                  ;
 34433                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 34434                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 34435                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 34436                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 34437                                  ;
 34438                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 34439                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 34440                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 34441                                  ;
 34442                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34443                                  
 34444                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 34445                                  
 34446                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 34447                                  GETLET:	
 34448 000059E8 AC                      	LODSB
 34449                                  
 34450                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 34451                                  
 34452                                  	;entry	UCase
 34453                                  UCase:	
 34454                                  	; 09/08/2018
 34455                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 34456                                  _UCase:
 34457 000059E9 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34458 000059EA BB[7E0B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 34459                                  
 34460                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 34461                                  
 34462                                  gl_0:
 34463 000059ED 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 34464 000059EF 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 34465 000059F1 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 34466 000059F3 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 34467 000059F5 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 34468                                  
 34469                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 34470                                  
 34471                                  gl_1:
 34472 000059F7 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 34473 000059F9 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 34474 000059FB 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 34475                                  
 34476                                  	; M048 - Start 
 34477                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 34478                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 34479                                  	; preserve it.
 34480                                  
 34481                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34482                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34483                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 34484                                  	;CS	XLAT
 34485                                  
 34486                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34487                                  
 34488                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34489 000059FD 1E                      	push	ds
 34490                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 34491 000059FE 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 34492 00005A03 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 34493 00005A04 1F                      	pop	ds
 34494                                  
 34495                                  	; M048 - End
 34496                                  
 34497                                  ; Now check the type
 34498                                  
 34499                                  ;If TableLook
 34500                                  gl_2:
 34501                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34502 00005A05 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34503                                  
 34504                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34505                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34506                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 34507                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34508                                  	;cs	xlat	
 34509                                  	
 34510                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34511 00005A06 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 34512                                  	
 34513                                  	;test	al,1	
 34514 00005A09 A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 34515 00005A0B 58                      	POP	AX
 34516                                  
 34517 00005A0C 5B                      	POP	BX
 34518 00005A0D C3                      	RETN
 34519                                  
 34520                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 34521                                  
 34522                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34523                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 34524                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 34525 00005A0E 53                      	PUSH	BX
 34526 00005A0F EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 34527                                  ;ELSE
 34528                                  ;
 34529                                  ;gl_2:
 34530                                  ;	POP	BX
 34531                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 34532                                  ;	retz
 34533                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 34534                                  ;	retz
 34535                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 34536                                  ;	retz
 34537                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 34538                                  ;	retz
 34539                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 34540                                  ;	retz
 34541                                  ;ENDIF
 34542                                  
 34543                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 34544                                  ;
 34545                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 34546                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 34547                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 34548                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 34549                                  ;
 34550                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 34551                                  
 34552                                  	;entry	DELIM
 34553                                  DELIM:
 34554                                  ;IF TableLook
 34555                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34556 00005A11 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34557                                  
 34558                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34559                                  	;push	bx
 34560                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34561                                  	;;09/08/2018
 34562                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34563                                  	;cs	xlat
 34564                                  	;pop	bx
 34565                                  
 34566                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34567 00005A12 E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 34568                                  	
 34569                                  	;test	al,2
 34570 00005A15 A802                    	TEST	AL,FDELIM
 34571 00005A17 58                      	POP	AX
 34572 00005A18 C3                      	RETN
 34573                                  ;ELSE
 34574                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 34575                                  ;	retz
 34576                                  ;
 34577                                  ;	CMP	AL,"<"
 34578                                  ;	retz
 34579                                  ;	CMP	AL,"|"
 34580                                  ;	retz
 34581                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 34582                                  ;	retz
 34583                                  ;
 34584                                  ;	CMP	AL,"+"
 34585                                  ;	retz
 34586                                  ;	CMP	AL,"="
 34587                                  ;	retz
 34588                                  ;	CMP	AL,";"
 34589                                  ;	retz
 34590                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 34591                                  ;	retz
 34592                                  ;ENDIF
 34593                                  
 34594                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34595                                  ;
 34596                                  ;  SPCHK - checks to see if a character is a space or equivalent
 34597                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to check
 34598                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is a space
 34599                                  ;	Uses  : flags
 34600                                  ;
 34601                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34602                                  
 34603                                  	;entry SPCHK
 34604                                  SPCHK:
 34605                                  ;IF TableLook
 34606                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34607 00005A19 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34608                                  
 34609                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 34610                                  	;push	bx
 34611                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 34612                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 34613                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 34614                                  	;cs	xlat
 34615                                  	;pop	bx
 34616                                  
 34617                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34618 00005A1A E80400                  	CALL	GetCharType
 34619                                  	
 34620                                  	;test	al,4
 34621 00005A1D A804                    	TEST	AL,FSPCHK
 34622 00005A1F 58                      	POP	AX
 34623 00005A20 C3                      	RETN
 34624                                  ;ELSE
 34625                                  ;	CMP	AL,9		; Filter out tabs too
 34626                                  ;	retz
 34627                                  ;; WARNING! " " MUST be the last compare
 34628                                  ;	CMP	AL," "
 34629                                  ;	return
 34630                                  ;ENDIF
 34631                                  
 34632                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34633                                  ;
 34634                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 34635                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 34636                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 34637                                  ;
 34638                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 34639                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 34640                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 34641                                  ;
 34642                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34643                                  
 34644                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34645                                  
 34646                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34647                                  
 34648                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34649                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34650                                  
 34651                                  GetCharType:
 34652                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 34653 00005A21 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 34654 00005A23 7314                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 34655                                  
 34656 00005A25 53                      	push	bx
 34657 00005A26 BB[A959]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 34658 00005A29 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 34659                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 34660 00005A2B 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 34661 00005A2D 5B                      	pop	bx
 34662                                  
 34663                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 34664                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 34665                                  
 34666 00005A2E 7306                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 34667                                  
 34668                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34669                                  %if 0
 34670                                  	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 34671                                  	shr	al,1
 34672                                  	shr	al,1
 34673                                  	shr	al,1
 34674                                  %else
 34675                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34676                                  	;;;
 34677 00005A30 51                      	push	cx
 34678 00005A31 B104                    	mov	cl,4			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 34679 00005A33 D2E8                    	shr	al,cl
 34680 00005A35 59                      	pop	cx
 34681                                  	;;;
 34682                                  %endif
 34683                                  
 34684                                  gct_80:
 34685 00005A36 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 34686 00005A38 C3                      	retn
 34687                                  gct_90:
 34688 00005A39 B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 34689 00005A3B C3                      	retn
 34690                                  
 34691                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34692                                  ;
 34693                                  ; Procedure : PATHCHRCMP
 34694                                  ;
 34695                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34696                                  
 34697                                  PATHCHRCMP:
 34698 00005A3C 3C2F                    	CMP	AL,'/'
 34699 00005A3E 7606                    	JBE	short PathRet
 34700 00005A40 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 34701 00005A42 C3                      	retn
 34702                                  GotFor:
 34703 00005A43 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 34704 00005A45 C3                      	retn
 34705                                  PathRet:
 34706 00005A46 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 34707 00005A48 C3                      	retn

 34718                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 34719                                  
 34720                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 34721                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 34722                                  
 34723                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 34724                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 34725                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 34726                                  ;
 34727                                  ;	FATAL
 34728                                  ;	FATAL1
 34729                                  ;	reset_environment
 34730                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 34731                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 34732                                  ;	STATCHK
 34733                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 34734                                  ;	DIVOV
 34735                                  ;	CHARHARD
 34736                                  ;	HardErr
 34737                                  ;
 34738                                  ;	Revision history:
 34739                                  ;
 34740                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 34741                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 34742                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 34743                                  ;
 34744                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 34745                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 34746                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 34747                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 34748                                  ;
 34749                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 34750                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 34751                                  ;	      charhard.
 34752

 35058                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35059                                  ;
 35060                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35061                                  ;
 35062                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35063                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35064                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35065                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35066                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35067                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35068                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35069                                  ; is simulated.
 35070                                  ;
 35071                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35072                                  
 35073                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35074                                  
 35075                                  CNTCHAND:
 35076                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35077                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35078                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35079                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35080                                  
 35081                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35082                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35083 00005B91 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35084 00005B97 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35085                                  
 35086 00005B99 B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35087 00005B9B E8DDC0                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35088 00005B9E E872BF                          CALL	CRLF
 35089                                  around_deadlock:
 35090 00005BA1 16                              PUSH    SS
 35091 00005BA2 1F                              POP     DS
 35092 00005BA3 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35093 00005BA8 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 35094 00005BAA E837DE                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 35095                                  NOSWAP:
 35096 00005BAD FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 35097 00005BAE 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 35098 00005BB2 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 35099 00005BB6 E89CA8                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 35100                                  
 35101                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 35102                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 35103                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 35104                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 35105                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 35106                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 35107                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 35108                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35109                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35110                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35111                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35112                                  			; else
 35113                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35114                                  
 35115                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35116                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 35117                                  
 35118                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 35119                                  	
 35120 00005BB9 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 35121                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 35122 00005BBA 1E                      	push	ds
 35123                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35124 00005BBB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35125 00005BC0 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35126                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35127                                  	;;;
 35128 00005BC5 C606[C011]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 35129                                  	;;;
 35130 00005BCA C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 35131 00005BCF 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 35132                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 35133 00005BD3 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 35134                                  
 35135 00005BD8 803E[660D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35136 00005BDD 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 35137 00005BDE 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35138 00005BE0 F8                      	CLC				
 35139 00005BE1 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35140 00005BE3 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 35141                                  
 35142                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35143                                  do_low_int23:
 35144 00005BE5 F8                      	clc
 35145 00005BE6 2EFF1E[495A]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]
 35146                                  
 35147                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 35148                                  
 35149                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 35150                                  
 35151                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35152                                  ;
 35153                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35154                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35155                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 35156                                  ;
 35157                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 35158                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 35159                                  
 35160                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 35161                                  
 35162 00005BEB FA                      	CLI
 35163                                  
 35164                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 35165                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 35166                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35167                                  	;POP	AX
 35168                                  
 35169                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35170                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35171                                  
 35172                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 35173                                  
 35174 00005BEC 50                      	push	ax
 35175 00005BED 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 35176                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35177 00005BEF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35178 00005BF4 A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 35179 00005BF7 58                      	pop	ax
 35180 00005BF8 A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 35181 00005BFB 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35182 00005BFC 58                      	pop	ax
 35183                                  
 35184                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 35185                                  
 35186                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35187                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 35188                                  	;JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35189                                  
 35190                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 35207

 35209                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input

 35424                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35425                                  ;
 35426                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 35427                                  ;
 35428                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 35429                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 35430                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 35431                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 35432                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 35433                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 35434                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 35435                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 35436                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 35437                                  ; Output:
 35438                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 35439                                  ;
 35440                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35441                                  
 35442                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 35606                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.

 35646                                  					; must preserve ES

 35668 00005DBB 36FE06[2103]            	INC	BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; Back in the DOS

 35679                                  	
 35680                                  	; 08/07/2018
 35681

 35683

 35685 00005DD3 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore

 35711                                  	;retn
 35712                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35713 00005DFE 7411                    	jz	short Cleanup_retn ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35714                                  CleanUp2:
 35715 00005E00 1E                      	push	ds
 35716 00005E01 56                      	push	si
 35717 00005E02 50                      	push	ax
 35718 00005E03 36A1[AA05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:SFN]

 35727                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 35728

 35732                                  CheckRI:	; 29/02/2024

 35735
