 35737

 35746                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 35747                                  DoAbort:
 35748 00005E24 16                      	push	ss

 35750                                  
 35751 00005E26 803E[5703]00            	CMP	byte [CONSWAP],0

 35753 00005E2D E8B4DB                  	call	SWAPBACK
 35754                                  NOSWAP2:

 35756                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 35757                                  
 35758                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 35759                                  	;jnz	short DoFail

 35767 00005E3C 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 35768                                  
 35769                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 35770                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 35771                                  
 35772 00005E3E E95410                  	jmp	exit_inner
 35773                                  
 35774                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35775                                  ;
 35776                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 35777                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 35778                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 35779                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 35780                                  ;
 35781                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 35782                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 35783                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 35784                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 35785                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 35786                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 35787                                  ;
 35788                                  ; output:   none.
 35789                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35790                                  
 35791                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 35792                                  	
 35793                                  reset_environment:
 35794                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35795                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 35796                                  
 35797                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 35798                                  
 35799 00005E41 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 35800                                  
 35801                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 35802                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 35803                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 35804                                  
 35805 00005E42 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 35806                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 35807                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 35808 00005E44 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 35809                                  
 35810                                  					; SS override
 35811 00005E46 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 35812                                  
 35813                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 35814                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 35815                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 35816                                  					; On process exit.
 35817 00005E4C B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 35818 00005E4F CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 35819                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 35820                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 35821 00005E51 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 35822 00005E53 E804B1                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 35823                                  
 35824 00005E56 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 35825 00005E57 06                      	push	es
 35826 00005E58 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 35827

 35829 00005E5E 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX

 35831

 35834                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process

 35836 00005E63 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX

 35841                                  
 35842                                  					; SS override
 35843                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 35844 00005E6C 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 35845 00005E72 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 35846                                  
 35847                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 35848                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 35849                                  
 35850                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 35851 00005E74 E85D10                  	call	arena_free_process
 35852                                  
 35853                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 35854                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 35855                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 35856                                  
 35857                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 35858 00005E77 E81DD7                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 35859                                  
 35860                                  reset_to_parent:
 35861                                  					; SS override
 35862 00005E7A 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 35863                                  
 35864                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 35865                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 35866 00005E7F 16                      	push	ss

 35870

 35872                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.

 35959                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35960                                  ;
 35961                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 35962                                  ;
 35963                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 35964                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 35965                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 35966                                  ;
 35967                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35968                                  
 35969                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 35970 00005EE3 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35971                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 35972 00005EE4 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 35973 00005EE7 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 35974                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 35975                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 35976                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35977                                  	
 35978                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35979 00005EEA 1E                      	push	ds
 35980                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 35981 00005EEB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35982                                  
 35983                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 35984                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 35985                                  
 35986 00005EF0 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 35987 00005EF2 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 35988 00005EF4 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 35989                                  
 35990                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 35991 00005EF6 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35992 00005EFA 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH

 35998 00005F00 58                      	POP	AX

 36001                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 36002

 36004                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 36005 00005F02 BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 36006 00005F05 E8BAA7                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields

 36010                                  ;============================================================================
 36011                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36012                                  ;============================================================================
 36013                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36014                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36015                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36016                                  
 36017                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36018                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36019                                  
 36020                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36021                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36022                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36023                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36024                                  ;
 36025                                  ;	IsEof
 36026                                  ;	UNPACK
 36027                                  ;	PACK
 36028                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36029                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36030                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36031                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36032                                  ;
 36033                                  ;	Revision history:
 36034                                  ;
 36035                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36036                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36037                                  ;
 36038                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36039                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36040                                  
 36041                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36042                                  
 36043                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36044                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36045                                  
 36046                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36047                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36048                                  ;
 36049                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36050                                  ;
 36051                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36052                                  ;
 36053                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36054                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36055                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36056                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36057                                  ;
 36058                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36059                                  
 36060                                  IsEOF:
 36061                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36062                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36063                                  	;;;
 36064 00005F0A E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36065 00005F0D 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36066                                  
 36067                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36068 00005F0F 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36069 00005F16 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36070 00005F18 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36071                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36072 00005F1B C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36073                                  
 36074                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36075                                  	;;;
 36076                                  
 36077                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36078 00005F1C 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36079 00005F22 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36080                                  
 36081                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36082                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36083                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36084                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36085                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36086                                  
 36087 00005F24 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36088 00005F28 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36089                                  
 36090 00005F2A 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36091                                  IsEOF_other:
 36092 00005F2E C3                      	retn
 36093                                  EOF16:
 36094 00005F2F 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36095 00005F32 C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36096                                  
 36097                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36098                                  
 36099                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36100                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36101                                  ;
 36102                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36103                                  ;
 36104                                  ; Inputs:
 36105                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36106                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36107                                  ; Outputs:
 36108                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36109                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36110                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36111                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36112                                  ;
 36113                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36114                                  ;
 36115                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36116                                  
 36117                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36118                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36119                                  	;
 36120                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36121                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36122                                  
 36123                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36124                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36125                                  
 36126                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36127                                  UNPACK:

 36317                                  ;
 36318                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36319                                  ;
 36320                                  ; Inputs:
 36321                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36322                                  ;	DX = Data
 36323                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36324                                  ; Outputs:
 36325                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36326                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36327                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 36330                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.

 36333                                  
 36334                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 36534                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36535                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36536                                  ;
 36537                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36538                                  ;
 36539                                  ; Inputs:
 36540                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36541                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36542                                  ; Function:
 36543                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36544                                  ; Outputs:
 36545                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36546                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36547                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36548                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36549                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36550                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36551                                  ;
 36552                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36553                                  
 36554                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36555                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36556                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36557                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36558                                  
 36559                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36560                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 36561                                  
 36562                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36563                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36564 000060BA C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36565                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36566 000060BF 50                      	push	ax
 36567 000060C0 53                      	push	bx
 36568 000060C1 51                      	push	cx
 36569 000060C2 52                      	push	dx
 36570                                  	; 02/03/2024
 36571                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36572                                  
 36573                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36574                                  	;;;
 36575                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36576 000060C3 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 36577 000060C5 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36578                                  	;
 36579 000060C9 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36580                                  	;
 36581 000060CA 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36582 000060CC E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36583 000060CF 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 36584                                  	; FAT32
 36585 000060D1 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36586 000060D3 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36587 000060D5 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36588 000060D7 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36589 000060D9 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36590 000060DB D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36591                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 36592 000060DD EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 36593                                  mapcl1:
 36594                                  	;;;
 36595 000060DF 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36596                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36597                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36598                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36599                                  	;
 36600                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36601                                  	;;;
 36602 000060E5 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 36603                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 36604 000060E7 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 36605 000060E9 D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 36606                                  mapcl2:
 36607 000060EB 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 36608 000060ED 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36609 000060F1 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 36610                                  	;;;
 36611                                  Map16:	
 36612                                  
 36613                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36614                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36615                                  %if 0
 36616                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36617                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36618                                  	
 36619                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36620                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36621                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36622                                  %endif
 36623                                  
 36624 000060F3 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36625                                  
 36626                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36627                                  ;
 36628                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36629                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36630                                  ;
 36631                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36632                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36633                                  ;
 36634                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36635                                  
 36636 000060F7 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 36637 000060FB 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 36638                                  
 36639                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36640                                  %if 0
 36641                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 36642                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 36643                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 36644                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 36645                                  	;shr	al,1
 36646                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 36647                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 36648                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 36649                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36650                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 36651                                  %else
 36652                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36653                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36654                                  	;;;
 36655 000060FD 50                      	push	ax
 36656 000060FE D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36657 00006100 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 36658 00006102 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 36659 00006104 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 36660 00006106 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 36661 00006108 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 36662 0000610A 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 36663 0000610C D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36664 0000610E 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 36665 00006110 87FA                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 36666 00006112 5A                      	pop	dx
 36667 00006113 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 36668                                  	;;;
 36669                                  %endif
 36670 00006117 EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 36671                                  
 36672                                  _DoDiv:
 36673                                  ;ENDIF
 36674                                  
 36675                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36676                                  %if 0
 36677                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36678                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 36679                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36680                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 36681                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36682                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 36683                                  %else
 36684                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36685                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36686                                  	;;;
 36687 00006119 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36688 0000611A 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 36689 0000611B F7F1                    	div	cx
 36690 0000611D 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36691 0000611E F7F1                    	div	cx
 36692                                  	;jmp	short DivDone
 36693                                  	;;;
 36694                                  %endif
 36695                                  
 36696                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36697                                  DivDone:
 36698                                  ;ENDIF
 36699                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 36700 00006120 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 36701                                  	
 36702                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36703                                  	;;;
 36704 00006124 83D700                  	adc	di,0
 36705                                  	;;;
 36706                                  
 36707 00006127 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 36708                                  
 36709                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 36710                                  
 36711                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36712                                  	;;;
 36713 00006128 57                      	push	di ; 4*
 36714                                  	;;;
 36715 00006129 50                      	push	ax ; 3*
 36716 0000612A 52                      	push	dx ; 2*
 36717 0000612B 51                      	push	cx ; 1*
 36718                                  
 36719 0000612C 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 36720                                  
 36721                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36722                                  	; mov [HIGH_SECTOR],di ; *!* ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36723 0000612E 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 36724                                  	;
 36725                                  
 36726                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36727                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36728                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 36729                                  	;
 36730                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36731                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 36732                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 36733                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 36734                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36735                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36736 00006130 E83D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36737                                  
 36738                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 36739 00006133 59                      	pop	cx ; 1*
 36740 00006134 58                      	pop	ax ; 2*
 36741 00006135 5A                      	pop	dx ; 3*
 36742                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36743                                  	;;;
 36744 00006136 5B                      	pop	bx ; 4*
 36745                                  	;;;
 36746                                  
 36747 00006137 725A                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 36748                                  
 36749 00006139 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 36750                                  	;;;lea	di,[si+16]
 36751                                  	;;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 36752                                  	;lea	di,[si+24] ; PCDOS 7.1	; 02/03/2024
 36753 0000613D 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 36754 00006140 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 36755 00006142 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 36756 00006144 7530                    	JNZ	short MAPRET	; ds<>ss
 36757 00006146 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 36758                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 36759 00006148 16                      	push	ss
 36760 00006149 1F                      	pop	ds	
 36761 0000614A FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 36762 0000614E A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 36763 00006151 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 36764                                  	
 36765                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36766                                  	;MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 36767                                  	;INC	DX
 36768                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36769                                  	;;;
 36770 00006155 31C0                    	xor     ax,ax ; 0

 36773 0000615E 11C3                    	adc	bx,ax
 36774                                  	;mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],bx ; *!*
 36775                                  	;;;
 36776                                  
 36777                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36778                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 36779                                  	;
 36780                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36781                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 36782                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 36783                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 36784                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36785                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36786 00006160 E80D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36787 00006163 722E                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 36788                                  
 36789 00006165 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 36790 00006169 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 36791 0000616C 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 36792                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 36793 0000616E 16                      	push	ss
 36794 0000616F 1F                      	pop	ds
 36795 00006170 A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 36796                                  
 36797                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 36798 00006173 BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 36799                                  MAPRET:
 36800                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36801                                  	;;;
 36802 00006176 368F06[E80A]            	pop	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW]	; (ds<>ss)
 36803                                  	;;;
 36804                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 36805 0000617B 5A                      	pop	dx
 36806 0000617C 59                      	pop	cx
 36807 0000617D 5B                      	pop	bx
 36808                                  
 36809 0000617E 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 36810                                  
 36811                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36812                                  	;;;
 36813 00006180 E822FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36814 00006183 720A                    	jc	short MapSet	; FAT32 fs
 36815                                  	;;;
 36816                                  
 36817 00006185 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 36818 0000618B 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 36819 0000618D 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 36820                                  MapSet:
 36821 0000618F A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 36822                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 36823 00006191 58                      	pop	ax
 36824 00006192 C3                      	retn
 36825                                  
 36826                                  MAP_POP:
 36827                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36828                                  	;;;
 36829                                  	;pop	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36830                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36831 00006193 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; (ds=ss)
 36832                                  	;;;
 36833                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 36834 00006197 5A                      	pop	dx
 36835 00006198 59                      	pop	cx
 36836 00006199 5B                      	pop	bx
 36837 0000619A 58                      	pop	ax
 36838                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 36839 0000619B C3                      	retn
 36840                                  
 36841                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36842                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36843                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36844                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36845                                  
 36846                                  ; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36847                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6C6h
 36848                                  
 36849                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 36850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36851                                  ;
 36852                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 36853                                  ;
 36854                                  ; Inputs:
 36855                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 36856                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 36857                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 36858                                  ; Function:
 36859                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 36860                                  ;	if disk changed.
 36861                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 36862                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 36863                                  ; Outputs:
 36864                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36865                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 36866                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 36867                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 36868                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 36869                                  ;
 36870                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36871                                  
 36872                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 36873 0000619C 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 36874                                  
 36875                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36876                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36877                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36878                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36879 000061A0 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36880 000061A4 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36881 000061A7 E8CCA4                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 36882                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36883                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36884 000061AA E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36885                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 36886                                  	;retn
 36887                                  
 36888                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36889                                  ;
 36890                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 36891                                  ;
 36892                                  ; Inputs:
 36893                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 36894                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 36895                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 36896                                  ; Function:
 36897                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 36898                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 36899                                  ; Outputs:
 36900                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 36901                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 36902                                  ;	THISDRV set
 36903                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36904                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 36905                                  ;
 36906                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36907                                  
 36908                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36909                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36910                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36911                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36912                                  
 36913                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36914                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 36915                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 36916                                  
 36917                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 36918 000061AD 06                      	PUSH	ES
 36919 000061AE 57                      	PUSH	DI
 36920                                  
 36921                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 36922 000061AF 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36923                                  
 36924                                  ; 03/03/2024
 36925                                  %if 0
 36926                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36927                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36928                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36929                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36930                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36931                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 36932                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36933                                  %else
 36934                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36935                                  	;;;
 36936 000061B3 E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 36937                                  	;;;
 36938                                  %endif
 36939 000061B6 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 36940 000061B7 07                      	POP	ES
 36941 000061B8 72E1                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 36942 000061BA 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 36943                                  
 36944                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 36945                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 36946                                  
 36947                                  MED_CHANGE:
 36948                                  	;XOR	AX,AX
 36949                                  	;DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 36950                                  	; 03/03/2024
 36951 000061BC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 36952                                  	
 36953 000061BF 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 36954 000061C0 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 36955 000061C4 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 36956                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 36957 000061C6 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 36958                                  
 36959                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36960                                  
 36961                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 36962                                  ;
 36963                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 36964                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 36965                                  
 36966 000061CA 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 36967                                  frcd20: 
 36968                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 36969                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 36970 000061CF 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 36971 000061D4 7522                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 36972                                  
 36973                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36974                                  	;push	es
 36975                                  	;push	di
 36976                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 36977                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36978                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 36979                                  	;pop	di
 36980                                  	;pop	es
 36981                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 36982                                  
 36983                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36984 000061D6 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36985 000061DA 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 36986 000061DC 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 36987 000061DE 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 36988 000061E2 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 36989                                  
 36990                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36991                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A70Fh
 36992 000061E4 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 36993                                  	;JZ	short frcd25 ; = 0	; If root (0), leave root
 36994                                  		; !!! test es:[di+49h],ax
 36995                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25	
 36996                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM bug (!?) ; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 36997                                  		; test dword ptr es:[di+49h],-1 ; Win ME - BIOSCODE:0C694h
 36998                                  		; jz short frcd25
 36999                                  		;
 37000                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37001 000061E8 7506                    	jnz	short frcd24
 37002                                  
 37003                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37004                                  	;;;
 37005                                  	;test	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37006 000061EA 2685454B                	test	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],AX
 37007 000061EE 7408                    	jz	short frcd25 ; = 0
 37008                                  frcd24:		; 03/03/2024
 37009                                  	;;;
 37010                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 37011 000061F0 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 37012                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37013                                  	;;;
 37014                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 37015 000061F4 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax ; -1
 37016                                  	;;;
 37017                                  frcd25:	
 37018                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 37019                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 37020 000061F8 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 37021 000061FB E2D2                    	LOOP	frcd20
 37022 000061FD 1F                      	POP	DS
 37023                                  NO_CHANGE:
 37024 000061FE C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37025 00006202 F8                      	CLC
 37026 00006203 C3                      	retn
 37027                                  
 37028                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 37029                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 37030                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 37031                                  ;;;
 37032                                  chk_set_first_access:
 37033                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 37034 00006204 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 37035 00006209 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 37036                                  	; FAT32
 37037                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 37038 0000620B 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37039                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 37040 00006210 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT_HW],0FFFFh ; -1
 37041 00006216 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 37042                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 37043                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 37044 00006218 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37045                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 37046                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 37047 0000621D 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37048 00006223 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 37049                                  	;or	byte [es:bp+18h],1
 37050 00006225 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37051                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37052 0000622A C3                      	retn
 37053                                  ;;;
 37054                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 37498                                  	;MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcnt-BUFINSIZ],AX
 37499                                  
 37500                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37501                                  	;mov	[di-0Ah],al
 37502                                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcnt-BUFINSIZ],AL 
 37503                                  						;>32mb		;AN000;
 37504                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Fh]
 37505                                  	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]		;>32mb
 37506                                  	;mov	[di-09h],ax					;AC000;
 37507                                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_wrtcntinc-BUFINSIZ],AX 
 37508                                  					;>32mb Correct buffer info ;AC000;
 37509                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37510                                  	push	ss
 37511                                  	pop	ds
 37512                                  	XOR	AL,AL			;Media changed (Z), Carry clear
 37513                                  	retn
 37514                                  
 37515                                  FATERRJ: 
 37516                                  	JMP	FATERR
 37517                                  
 37518                                  %else
 37519                                  	; 04/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37520                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 37521                                  	;;;
 37522 000063ED 09FF                    	or	di,di
 37523 000063EF 790C                    	jns	short gotgetbuf2
 37524                                  	; error

 37528                                  				; byte BUFFINFO.buf_ID = 0FFh ; FREE
 37529                                  				; byte BUFFINFO.buf_flags = 0
 37530 000063FA E92EFE                  	jmp	FATERR
 37531                                  	
 37532                                  gotgetbuf2:
 37533 000063FD C536[6C03]              	lds	si,[CALLBPB]	; Address of the BPB (DEVCALL offset 18)
 37534                                  
 37535 00006401 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx	; 0
 37536                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],cx	; [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE] = 0

 37551 00006417 49                      	dec	cx	; -1

 37554                                  	;mov	[es:bp+21h],cx

 37623

 37628

 37630 00006497 7502                    	jne	short gotgetbuf7	; if yes, it is invalid value (must be 0FFFFFFFFh)
 37631 00006499 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx
 37632                                  gotgetbuf7:
 37633 0000649B 7308                    	jnb	short gotgetbuf8	; yes, invalid value (must be 0FFFFFFFFh)
 37634

 37753                                  ; BUF.ASM

 37755                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37756                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 - 12/03/2018
 37757                                  ;
 37758                                  ; buffer management for MSDOS
 37759                                  ;
 37760                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 37761                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 37762                                  ;
 37763                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 37764                                  ;
 37765                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37766                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37767                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37768                                  ;; Inputs:
 37769                                  ;;      None
 37770                                  ;; Function:
 37771                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37772                                  ;; Outputs:
 37773                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37774                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37775                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37776                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37777                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37778                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37779                                  ;
 37780                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37781                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37782                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37783                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37784                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37785                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37786                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37787                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37788                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37789                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37790                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37791                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37792                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37793                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37794                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37795                                  ;       RETN
 37796                                  ;
 37797                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37798                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37799                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37800                                  ;
 37801                                  ;; Inputs:
 37802                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37803                                  ;; Function:
 37804                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37805                                  ;; Outputs:
 37806                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37807                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37808                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37809                                  ;
 37810                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37811                                  ;       ;retz
 37812                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37813                                  ;
 37814                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37815                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37816                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37817                                  ;
 37818                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37819                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37820                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37821                                  ;	
 37822                                  ;	push	ax
 37823                                  ;	or	al,1
 37824                                  ;	pop	ax
 37825                                  ;	retn	
 37826                                  ;
 37827                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37828                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37829                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT
 37830                                  
 37831                                  ;============================================================================
 37832                                  ; BUF.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 37833                                  ;============================================================================
 37834                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37835                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37836                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37837                                  
 37838                                  ;	TITLE	BUF - MSDOS buffer management
 37839                                  ;	NAME	BUF
 37840                                  
 37841                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 37842                                  ;
 37843                                  ;	GETCURHEAD
 37844                                  ;	ScanPlace
 37845                                  ;	PLACEBUF
 37846                                  ;	PLACEHEAD
 37847                                  ;	PointComp
 37848                                  ;	GETBUFFR
 37849                                  ;	GETBUFFRB
 37850                                  ;	FlushBuf
 37851                                  ;	BufWrite
 37852                                  ;	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS
 37853                                  ;
 37854                                  ;	Revision history:
 37855                                  ;
 37856                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37857                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 37858                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 37859                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 37860                                  
 37861                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37862                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37863                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37864                                  ; Inputs:
 37865                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37866                                  ; Function:
 37867                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37868                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37869                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37870                                  ; Outputs:
 37871                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37872                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37873                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37874                                  ; No other registers altered
 37875                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37876                                  
 37877                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37878                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37879                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37880                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37881                                  
 37882                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37883                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 37884                                  
 37885                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37886 0000650B 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37887 00006510 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37888 00006517 36893E[1711]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37889 0000651C C3                      	retn
 37890                                  
 37891                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37892                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37893                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37894                                  ; Inputs:
 37895                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37896                                  ; Function:
 37897                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37898                                  ; Outputs:
 37899                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37900                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37901                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37902                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37903                                  
 37904                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37905                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37906                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37907                                  ;	push	es
 37908                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37909                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37910                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37911                                  ;	push	es
 37912                                  ;	pop	ds
 37913                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37914                                  ;	pop	es
 37915                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37916                                  ;	retn	
 37917                                  	
 37918                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37919                                  SCANPLACE:
 37920 0000651D FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37921                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37922 0000651F E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37923 00006522 5F                      	pop	di
 37924 00006523 C3                      	retn
 37925                                  
 37926                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37927                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37928                                  ; Input:
 37929                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37930                                  ; Function:
 37931                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37932                                  ; NO registers altered
 37933                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37934                                  
 37935                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37936                                  
 37937                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37938                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37939                                  PLACEBUF:
 37940                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37941                                  
 37942                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37943 00006524 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37944 00006525 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37945                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37946                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37947                                  	
 37948 00006526 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37949                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37950 00006528 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37951                                  	
 37952 0000652D 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37953 0000652F 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37954 00006531 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 37955 00006533 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37956 00006535 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 37957 00006539 EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 37958                                  not_first:

 38117                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38118                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38119                                  ;
 38120                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38121                                  ; Inputs:
 38122                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38123                                  ; Function:
 38124                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38125                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38126                                  ;	   same segment
 38127                                  ;
 38128                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38129                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38130                                  ; No Registers altered
 38131                                  ;
 38132                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38133                                  
 38134                                  POINTCOMP:
 38135                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 38150                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38151                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38152                                  
 38153                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38154                                  
 38155                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38157                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38158                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38159                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38160                                  ; 
 38161                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38162                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38163                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38164                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38165                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38166                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38167                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38168                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38169                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38170                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38171                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38172                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38173                                  
 38174                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38175                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38176                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38177                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38178                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38179                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38180                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38181                                  ; 
 38182                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38183                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38184                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38185                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38186                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38187                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38188                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38189                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38190                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38191                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38192                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38193                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38194                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38195                                  
 38196                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 38813                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 38814                                  ;
 38815                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 38816                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 38817                                  ;
 38818                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty

 38826                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 38827                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38828 00006739 B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 38829                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 38830 0000673B 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH

 38834                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]

 38836 00006747 F8                      	CLC
 38837 00006748 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 38838                                  
 38839                                  	; 07/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 38840                                  	;;;

 38842 0000674C 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 38843                                  	;test	ss:drive_flags[bx],8 
 38844 0000674E 36F687[1012]08          	test	byte [ss:bx+drive_flags],8 ; bit 3

 38846                                  	;;;
 38847                                  
 38848                                  DOBUFFER:

 38850 00006756 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 38851 0000675A 74DC                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 38852 0000675C 50                      	PUSH	AX
 38853                                  	;push	word [di+4]

 38860                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 38861 00006769 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 38862                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 38863 0000676C 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 38864                                  checkflush_retn:

 38867                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 38868                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38869                                  ;
 38870                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 38871                                  ;
 38872                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 38873                                  ;
 38874                                  ;	EXIT	Buffer marked free
 38875                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 38876                                  ;
 38877                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 38878                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR
