 39175                                  ;============================================================================
 39176                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39177                                  ;============================================================================
 39178                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39179                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39180                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39181                                  
 39182                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39183                                  
 39184                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39185                                  
 39186                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39187                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39188                                  
 39189                                  ; =========================================================================
 39190                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39191                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39192                                  ;
 39193                                  ;	$WAIT
 39194                                  ;	$EXEC
 39195                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39196                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39197                                  ;	$EXIT
 39198                                  ;	$ABORT
 39199                                  ;	abort_inner
 39200                                  ;
 39201                                  ;	Modification history:
 39202                                  ;
 39203                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39204                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39205                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39206                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39207                                  ;
 39208                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39209                                  ;
 39210                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39211                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39212                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39213                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39214                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39215                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39216                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39217                                  ;
 39218                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39219                                  ;
 39220                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39221                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39222                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39223                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39224                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39225                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39226                                  ;
 39227                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39228                                  ;
 39229                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39230                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39231                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39232                                  ;
 39233                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39234                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39235                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39236                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39237                                  ;
 39238                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39239                                  ;
 39240                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39241                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39242                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39243                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39244                                  ;
 39245                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39246                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39247                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39248                                  ;
 39249                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39250                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39251                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39252                                  ;
 39253                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39254                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39255                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39256                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39257                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39258                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39259                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39260                                  ;
 39261                                  ; =========================================================================
 39262                                  
 39263                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39264                                  
 39265                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 39266                                  ; =========================================================================
 39267                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 39268                                  ;
 39269                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39270                                  ;
 39271                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 39272                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 39273                                  ;
 39274                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 39275                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 39276                                  ;	USES	all
 39277                                  ; =========================================================================
 39278                                  
 39279                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39280                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39281                                  
 39282                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39283                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39284                                  
 39285                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39286                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 39287                                  
 39288                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 39289                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 39290                                  
 39291                                  _$WAIT:
 39292                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39293                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39294                                  
 39295 00006830 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39296 00006832 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 39297 00006837 E9459E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 39299                                  ; =========================================================================
 39300                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39301                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39302                                  ;
 39303                                  ;
 39304                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39305                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39306                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39307                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39308                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39309                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39310                                  ;
 39311                                  ;	AL  Function
 39312                                  ;	--  --------
 39313                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39314                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39315                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39316                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39317                                  ;
 39318                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39319                                  ;
 39320                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39321                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39322                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39323                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39324                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39325                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39326                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39327                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39328                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39329                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39330                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39331                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39332                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39333                                  ;
 39334                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39335                                  ;
 39336                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39337                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39338                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39339                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39340                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39341                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39342                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39343                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39344                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39345                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39346                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39347                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39348                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39349                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39350                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39351                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39352                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39353                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39354                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39355                                  ;
 39356                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39357                                  ;
 39358                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39359                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39360                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39361                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39362                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39363                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39364                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39365                                  ;
 39366                                  ; Returns:
 39367                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39368                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39369                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39370                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39371                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39372                                  ; =========================================================================
 39373                                  ;
 39374                                  ;   Revision history:
 39375                                  ;
 39376                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39377                                  ;
 39378                                  ; =========================================================================
 39379                                  
 39380                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39381                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39382                                  
 39383                                  ; =========================================================================
 39384

 39386                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 39387                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 39388                                  ;%out
 39389                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 39390                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 39391                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 39392                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 39393                                  ;ENDIF

 39417                                  
 39418                                  EXEC001S:
 39419                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 39420                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 39421                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 39422                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 39423                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 39424                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD

 39427                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 39428                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 39429                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 39430                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 39431                                  	;
 39432                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 39433                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 39434                                  
 39435                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 39436                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 39437                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 39438                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]
 39439                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 39440                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 39441                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 39442                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 39443                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 39444                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 39445                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 39446                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 39447                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 39448                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 39449                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 39450                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 39451                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 39452                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]
 39453                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 39454                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39455                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]

 39458                                  	; ==================================================================
 39459                                  	; validate function
 39460                                  	; ==================================================================
 39461                                  		      	
 39462                                  	; M068 - Start
 39463                                  	;
 39464                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 39465                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39466                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 39467                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39468                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39469                                  
 39470                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39471 0000683A 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39472                                  
 39473                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 39474                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39475                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39476                                  
 39477 00006840 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 39478                                  	;jne	short @f
 39479 00006842 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39480                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39481 00006844 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39482 00006845 B9[0A04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39483 00006848 51                      	push	cx
 39484                                  ;@@:
 39485                                  Exec_@f:
 39486                                  	; M068 - End
 39487                                  	
 39488                                  	;Enter
 39489                                  
 39490 00006849 55                      	push	bp
 39491 0000684A 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39492                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 39493                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39494                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 6.22 & PCDOS 7.1 ; 07/03/2024
 39495                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39496                                  	; 20/05/2019
 39497 0000684C 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0
 39498                                  
 39499                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39500 0000684F 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 39501                                  					; M030
 39502 00006851 7611                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39503                                  
 39504                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 39505                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 39506                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39507                                  
 39508                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 39509                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 39510                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 39511                                  	; 01/07/2024
 39512 00006853 E878AA                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk

 39515 00006856 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function

 39545 00006876 8846FB                  	mov	Exec_Func,AL
 39546                                  	;mov	byte [bp-6],0
 39547 00006879 C646FA00                	mov	Exec_Load_High,0

 39550 0000687D 8956E6                  	mov	ExecNameL,DX		; set up length of exec name
 39551                                  	;mov	[bp-24],ds
 39552 00006880 8C5EE8                  	mov	ExecNameH,DS

 39554                                  	;invoke	DStrLen
 39555 00006885 E840AF                  	call	DStrLen
 39556                                  	;mov	[bp-22],cx
 39557 00006888 894EEA                  	mov	ExecNameLen,CX		; save length
 39558                                  
 39559                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39560 0000688B 36A0[0203]              	mov	al,[ss:AllocMethod]	; M063: save alloc method in 
 39561 0000688F 36A2[8400]              	mov	[ss:ALLOCMSAVE],al	; M063: AllocMsave
 39562                                  
 39563                                  	;xor	AL,AL			; open for reading
 39564                                  	; 07/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39565                                  	;;;
 39566 00006893 B0A0                    	mov	al,0A0h			; Access mode bits: (0 to 2)
 39567                                  					; 000  read access
 39568                                  
 39569                                  					; Sharing mode bits: (4 to 6)
 39570                                  					; 010  deny others write access
 39571

 39573                                  	;;;

 39575 00006895 55                      	push	BP
 39576                                  
 39577                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39578                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],1
 39579 00006896 36800E[8600]01          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECOPEN ; this flag is set to indicate to 
 39580                                  					; the redir that this open call is
 39581                                  					; due to an exec.
 39582

 41068                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41069                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41070                                  ;
 41071                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41072                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41073                                  ;
 41074                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41075                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41076                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41077                                  ;
 41078                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41079                                  
 41080                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41081                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41082                                  
 41083                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41084                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41085                                  
 41086                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41087                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41088                                  
 41089                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41090 00006E46 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41091                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41092 00006E47 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41093 00006E4D 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41094 00006E52 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41095 00006E55 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41096                                  
 41097 00006E57 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41098                                  
 41099                                  Keep_Shrink:
 41100 00006E5A 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 41101 00006E5C 53                      	push	BX
 41102 00006E5D 06                      	push	ES
 41103 00006E5E E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41104 00006E61 1F                      	pop	DS
 41105 00006E62 5B                      	pop	BX
 41106 00006E63 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41107                                  
 41108 00006E65 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41109 00006E67 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41110                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41111 00006E69 A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41112                                  
 41113                                  Keep_Done:
 41114 00006E6C 58                      	pop	AX
 41115 00006E6D EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 41116

 41152                                  	; IBMDOSDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 6375h

 41170                                  
 41171                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41172                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41173                                  ; Inputs:
 41174                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41175                                  ; Function:
 41176                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41177                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41178                                  ; Returns:
 41179                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41180                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41181                                  
 41182                                  _$ABORT:
 41183 00006EA2 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41184                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41185                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 41186 00006EA4 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41187                                  
 41188                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41189                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41190                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41191                                  
 41192                                  abort_inner:
 41193 00006EAA 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 41194 00006EAF 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 41195 00006EB3 E8D595                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 41196                                  
 41197                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 41198 00006EB6 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 41199 00006EB9 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 41200 00006EBB 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 41201                                  	;mov	si,10
 41202 00006EBD BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 41203                                  	;mov	di,88h
 41204 00006EC0 BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 41205 00006EC3 A5                      	movsw
 41206 00006EC4 A5                      	movsw
 41207 00006EC5 A5                      	movsw
 41208 00006EC6 A5                      	movsw
 41209 00006EC7 A5                      	movsw
 41210 00006EC8 A5                      	movsw
 41211 00006EC9 E975EF                  	jmp	reset_environment
 41212

 41241                                  
 41242                                  ;**
 41243                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 41244                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 41245                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 41246                                  ;
 41247                                  ;	Memory related system calls and low level routines for MSDOS 2.X.
 41248                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 41249                                  ;
 41250                                  ;	$ALLOC
 41251                                  ;	$SETBLOCK
 41252                                  ;	$DEALLOC
 41253                                  ;	$AllocOper
 41254                                  ;	arena_free_process
 41255                                  ;	arena_next
 41256                                  ;	check_signature
 41257                                  ;	Coalesce
 41258                                  ;
 41259                                  ;	Modification history:
 41260                                  ;
 41261                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 41262                                  ;
 41263                                  ;	    Revision: M000 - added support for allocing UMBs. 7/9/90
 41264                                  ;		      M003 - added support for link/unlink UMBs from
 41265                                  ;			     DOS arena chain. 7/18/90
 41266                                  ;		      M009 - Added error returns invalid function and 
 41267                                  ;			     arena trashed in set link state call.
 41268                                  ;		      M010 - Release UMB arenas allocated to current PDB
 41269                                  ;			     if UMB_HEAD is initialized.
 41270                                  ;

 41407                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 41408                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41409                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 41410                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41411                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 41412                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 41413                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41414                                  
 41415                                  arena_next:
 41416 00006F06 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 41417 00006F08 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 41418 00006F0C 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 41419                                  
 41420                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 41421                                  ;
 41422                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 41423                                  ;       RETN
 41424                                  
 41425                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41426                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41427                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41428                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41429                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 41430                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 41431                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 41432                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 41433                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41434                                  
 41435                                  check_signature:        
 41436                                  
 41437 00006F0D 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 41438                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 41439 00006F0F 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 41440                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 41441 00006F13 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41442                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41443 00006F15 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 41444                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 41445 00006F19 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41446 00006F1B F9                              STC                             ; set error
 41447                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 41448                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 41449                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 41450                                  check_signature_ok:
 41451                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 41452 00006F1C C3                      	RETN
 41453                                  
 41454                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 41455                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41456                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 41457                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 41458                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 41459                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 41460                                  ;
 41461                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 41462                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41463                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41464                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 41465                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 41466                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 41467                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 41468                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41469                                          
 41470                                  Coalesce:
 41471                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41472 00006F1D 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 41473                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 41474                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 41475 00006F20 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 41476 00006F22 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 41477                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 41478 00006F25 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 41479                                  
 41480                                  coalesce_check:
 41481                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 41482 00006F27 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 41483                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 41484 00006F2C 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 41485                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 41486 00006F2E 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 41487 00006F33 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 41488                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 41489 00006F34 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 41490 00006F38 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 41491 00006F3B 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 41492 00006F3D EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again

 41494                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41495                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 41496                                  
 41497                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 41498                                  
 41499                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41500                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41501                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 41502                                  ;
 41503                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 41504                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 41505                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 41506                                  ;
 41507                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 41508                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 41509                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 41510                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 41511                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 41512                                  ;
 41513                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 41514                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 41515                                  ;
 41516                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41517                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41518                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41519                                  ;           INT     21h
 41520                                  ;
 41521                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 41522                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 41523                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 41524                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 41525                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 41526                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 41527                                  ;
 41528                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 41529                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 41530                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 41531                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 41532                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 41533                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 41534                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 41535                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 41536                                  ;	USES	All
 41537                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41538                                  
 41539                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41540                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41541                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 41542                                  ;
 41543                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41544                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41545                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41546                                  ;           INT     21h
 41547                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 41548                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 41549                                  ;
 41550                                  ;   Description:
 41551                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 41552                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 41553                                  ;
 41554                                  ;   Error return:
 41555                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 41556                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41557                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41558                                  
 41559                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41560                                  
 41561                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 41897                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41898                                  
 41899                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41901                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41902                                  ;
 41903                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41904                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41905                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41906                                  ;
 41907                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41908                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41909                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41910                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41911                                  ;
 41912                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41913                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41914                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41915                                  ;		code.
 41916                                  ;
 41917                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41918                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41919                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41920                                  ;
 41921                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41922                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41923                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41924                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41925                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41926                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41927                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41928                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41929                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41930                                  
 41931                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41932                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41933                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41934                                  ;
 41935                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41936                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41937                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41938                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41939                                  ;           INT     21h
 41940                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41941                                  ;         size possible
 41942                                  ;   Error return:
 41943                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41944                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41945                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41946                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41947                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41948                                  
 41949                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41950                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41951                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41952 00007090 E805A8                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41953                                  
 41954 00007093 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 41955 00007096 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 41956 00007098 48                              DEC     AX
 41957 00007099 E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 41958 0000709C 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 41959                                  
 41960                                  setblock_bad:
 41961 0000709E E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed

 42044                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42045                                  
 42046                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42047                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42048                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42049                                  ;
 42050                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42051                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42052                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42053                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42054                                  ;           INT     21h
 42055                                  ;
 42056                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42057                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42058                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42059                                  ;
 42060                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42061                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42062                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42063                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42064                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42065                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42066                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42067                                  ;
 42068                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42069                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42070                                  ;
 42071                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42072                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42073                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42074                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42075                                  ;
 42076                                  ;
 42077                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42078                                  ;
 42079                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42080                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42081                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42082                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42083                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42084                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42085                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42086                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42087                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42088                                  ;
 42089                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42090                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42091                                  ;
 42092                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42093                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42094                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42095                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42096                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42097                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42098                                  
 42099                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42100                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42101                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42102                                  ;
 42103                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42104                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42105                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42106                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42107                                  ;           INT     21h
 42108                                  ;
 42109                                  ;   Error return:
 42110                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42111                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 42332                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42333                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42334                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42335                                  ;
 42336                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42337                                  ;
 42338                                  ;
 42339                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42340                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42341                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42342                                  ;		   else
 42343                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42344                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42345                                  ;
 42346                                  ;		   CY if error
 42347                                  ;
 42348                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42349                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42350                                  
 42351                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42352                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42353                                  
 42354                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42355                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42356                                  
 42357                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42358                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42359                                  
 42360                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42361                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42362                                  
 42363                                  GetLastArena:
 42364 00007159 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42365                                  
 42366 0000715A 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42367 0000715E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42368 00007160 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42369                                  
 42370 00007162 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42371                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42372 00007166 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42373                                  
 42374                                  GLA_next:
 42375 00007168 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42376 0000716A E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42377                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42378                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42379                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42380 0000716D 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42381                                  
 42382                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42383                                  %if 0
 42384                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42385                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42386                                  					;    umb_head
 42387                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42388                                  %else
 42389                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42390                                  	;;;
 42391 0000716F E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42392 00007172 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42393                                  	;;;
 42394                                  %endif
 42395 00007174 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42396                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42397 00007178 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42398                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42399 0000717A 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42400                                  GLA_@f:
 42401 0000717C 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42402                                  
 42403                                  GLA_done:
 42404                                  
 42405                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42406                                  %if 0
 42407                                  					; M061 - Start
 42408                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42409                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42410                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42411                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42412                                  %else
 42413                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42414                                  	;;;
 42415 0000717E E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42416 00007181 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42417                                  	;;;
 42418                                  %endif
 42419 00007183 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42420 00007185 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42421                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42422 00007188 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42423 0000718A 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42424 0000718C 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42425                                  					; M061 - End
 42426                                  GLA_ret:
 42427                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42428                                  	;clc
 42429                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42430                                  	;clc
 42431 0000718E 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 42432 0000718F C3                      	retn				; M061
 42433                                  
 42434                                  GLA_err:
 42435 00007190 F9                      	stc				; M061
 42436                                  GLA_err2:
 42437 00007191 58                      	pop	ax
 42438                                  
 42439                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 42440                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42441                                  	;;;

 42443 00007193 E84BA1                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 42444 00007196 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 42445                                  	;;;
 42446                                  
 42447                                  	; 10/03/2024
 42448                                  	;retn

 42517                                  ;
 42518                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 42519                                  ;
 42520                                  ; Inputs:
 42521                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 42522                                  ; Function:
 42523                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 42524                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 42525                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 42526                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 42527                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 42528                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 42529                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 42530                                  ;			CX User Index
 42531                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 42532                                  ;			BX = UID
 42533                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 42534                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 42535                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 42536                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 42537                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 42538                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 42539                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 42540                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 42541                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 42542                                  ;
 42543                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42544                                  
 42545                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42546                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 42547                                  
 42548                                  _$ServerCall:
 42549                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 42551                                  	; 10/06/2019
