 42869                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42870                                  
 42871                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42872                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42873                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42874                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42875                                  ;
 42876                                  ;	NOTE:
 42877                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42878                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42879                                  ;
 42880                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42881                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42882                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42883                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42884                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42885                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42886                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42887                                  
 42888                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42889                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42890                                  
 42891                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42892                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42893                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42894 000072E7 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42895                                  	
 42896                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42897 000072EC 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42898                                  
 42899                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42900 000072F1 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42901 000072F6 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42902                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42903                                  	;mov	al,6
 42904 000072F8 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42905                                  ReturnCarry:
 42906 000072FA F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42907 000072FB C3                      	retn				; go back
 42908                                  pjfn10: 
 42909                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42910 000072FC 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42911 00007301 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42912                                  	;clc
 42913                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42914 00007303 C3                      	retn
 42915                                  
 42916                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42917                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42918                                  ;
 42919                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42920                                  ;
 42921                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42922                                  ;
 42923                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42924                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42925                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42926                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42927                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42928                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42929                                  ; NOTE:
 42930                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42931                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42932                                  ;
 42933                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42934                                  
 42935                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42936                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42937                                  
 42938                                  SFFromHandle:
 42939 00007304 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42940                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42941 00007307 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42942 00007309 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42943                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42944                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42945                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42946                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42947                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42948                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42949 0000730D 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42950                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42951                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42952                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42953                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42954                                  GetSF:
 42955 0000730F 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42956 00007310 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42957 00007313 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42958 00007315 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42959 00007318 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42960 00007319 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42961                                  
 42962                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42963                                  
 42964                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42965                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42966                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42967                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42968                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42969                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42970                                  ;
 42971                                  ;   NOTE:
 42972                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42973                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42974                                  ;
 42975                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42976                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42977                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42978                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42979                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42980                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42981                                  
 42982                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42983                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42984                                  
 42985                                  SFFromSFN:
 42986                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42987                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42988 0000731A 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42989                                  
 42990                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42991 0000731F 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42992                                  sfsfn5:	
 42993                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 42994 00007324 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 42995 00007328 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 42996                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 42997 0000732A 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 42998 0000732E 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 42999                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 43000 00007331 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 43001 00007334 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 43002 00007336 F9                      	STC
 43003 00007337 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 43004                                  sfsfn7:
 43005 00007338 50                      	push	ax
 43006                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 43007                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 43008                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 43009                                  	
 43010                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43011 00007339 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 43012                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43013                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 43014                                  	
 43015 0000733B F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 43016 0000733D 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43017 0000733F 58                      	pop	ax
 43018                                  	;add	di,6
 43019 00007340 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43020 00007343 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43021                                  
 43022                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43023                                  
 43024                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43025                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43026                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43027                                  ;
 43028                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43029                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43030                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43031                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43032                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43033                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43034                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43035                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43036                                  
 43037                                  JFNFree:
 43038 00007344 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43039                                  jfnf1:	
 43040 00007346 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43041 00007349 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43042 0000734B 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43043 0000734F 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43044 00007351 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43045 00007352 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43046                                  
 43047                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43048                                  jfnf5:	
 43049                                  	;mov	al,4
 43050 00007354 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43051                                  jfnfx:	
 43052 00007356 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43053                                  
 43054                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43055                                  
 43056                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43057                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43058                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43059                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43060                                  ;
 43061                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43062                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43063                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43064                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43065                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43066                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43067                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43068                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43069                                  ;
 43070                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43071                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43072                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43073                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43074                                  ;
 43075                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43076                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43077                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43078                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43079                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43080                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43081                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43082                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43083                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43084                                  
 43085                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43086                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43087                                  
 43088                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43089                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43090                                  
 43091                                  SFNFree:
 43092                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43093                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43094                                  	;
 43095                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43096 00007357 50                      	push	ax
 43097 00007358 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43098                                  sfnf5:	
 43099 0000735A 53                      	push	bx
 43100 0000735B E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43101 0000735E 5B                      	pop	bx
 43102 0000735F 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43103 00007361 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43104                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43105 00007365 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43106                                  	
 43107                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43108 00007367 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43109                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43110 0000736B 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43111                                  sfnf7:	
 43112 0000736D 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43113 0000736E EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43114                                  
 43115                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43116                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43117                                  ;
 43118                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43119                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43120                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43121                                  
 43122                                  sfnf10:	
 43123 00007370 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43124                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43125 00007374 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43126 00007378 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43127 0000737A 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43128                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43129 0000737E 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43130 00007382 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43131                                  
 43132                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43133                                  ;
 43134                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43135                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43136                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43137                                  
 43138                                  sfnf20:
 43139                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43140                                  
 43141                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43142 00007384 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43143                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43144                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43145                                  
 43146 00007389 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43147                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43148 0000738D 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43149 00007391 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43150                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43151 00007395 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43152                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43153                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43154                                  	;pop	ax
 43155                                  	;;clc
 43156                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43157                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43158 00007399 58                      	pop	ax
 43159                                  	;clc
 43160 0000739A C3                      	retn
 43161                                  
 43162                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43163                                  ;
 43164                                  ;	'C' set
 43165                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43166                                  
 43167                                  sfnf95: 
 43168 0000739B 58                      	pop	ax
 43169                                  
 43170                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43171                                  %if 0
 43172                                  	;mov	al,4
 43173                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43174                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43175                                  %else
 43176                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43177                                  	;;;
 43178 0000739C EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43179                                  	;;;
 43180                                  %endif
 43181

 43189                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43190                                  
 43191                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43192                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43193                                  ;
 43194                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43195                                  ;
 43196                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43197                                  ;		path
 43198                                  ;
 43199                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43200                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43201                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43202                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43203                                  ;
 43204                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43205                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>

 43219                                  _$CLOSE:
 43220                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43221                                  
 43222 0000739E E8F602                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry

 43225 000073A4 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE

 43227 000073A9 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43228                                  
 43229                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43230                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43231                                  ;
 43232                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43233                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43234                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.

 43237 000073AD 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?

 43246                                  
 43247                                  ; The JFN must be freed. Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 43248                                  ; -1.
 43249

 43252 000073C0 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN

 43255                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!

 43260                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!

 44322                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44323                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44324                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44325                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44326                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44327                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44328                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44329                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44330                                  ;
 44331                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44332                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44333                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44334                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44335                                  ;	USES	none
 44336                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44337                                  
 44338                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44339                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44340                                  CheckOwner:
 44341                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44342                                  
 44343 00007697 E86AFC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 44344 0000769A 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44345                                  
 44346 0000769C 50                      	push	ax
 44347                                  
 44348                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44349

 44351                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.

 44383                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018

 44386                                  
 44387                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44388                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44389                                  
 44390                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44391                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44392                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44393                                  
 44394                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44395                                  ;
 44396                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44397                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44398                                  ;	InitCDS
 44399                                  ;	$UserOper
 44400                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44401                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44402                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44403                                  ;
 44404                                  ;   Revision history:
 44405                                  ;
 44406                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44407                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44408                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44409                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44410                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44411                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44412                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44413                                  ;
 44414                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44415                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44416                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44417                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44418                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44419                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44420                                  ;
 44421                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44422                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44423                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44424                                  ;
 44425                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44426                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44427                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44428                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44429                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44430                                  ;
 44431                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44432                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 44433                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 44434                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 44435                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 44436                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 44437                                  ;
 44438                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 44439                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 44440                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 44441                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 44442                                  ;   number.
 44443                                  ;
 44444                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 44445                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 44446                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 44447                                  ;   TransPath.
 44448                                  ;
 44449                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 44450                                  
 44451                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 44452                                  
 44453                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 44454                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 44455                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 44456                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 44457                                  ;					; current drive)
 44458                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 44459                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 44460                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 44461                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 44462                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 44463                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 44464                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 44465                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 44466                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error

 44468                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 44469                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44470                                  ; Inputs:
 44471                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 44472                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 44473                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 44474                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 44475                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 44476                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 44477                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 44478                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 44479                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 44480                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 44481                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44482                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 44483                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 44484                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44485                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 44486                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 44487                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 44488                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 44489                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 44490                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 44491                                  ; Function:
 44492                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 44493                                  ; Returns:
 44494                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 44495                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44496

 44568                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 44569                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44570                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 44571                                  ;
 44572                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 44573                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 44574                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 44575                                  ;		'C' clear
 44576                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 44577                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags
 44578                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44579                                  
 44580                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44581                                  FIND_DPB:
 44582 000076F1 36C536[2600]            	LDS	SI,[SS:DPBHEAD]		;smr;SS Override
 44583                                  fdpb5:	
 44584 000076F6 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1
 44585 000076F9 7409                    	JZ	short fdpb10
 44586 000076FB 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si]
 44587                                  	;CMP	AL,[SI+DPB.DRIVE]
 44588 000076FD 7406                    	jz	short ret_label15	; Carry clear (retz)
 44589                                  	;;lds	si,[si+18h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44590                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 44591 000076FF C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]

 44668                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 44669                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44670                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 44671                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 44672                                  ;
 44673                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 44674                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 44675                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 44676                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 44677                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 44678                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 44679                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 44680                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 44681                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number

 44683                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word

 44980                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 44981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44982                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 44983                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 44984                                  ;
 44985                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 44986                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 44987                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 44988                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 44989                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 44990                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 44991                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44992                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44993                                  
 44994                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44995                                  TransFCB:
 44996                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44997                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44998                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 44999                                  	;ENTER
 45000 0000782D 55                      	push	bp
 45001 0000782E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 45002                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 45003 00007830 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 45004 00007833 16                      	push	ss
 45005 00007834 07                      	pop	es
 45006 00007835 06                      	push	es
 45007 00007836 57                      	push	di
 45008                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45009                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 45010 00007837 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 45011 0000783A 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 45012 00007840 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45013 00007846 E8B7A9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 45014                                  	; 06/12/2022
 45015 00007849 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 45016 0000784B 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45017 0000784E 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45018 00007852 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45019                                  GetDrive:
 45020 00007858 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 45021 00007859 E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 45022 0000785C 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 45023 0000785E E86F03                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 45024                                  
 45025                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 45026                                  
 45027                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 45028 00007861 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 45029 00007864 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 45030                                  FCBScan:
 45031 00007865 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 45032                                  	
 45033                                  	; 09/08/2018
 45034                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 45035                                  	;es	xlat
 45036                                  
 45037                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 45038 00007866 E8B8E1                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 45039                                  
 45040                                  	;test	al,8	
 45041 00007869 A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 45042 0000786B 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 45043                                  NextCh:

 45045 0000786F 5E                      	pop	si
 45046 00007870 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 45047 00007872 E8E8AD                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 45048 00007875 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45049 00007876 07                      	pop	es
 45050 00007877 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45051 00007878 1F                      	pop	ds

 45053                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname

 45055 0000787C 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 45056 0000787F 7407                    	jz	short BadPack

 45071                                  
 45072                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45073                                  
 45074                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45076                                  ;
 45077                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45078                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45079                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45080                                  ;       exactly.
 45081                                  ;
 45082                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45083                                  ;       matches splice.
 45084                                  ;
 45085                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45086                                  ;
 45087                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45088                                  ;
 45089                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45090                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45091                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45092                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45093                                  ;
 45094                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45095                                  ;
 45096                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45097                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45098                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45099                                  ;
 45100                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45101                                  ;
 45102                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45103                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45104                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45105                                  ;           splice
 45106                                  ;           fatRead
 45107                                  ;           return
 45108                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45109                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45110                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45111                                  ;           return
 45112                                  ;       if device then
 45113                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45114                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45115                                  ;           return
 45116                                  ;       if file then
 45117                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45118                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45119                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45120                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45121                                  ;           splice
 45122                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45123                                  ;           if local then
 45124                                  ;               fatread
 45125                                  ;           return
 45126                                  ;
 45127                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45128                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45129                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45130                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45131                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45132                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45133                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45134                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45135                                  ;
 45136                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45137                                  
 45138                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45139                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45140                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45141                                  
 45142                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45143                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45144                                  
 45145                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45146                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45147                                  
 45148                                  TransPath:
 45149 0000788F 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45150 00007891 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45151                                  TransPathSet:
 45152 00007893 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45153                                  SetSplice:
 45154 00007895 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override
 45155 00007899 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45156                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45157 0000789B 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override
 45158 0000789F 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45159 000078A5 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45160 000078AA 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45161 000078B1 16                      	push	ss
 45162 000078B2 07                      	pop	es
 45163                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45164 000078B3 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45165                                  ;
 45166                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45167                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45168                                  ;
 45169                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45170                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45171                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45172                                  	;;;
 45173 000078B7 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45174 000078BD 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45175                                  	;;;
 45176                                  ;
 45177                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45178                                  ;
 45179 000078BF E8F802                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45180 000078C2 E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45181 000078C5 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 45182 000078C7 E80603                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 45183 000078CA 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45184 000078CD E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45185 000078D0 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45186                                  ;
 45187                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45188                                  ;
 45189 000078D2 16                      	push	ss
 45190 000078D3 1F                      	pop	ds
 45191 000078D4 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45192 000078D8 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45193 000078DD 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45194 000078DF E82D02                  	CALL    Splice
 45195                                  NoServerSplice:
 45196 000078E2 16                      	push	ss
 45197 000078E3 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45198 000078E4 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45199 000078E8 E8AD9F                  	call	ECritDisk
 45200 000078EB E8BFE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45201 000078EE E8D49F                  	call	LCritDisk
 45202                                  NoPath:
 45203                                  	;mov	al,3
 45204 000078F1 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45205 000078F3 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45206                                  
 45207                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45208                                  ; the name if so.
 45209                                  
 45210                                  CheckUNC:
 45211 000078F4 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45212                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45213 000078FB B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45214 000078FE CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45215                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45216                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45217                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45218 00007900 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45219                                  
 45220                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45221                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45222                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45223                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45224                                  
 45225                                  NO_CHECK:
 45226 00007902 E8B502                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45227 00007905 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45228 00007906 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45229 00007908 E831E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45230 0000790B 86C4                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45231 0000790D E82CE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45232 00007910 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45233 00007912 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45234 00007914 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45235                                  
 45236                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45237                                  ; local machine root path
 45238                                  
 45239 00007916 58                      	POP     AX
 45240 00007917 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45241                                  UNCCpy:
 45242 00007918 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45243 00007919 E8CDE0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45244 0000791C 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45245 0000791E 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45246 00007920 E819E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45247 00007923 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45248 00007925 AA                      	STOSB
 45249 00007926 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45250 00007928 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45251                                  UNCDone:
 45252 0000792B 16                      	push	ss
 45253 0000792C 1F                      	pop	ds
 45254 0000792D C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45255                                  UNCTerm:
 45256 0000792E AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45257 0000792F EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45258                                  
 45259                                  CheckDevice:
 45260                                  
 45261                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45262                                  
 45263 00007931 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45264 00007932 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 45265 00007935 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 45266                                  	;mov	al,2 
 45267 00007937 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 45268 00007939 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 45269 0000793A C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 45270                                  CheckPath:
 45271 0000793B 50                      	push	ax
 45272 0000793C 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 45273                                  
 45274                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45275                                  %if 0
 45276                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45277                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45278                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45279                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45280                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45281                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45282                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45283                                  ;;;
 45284                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45285                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45286                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45287                                  ;;;
 45288                                  ;;;More info:
 45289                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45290                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45291                                  ;;;
 45292                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45293                                  start5Dhack:
 45294                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45295                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45296                                  
 45297                                  %endif
 45298                                  
 45299                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45300                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BECBh
 45301                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC47h)
 45302                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6C2h))
 45303                                  %if 0
 45304                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45305                                  %else
 45306                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45307                                  
 45308                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45309                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 45310 0000793D E8C0D3                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 45311                                  %endif
 45312 00007940 5D                      	pop	bp
 45313 00007941 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 45314 00007942 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 45315                                  
 45316                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 45317                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 45318                                  ; call.
 45319                                  
 45320 00007944 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 45321 0000794A E871FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 45322 0000794D 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 45323                                  
 45324                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 45325                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 45326                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 45327                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 45328                                  ; a device.
 45329                                  
 45330 00007953 E87A02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 45331 00007956 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 45332 00007958 AA                      	STOSB
 45333 00007959 E8469E                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 45334                                  
 45335 0000795C F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 45336 0000795D 16                      	push	ss
 45337 0000795E 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 45338                                  DoFile_retn:
 45339 0000795F C3                      	retn
 45340                                  
 45341                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45342                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BEEEh
 45343                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC6Ah)
 45344                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6F2h))
 45345                                  ;%if 1
 45346                                  
 45347                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45348                                  %if 0
 45349                                  
 45350                                  no5Dshere:
 45351                                  	; 10/08/2018
 45352                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 45353                                  %endif
 45354                                  
 45355                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 45356                                  
 45357                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 45358                                  
 45359                                  DoFile:
 45360                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45361                                  
 45362 00007960 E83FFE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 45363                                  	;mov	al,3 
 45364 00007963 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 45365 00007965 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 45366                                  
 45367                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 45368                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 45369                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 45370                                  
 45371                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 45372 00007967 1E                      	push	ds
 45373 00007968 56                      	push	si
 45374 00007969 06                      	push	es
 45375 0000796A 57                      	push	di
 45376 0000796B E8C5D2                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 45377                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 45378 0000796E 5F                      	pop	di
 45379 0000796F 07                      	pop	es
 45380 00007970 5E                      	pop	si
 45381 00007971 1F                      	pop	ds
 45382                                  	;mov	al,3
 45383 00007972 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45384                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 45385 00007974 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45386                                  
 45387                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 45388                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 45389                                  
 45390 00007976 1E                      	push	ds
 45391 00007977 56                      	push	si
 45392 00007978 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 45393 0000797D 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 45394                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45395 0000797F 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 45396                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45397 00007982 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 45398                                  					;AN000;
 45399 00007986 E8289E                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 45400 00007989 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 45401                                  
 45402                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 45403                                  
 45404 0000798A B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 45405 0000798C 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 45406 00007990 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 45407 00007992 AA                      	STOSB
 45408                                  
 45409                                  ; Now get original string.
 45410                                  
 45411                                  GetOrig:
 45412 00007993 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 45413 00007994 5E                      	pop	si
 45414 00007995 1F                      	pop	ds
 45415                                  
 45416                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 45417                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 45418                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 45420 00007996 E8CE00                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 45421 00007999 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 45422 0000799B 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 45423 0000799D 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 45424                                  ;
 45425                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 45426                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 45427                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 45428                                  ;
 45429 0000799F 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 45430                                  SkipPath:
 45431 000079A1 AC                      	LODSB
 45432 000079A2 E897E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45433 000079A5 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 45434 000079A7 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45435 000079A8 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45436 000079AA 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 45437                                  
 45438                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 45439                                  ; for yucks.
 45440                                  
 45441                                  PathAssure:
 45442 000079AC B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 45443 000079AE AA                      	STOSB
 45444                                  
 45445                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 45446                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 45447                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 45448                                  
 45449                                  DoCanon:
 45450 000079AF E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 45451                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 45452 000079B2 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45453                                  
 45454                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 45455                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 45456                                  ; buffer.
 45457                                  
 45458 000079B4 16                      	push	ss
 45459 000079B5 1F                      	pop	ds
 45460 000079B6 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 45461 000079BA C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 45462 000079BE E81702                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 45463 000079C1 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 45464                                  
 45465                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 45466                                  
 45467 000079C3 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 45468 000079C6 E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 45469 000079C9 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 45470                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 45471 000079CB 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 45472 000079CF 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 45473 000079D1 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 45474 000079D2 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 45475                                  
 45476                                  ; Splice the result.
 45477                                  
 45478                                  DoSplice:
 45479 000079D7 16                      	push	ss
 45480 000079D8 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 45481 000079D9 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 45482 000079DD 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45483 000079DF F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45484 000079E4 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 45485 000079E6 E82601                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 45486                                  SkipSplice:
 45487                                  
 45488                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 45489                                  ; device.
 45490                                  
 45491 000079E9 16                      	push	ss
 45492 000079EA 1F                      	pop	ds
 45493 000079EB C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 45494                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 45495                                  	; 17/12/2022

 45511                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 45512                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45513                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 45514                                  ;
 45515                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45516                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 45517                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 45518                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 45519                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45520                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 45521                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 45522                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 45523                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 45524                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 45525                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45526                                  
 45527                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45528                                  
 45529                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45530                                  
 45531                                  Canonicalize:
 45532                                  
 45533                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 45534                                  
 45535 00007A04 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 45536 00007A05 E834E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP

 45538 00007A0A 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 45539 00007A0C 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 45540 00007A0E AA                      	STOSB
 45541 00007A0F EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 45542                                  CanonDec:

 45544                                  
 45545                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 45546                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 45547                                  ; buffer.
 45548                                  
 45549                                  CanonLoop:
 45550                                  
 45551                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 45552                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 45553                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 45554

 45559 00007A1D 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate

 45581                                  ; it to 8.3

 45588

 45627

 45805                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 45806                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45807                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 45808                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 45809                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 45810                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 45811                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 45812                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 45813                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 45814                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 45815                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 45816                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 45817                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 45818                                  ;                   left alone
 45819                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 45820                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 45821                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45822
