 45902                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 45903                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45904                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 45905                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 45906                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 45907                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 45908                                  ;
 45909                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 45910                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 45911                                  ;   Outputs:
 45912                                  ;       Carry Clear
 45913                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 45914                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 45915                                  ;       Carry Set
 45916                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 45917                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 45918                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45919                                  
 45920                                  _$NameTrans:
 45921 00007B95 1E                      	push	ds
 45922 00007B96 56                      	push	si
 45923 00007B97 06                      	push	es

 45925 00007B99 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45926                                  	
 45927                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45928                                  ; M027 - Start
 45929                                  ;
 45930                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 45931                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 45932                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 45933                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 45934                                  ; and restore CX.
 45935                                  
 45936                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 45937 00007B9A B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 45938 00007B9C E8EE02                  	call	SetAttrib
 45939                                  
 45940                                  ; M027 - End
 45941                                  
 45942                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45943 00007B9F BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 45944 00007BA2 E8EAFC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 45945 00007BA5 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45946 00007BA6 5F                      	pop     di
 45947 00007BA7 07                      	pop	es
 45948 00007BA8 5E                      	pop     si
 45949 00007BA9 1F                      	pop     ds
 45950 00007BAA 7303                    	JNC	short TransOK
 45951 00007BAC E9DA8A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 45952                                  TransOK:
 45953 00007BAF BE[BE03]                	MOV     SI,OPENBUF
 45954 00007BB2 16                      	push	ss
 45955 00007BB3 1F                      	pop	ds
 45956                                  ;GotText:
 45957 00007BB4 E8FA9B                  	call	FStrCpy
 45958 00007BB7 E9C58A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 45960                                  ;Break   <DriveFromText - return drive number from a text string>
 45961                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45962                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 45963                                  ;   pointer.
 45964                                  ;
 45965                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to a text string
 45966                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has drive number
 45967                                  ;               DS:SI advanced
 45968                                  ;   Registers modified: AX,SI.
 45969                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45971                                  DriveFromText:

 45976 00007BBE 74D4                    	jz	short Splice_retn
 45977 00007BC0 807C013A                	CMP	BYTE [SI+1],':'		;           s[1] == ':') {
 45978 00007BC4 75CE                    	jnz	short Splice_retn
 45979 00007BC6 AD                      	LODSW                           ;           drive = (*s | 020) - 'a'+1;

 45981                                  	;sub	al,60h

 45986                                  	;dec	al ; -1
 45987 00007BCF C3                      	retn				;           }

 45989                                  ;Break   <TextFromDrive - convert a drive number to a text string>
 45990                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45991                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 45992                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 45993                                  ;
 45994                                  ;   Inputs:     AL has 0-based drive number
 45995                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI advanced
 45996                                  ;   Registers modified: AX
 45997                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45999                                  TextFromDrive:
 46000 00007BD0 FEC0                    	INC	AL
 46001                                  TextFromDrive1:

 46004 00007BD4 B43A                    	MOV	AH,":"	; 3Ah           ;   strcat (d, ":");
 46005 00007BD6 AB                      	STOSW
 46006                                  PathPref_retn:
 46007 00007BD7 C3                      	retn
 46008                                  
 46009                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 46010                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46011                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 46012                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 46013                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 46014                                  ;
 46015                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 46016                                  ;               ES:DI string
 46017                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 46018                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 46019                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 46020                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 46021                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46022                                  
 46023                                  PathPref:
 46024 00007BD8 E8ED9B                  	call	DStrLen                 ; get length
 46025 00007BDB 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 46026 00007BDC F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 46027 00007BDE 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 46028 00007BE0 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 46029 00007BE1 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 46030 00007BE4 E855DE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 46031 00007BE7 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 46032                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 46033 00007BE9 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 46034 00007BEC E87AFE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 46035                                  Prefix:
 46036 00007BEF 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 46037 00007BF0 C3                      	retn
 46038                                  
 46039                                  ;Break   <ScanPathChar - see if there is a path character in a string>
 46040                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46041                                  ;     ScanPathChar - search through the string (pointed to by DS:SI) for
 46042                                  ;     a path separator.
 46043                                  ;
 46044                                  ;     Input:    DS:SI target string (null terminated)
 46045                                  ;     Output:   Zero set => path separator encountered in string
 46046                                  ;               Zero clear => null encountered
 46047                                  ;     Registers modified: SI

 46053 00007BF5 75FA                    	JNZ	short ScanPathChar	; not \, / or NUL => go back for more

 46057 00007BF7 E942DE                  	jmp	PATHCHRCMP

 46072                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 46073                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 46074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46075                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46076                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46077                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46078                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46079                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46080                                  ;
 46081                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46082                                  ;       ------          --------
 46083                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46084                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46085                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46086                                  ;
 46087                                  ;   Error returns:
 46088                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46089                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46090                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46091                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46092                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46093                                  
 46094                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46095                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46096                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46097                                  ;
 46098                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46099                                  ;
 46100                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46101                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46102                                  ;
 46103                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46104                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46105                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46106                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46107                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46108                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46109                                  ;	USES	all
 46110                                  ;
 46111                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46112                                  
 46113                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46114                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46115                                  
 46116                                  ; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46117                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C194h
 46118                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AF10h)
 46119                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A9A7h)
 46120                                  
 46121                                  _$OPEN:       
 46122 00007BFA 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 46123                                  _$Open2:

 46125 00007BFC B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 46126 00007BFE E88C02                  	call	SetAttrib

 46131 00007C04 50                      	push	ax

 46133                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 46134                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 46135                                  ;
 46136                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 46137                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 46138                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 46139                                  ;
 46140                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 46141                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 46142                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 46143                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 46144                                  
 46145                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 46146

 46154                                  
 46155 00007C10 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override

 46157 00007C1A 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 46158                                  
 46159                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 46160                                  
 46161 00007C1F E822F7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 46162                                  	;jnc	short SaveJFN
 46163                                  	; 14/03/2024

 46166                                  ;OpenFailJ:
 46167                                  	;JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 46168                                  
 46169                                  SaveJFN:
 46170 00007C24 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 46171 00007C29 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 46172 00007C2E 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 46173                                  
 46174                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 46175                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 46176                                  
 46177 00007C33 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 46178 00007C38 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN

 46228                                  	;;mov	word [si+2], 0
 46229                                  	;;mov	word [si+33h], 0
 46230                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],0
 46231                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],0
 46232                                  
 46233                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46234                                  ;**	Check if this is an extended open. If so you must set the
 46235                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 46236                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm
 46237

 46252 00007C7F 16                      	push	ss

 46263                                  
 46264                                  OpenOK:

 46270                                  ; If the open mode is 70, we scan the system for other SFT's with the same
 46271                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already
 46272                                  ; opened one. Otherwise we use this new one. We compare uid/pid/mode/mft
 46273                                  ;

 46275                                  ; sharer.

 46357                                  ;	BREAK <$Creat - create a brand-new file>

 46359                                  ;
 46360                                  ;**	$Creat - Create a File
 46361                                  ;
 46362                                  ;	$Creat creates the directory entry specified in DS:DX and gives it the
 46363                                  ;	initial attributes contained in CX
 46364                                  ;

 46366                                  ;		(CX) = initial attributes
 46367                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 46368                                  ;		  (ax) = error code

 46402                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 46409                                  _$CHMOD:
 46410                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 46530                                  ;
 46531                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 46532                                  ;
 46533                                  ;
 46534                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 46535                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46536                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL

 46538                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 46539                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46540                                  ;
 46541                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 46542                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 46543                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 46544                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46545                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46546                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 46547                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 46548                                  ;
 46549                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46550                                  
 46551                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46552                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h
 46553

 46556 00007D45 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point at input string
 46557 00007D47 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 46558 00007D4A E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path
 46559 00007D4D 59                      	pop	cx

 46569                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 46570                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46571 00007D62 729C                    	jc	short NORERR
 46572

 46716                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 46717                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46718                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 46719                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 46720                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 46721                                  ;
 46722                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 46723                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 46724                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 46725                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 46726                                  ;		Carry Set:
 46727                                  ;		    AX has error code
 46728                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 46729                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46730                                  
 46731                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 46732 00007DDE 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 46733 00007DDF B9[D530]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 46734 00007DE2 E9F1FE                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 46735                                  
 46736                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 46737                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46738                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 46739                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 46740                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 46741                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 46742                                  ;
 46743                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 46744                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 46745                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 46746                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 46747                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46748                                  
 46749                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46750                                  ;BinToAscii:
 46751                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 46752                                  ;bta5:
 46753                                  ;	push    cx
 46754                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 46755                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 46756                                  ;	push    ax
 46757                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 46758                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 46759                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 46760                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 46761                                  ;	add     al,7
 46762                                  ;bta6: 
 46763                                  ;	stosb
 46764                                  ;	pop     ax
 46765                                  ;	pop     cx
 46766                                  ;	loop    bta5
 46767                                  ;	retn
 46768                                  
 46769                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46770                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 46771                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 46772                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 46773                                  %if 0
 46774                                  
 46775                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46776                                  BinToAscii:
 46777                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 46778                                  bta5:	
 46779                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 46780                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 46781                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 46782                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 46783                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 46784                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 46785                                  	dec	ch
 46786                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 46787                                  	retn
 46788                                  %else
 46789                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46790                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 46791                                  
 46792                                  BinToAscii:
 46793 00007DE5 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 46794 00007DE6 86C4                    	xchg	ah,al
 46795                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46796 00007DE8 D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 46797 00007DEA 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 46798 00007DED AB                      	stosw
 46799 00007DEE 58                      	pop	ax
 46800                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46801 00007DEF D410                    	aam	10h
 46802 00007DF1 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 46803 00007DF4 AB                      	stosw
 46804 00007DF5 C3                      	retn	
 46805                                  %endif
 46806                                  
 46807                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 46808                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46809                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 46810                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 46811                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 46812                                  ;
 46813                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 46814                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 46815                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 46816                                  ;		AX has handle
 46817                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 46818                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46819                                  
 46820                                  	; 10/07/2024
 46821                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46822                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46823                                  
 46824                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 46825                                  	;Enter
 46826 00007DF6 55                      	push	bp
 46827 00007DF7 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 46828                                  
 46829                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 46830                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 46831                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 46832                                  
 46833 00007DF9 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 46834                                  
 46835                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 46836 00007DFC F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 46837 00007E00 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 46838                                  
 46839                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 46840                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 46841                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 46842                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 46843                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 46844                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 46845                                  
 46846                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 46847 00007E02 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 46848 00007E05 EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 46849                                  
 46850                                  OKatts:
 46851                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 46852 00007E07 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 46853                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 46854 00007E0A 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 46855                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 46856 00007E0D 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 46857                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 46858 00007E10 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 46859 00007E13 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46860 00007E14 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 46861 00007E15 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 46862 00007E17 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 46863 00007E19 F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 46864                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46865 00007E1B 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 46866 00007E1D 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 46867                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 46868                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46869                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46870 00007E1F 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 46871                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 46872                                  okok:					;AN000;
 46873 00007E20 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 46874 00007E22 F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 46875                                  					;AN000;

 46890 00007E31 897EFC                  	mov	[bp-4],di ; !Fix!
 46891                                  CreateLoop:
 46892 00007E34 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 46893 00007E35 1F                      	pop	ds
 46894 00007E36 55                      	push	bp
 46895 00007E37 E8418D                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 46896 00007E3A 5D                      	pop	bp
 46897                                  ;
 46898                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 46899                                  ;
 46900                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 46901 00007E3B C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]

 46914 00007E55 5D                      	pop	bp

 46916                                  
 46917                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 46918                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 46919                                  
 46920                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 46921                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 46922                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists
 46923                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; file existed => try with new name
 46924                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_access_denied
 46925                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; access denied (attr mismatch)
 46926                                  
 46927                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46928                                  	;cmp	al,50h

 46930 00007E5A 74D8                    	JZ	short CreateLoop	; Y: try again

 46933 00007E5E 7521                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 46934                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 46935                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 46936                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 46937                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 46938                                  					;    so.
 46939                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46940                                  %if 0
 46941                                  	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 46942                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 46943                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 46944                                  ;M070
 46945                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 46946                                  ;
 46947                                  	cmp	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_FAIL_I24 ;User failed on I24? ;M070
 46948                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 46949                                  
 46950                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 46951                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46952                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 46953                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46954                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 46955                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 46956                                  %else
 46957                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46958                                  	;;;

 46960 00007E64 3C41                    	cmp	al,41h			; error_net_access_denied
 46961 00007E66 7419                    	je	short SETTMPERR

 46974                                  %endif

 46989                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 46990                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 46991                                  ;   serverdoscall.
 46992                                  ;
 46993                                  ;   Inputs:	fSharing == FALSE => set sattrib to CH
 46994                                  ;		fSharing == TRUE => set sattrib to CL

 47024                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 47025                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47026                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 47027                                  ;	 BX= mode
 47028                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 47029                                  ;	 DX= flag
 47030                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 47031                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 47032                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 47033                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 47034                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 47035                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 47036                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 47037                                  ; Output: carry clear
 47038                                  ;		     AX= handle
 47039                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 47040                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 47041                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 47042                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 47043                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47044                                  
 47045                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47046                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 47266                                  
 47267                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 47268                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47269                                  ;
 47270                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47271                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47272                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47273                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47274                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47275                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47276                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47277                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47278                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47279                                  ;
 47280                                  ;   Error returns:
 47281                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47282                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47283                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47284                                  ;
 47285                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47286                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47287                                  ;
 47288                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47289                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47290                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47291                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47292                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 47293                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 47294                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 47295                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 47296                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 47297                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 47298                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47299                                  ;
 47300                                  ;   Error returns:
 47301                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47302                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47303                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47304                                  ;
 47305                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47306                                  
 47307                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47308

 47747                                  	;mov	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0
 47748 0000809A 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx ; 0
 47749                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+11h]
 47750 0000809E 268B5611                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 47751 000080A2 EB0C                    	jmp     short sharev_2
 47752                                  sharev_1:
 47753                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 47754 000080A4 268B562B                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 47755 000080A8 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx
 47756                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+29h]
 47757 000080AC 268B5629                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR]
 47758                                  sharev_2: 
 47759                                  	;;;
 47760 000080B0 E8F3DB                  	call	HARDERR
 47761                                  ; 01/07/2024
 47762                                  %if 0
 47763                                  	POP	DI
 47764                                  	POP	ES
 47765                                  	POP	DS
 47766                                  	CMP	AL,1
 47767                                  	jz	short shchk_retn	; 1 = retry, carry clear
 47768                                  	STC
 47769                                  	retn
 47770                                  %else
 47771 000080B3 EBAD                    	jmp	short sharev_3
 47772                                  %endif
 47773                                  
 47774                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47775                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 47776                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 47777                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 47778                                  ;
 47779                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 47780                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 47781                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 47782                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47783                                  
 47784                                  ShareEnd:
 47785                                  	; 26/07/2019
 47786 000080B5 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 47787 000080B9 C3                      	retn
 47788                                  
 47789                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 47790                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47791                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 47792                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 47793                                  ;
 47794                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 47795                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 47796                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 47797                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 47798                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47799                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47800                                  
 47801                                  ShareEnter:
 47802 000080BA 51                      	push	cx
 47803                                  retry:
 47804 000080BB 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 47805                                  attempt:
 47806 000080BF C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 47807 000080C3 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 47808                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 47809 000080C5 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 47810 000080C9 51                      	push	cx
 47811 000080CA E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 47812 000080CD 59                      	pop	cx
 47813 000080CE 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 47814 000080D0 E80297                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 47815 000080D3 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 47816 000080D5 E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 47817 000080D8 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 47818                                  done:
 47819 000080DA 59                      	pop	cx
 47820 000080DB C3                      	retn
 47821                                  
 47822                                  ;============================================================================
 47823                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47824                                  ;============================================================================
 47825                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47826                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 47827                                  
 47828                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 47829                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47830                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 47831                                  ;
 47832                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 47833                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 47834                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 47835                                  ;
 47836                                  ;	Revision history:
 47837                                  ;
 47838                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 47839                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47840                                  
 47841                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47842                                  ;
 47843                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 47844                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 47845                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 47846                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 47847                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 47848                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 47849                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 47850                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 47851                                  ;
 47852                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47853                                  
 47854                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 47855                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 47856                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 47857                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 47858                                  
 47859                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 47860                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47861                                  
 47862                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 47863                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 47864                                  
 47865                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 47866                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 47867                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 47868                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 47869                                  
 47870                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 47871                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47872                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 47873                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 47874                                  
 47875                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 47876                                  ;
 47877                                  ;struc ERStruc
 47878                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 47879                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 47880                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 47881                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 47882                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 47883                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 47884                                  ; .size:
 47885                                  ;endstruc
 47886                                  
 47887                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 47888                                  
 47889                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47890                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47891                                  
 47892                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47893                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47894                                  
 47895                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47896                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 47897                                  
 47898                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 47899                                  
 47900                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47901                                  ;
 47902                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 47903                                  ;
 47904                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 47905                                  ;
 47906                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47907                                  
 47908                                  ExecReady:
 47909 000080DC 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 47910                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47911                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47912 000080DE F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47913                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 47914 000080E2 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 47915                                  
 47916                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47917 000080E4 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47918 000080E7 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 47919 000080EA 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 47920                                  
 47921                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 47922 000080EC 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 47923                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 47924 000080EF 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 47925                                  
 47926                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 47927 000080F2 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 47928                                  	
 47929                                  	; 20/03/2024
 47930                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47931 000080F7 36FF16[4612]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 47932                                  
 47933                                  er_setver:
 47934                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 47935                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47936 000080FC F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 47937                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 47938 00008100 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 47939                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 47940 00008102 1E                      	push	ds
 47941 00008103 56                      	push	si
 47942                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 47943 00008104 C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 47944 00008107 E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 47945 0000810A E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 47946 0000810D 5E                      	pop	si
 47947 0000810E 1F                      	pop	ds
 47948                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 47949 0000810F 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47950 00008112 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 47951                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 47952 00008116 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 47953                                  
 47954                                  er_chkdoshi:
 47955 0000811A 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 47956 00008120 741E                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 47957                                  
 47958                                  					; M068 - Start
 47959                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47960 00008122 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 47961                                  
 47962                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 47963 00008125 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 47964                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 47965                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 47966                                  					; explanation
 47967                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47968                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47969 0000812B F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47970                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 47971 0000812F 7506                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 47972                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 47973                                     	; 07/03/2025
 47974                                  	;push	ds
 47975                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 47976                                  	;call	IsCopyProt ; !*!	; check if copy protected
 47977                                  	;pop	ds
 47978                                  
 47979                                  	; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS 1.0)
 47980 00008131 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; *!*
 47981                                  
 47982                                  er_setA20:
 47983                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 47984                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 47985                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 47986                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 47987                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 47988                                  
 47989 00008137 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 47990 0000813C 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 47991                                  					; turned OFF.
 47992                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 47993 00008140 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 47994 00008142 C3                      	retn
 47995

 48010                                  ; temp iret instruction

 48015                                  initiret: ; MSDOS 6.0

 48018 00008143 CF                      	iret
 48019                                  
 48020                                  ; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48021                                  
 48022                                  ; pointer to the BIOS data segment that will be available just to the
 48023                                  ; initialization code
 48024                                  
 48025 00008144 7000                    InitBioDataSeg:	dw 70h ; KERNEL_SEGMENT = 0070h
 48026                                  
 48027                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48028                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48029                                  
 48030                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48031                                  ; DOSCODE:CCE1h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48032                                  
 48033                                  ; Convert AX from a number of bytes to a number of paragraphs (round up).
 48034                                  
 48035                                  ParaRound:
 48036 00008146 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 48037 00008149 D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 48038 0000814B D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48039 0000814D D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48040 0000814F D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48041 00008151 C3                      	retn

 48050                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48051                                  ;
 48052                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 48053                                  ;
 48054                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 48055                                  ;
 48056                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 48057                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 48058                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 48059                                  ;
 48060                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 48061                                  ;
 48062                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48063                                  
 48064                                  WhatCPUType:
 48065                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48066                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 48067                                  
 48068                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48069                                  
 48070                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 48071                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 48072                                  ;
 48073                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 48074                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 48075                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 48076                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 48077                                  
 48078                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48079                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 48080                                  
 48081                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48082                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 48083                                  
 48084                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 48085 00008152 9C                      	pushf
 48086 00008153 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 48087 00008154 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 48088                                  
 48089 00008156 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 48090 00008158 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 48091 00008159 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 48092 0000815A 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 48093 0000815B 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 48094 0000815C 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 48095 0000815F 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 48096 00008162 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 48097                                  
 48098 00008164 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 48099 00008167 50                      	push	ax
 48100 00008168 9D                      	popf
 48101 00008169 9C                      	pushf
 48102 0000816A 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 48103 0000816B 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 48104 0000816E 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 48105                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 48106 00008170 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 48107                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 48108 00008171 43                      	inc	bx
 48109                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 48110 00008172 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 48111 00008174 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 48112 00008175 9D                      	popf
 48113                                  	
 48114                                  	;endm
 48115                                  
 48116                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48117 00008176 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 48118                                  
 48119                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48120                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022
 48121

 48123                                  
 48124                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION
 48125                                  
 48126                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48127                                  	; DOSCODE:B779h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48128                                  
 48129                                  	; 23/03/2024
 48130                                  	; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48131                                  	; DOSCODE:CCEDh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48132                                  
 48133                                  	; DOSCODE:BA57h (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 48134                                  	; BIOSCODE:CF81h (Windows ME IO.SYS)
 48135                                  	
 48136                                  	; 30/05/2019
 48137                                  	; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48138                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 48139                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 48140                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48141                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 48142                                  DOSINIT:
 48143                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 48144                                  	;
 48145                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 48146                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 48147                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 48148                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 48149                                  	;
 48150                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 48151                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 48152                                  
 48153 00008177 FA                              CLI
 48154 00008178 FC                              CLD
 48155                                  
 48156                                  	; 03/11/2022
 48157                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 48158                                  	
 48159                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48160                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48161                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 48162                                  	
 48163 00008179 56                      	push	si
 48164 0000817A 1E                      	push	ds
 48165 0000817B 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 48166                                  
 48167 0000817C 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 48168                                  
 48169                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 48170                                  
 48171                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 48172                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 48173                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48174                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 48175 0000817E B8[EE85]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 48176                                  
 48177                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48178 00008181 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 48179                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 48180                                  	; 12/04/2024
 48181 00008184 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 48182                                  
 48183 00008186 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 48184                                  					; code segment
 48185                                  	; 05/12/2022
 48186                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48187                                  	;xor	si,si
 48188                                  	
 48189                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 48190                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 48191                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 48192                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48193 00008188 0E                      	push	cs
 48194 00008189 1F                      	pop	ds
 48195                                  
 48196                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 48197                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 48198                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 48199                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 48200                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48201 0000818A 8E06[4481]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 48202                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48203                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 48204                                  
 48205                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 48206 0000818E 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 48207                                  
 48208 00008193 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; ES:DI now points to RAM data
 48209                                  
 48210                                  	;mov	cx,4970  ; Offset 0BA78h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48211                                  	;mov	cx,4976  ; 25/05/2019
 48212                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48213                                  	;mov	cx,4934	 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 48214                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48215                                  	;mov	cx,4962
 48216                                  	;mov	cx,MSDAT001E		; get end of dosdata = size of dosdata

 49064                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49065                                  ;
 49066                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49067                                  ;
 49068                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49069                                  ;
 49070                                  ;	USED:	none
 49071                                  ;
 49072                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49073                                  
 49074                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49075                                  ;
 49076                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49077                                  ;
 49078 00008475 50                      	push	ax
 49079                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49080 00008476 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49081 00008479 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49082                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49083                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49084                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49085 0000847B 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49086 0000847D 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49087                                  ;
 49088                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49089                                  ; need to call it later.
 49090                                  ;
 49091 0000847F 53                      	push	bx
 49092 00008480 52                      	push	dx
 49093 00008481 1E                      	push	ds
 49094 00008482 06                      	push	es
 49095                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49096 00008483 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49097 00008486 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49098                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49099                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49100                                  
 49101 00008488 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49102                                  
 49103 0000848D 891E[4D10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49104 00008491 8C06[4F10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49105                                  cXMMexit:
 49106 00008495 F8                      	clc
 49107 00008496 07                      	pop	es
 49108 00008497 1F                      	pop	ds
 49109 00008498 5A                      	pop	dx
 49110 00008499 5B                      	pop	bx
 49111 0000849A 58                      	pop	ax
 49112 0000849B C3                      	retn				; done
 49113                                  ;
 49114                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49115                                  ;
 49116                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49117 0000849C F9                      	stc
 49118 0000849D 58                      	pop	ax
 49119 0000849E C3                      	retn

 49121                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49122                                  ;
 49123                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49124                                  ;
 49125                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49126                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49127                                  ;
 49128                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49129                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49130                                  ;		      if first entry
 49131                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49132                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49133                                  ;		      else
 49134                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49135                                  ;
 49136                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49137                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49138                                  ;
 49139                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49140                                  ;
 49141                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx

 49621                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49622                                  ;
 49623                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49624                                  ;
 49625                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49626                                  ;
 49627                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49628                                  ;
 49629                                  ;	Description:
 49630                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49631                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49632                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 49633                                  ;
 49634                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49635                                  
 49636                                  	; 04/11/2022

 49788                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 49789                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 49790                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 49791                                  ;

 49793                                  ; describing that data item.

 49888                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 49889                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49890                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 49891                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49892                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 49893                                  ;;
 49894                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 49895                                  ;;
 49896                                  ;;	on return:
 49897                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 49898                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 49899                                  ;;
 49900                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 49901                                  ;;
 49902                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49903                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49904                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 49905                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 49906                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 49907                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 49908                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 49909                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 49910                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 49911                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 49912                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 49913                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 49914                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 49915                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 49916                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 49917                                  ;;
 49918                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49919
