 50123 000000C8 [4507]0000              ShSU:		DW	BadCall,0  ; 14  ShSU

 50126                                  ;============================================================================
 50127                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50128                                  ;============================================================================
 50129                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 50130                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 50131                                  
 50132                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 50133                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50134                                  
 50135                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 50136                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50137                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50138                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50139                                  ;
 50140                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50141                                  ; describing that data item.
 50142                                  
 50143                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50144                                  
 50145                                  ;
 50146                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50147                                  ;
 50148                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50149                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50150                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50151                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50152                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50153                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50154                                  ;
 50155                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50156                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50157                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50158                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50159                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50160                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50161                                  ;   as EOF).
 50162                                  
 50163                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 50164                                  
 50165                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 50166                                  
 50167                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 50168 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 50169 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 50170                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 50171 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 50172                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 50173 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 50174                                  
 50175                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 50176                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 50177                                  ; console.
 50178                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50179 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 50180 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 50181                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 50182 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 50183 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 50184                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 50185 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 50186 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 50187 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 50188                                  switch_character:
 50189 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 50190 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 50191 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 50192 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 50193 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 50194                                  
 50195                                  ; The following table is a list of addresses that the sharer patches to be
 50196                                  ; PUSH AX to enable the critical sections
 50197                                  
 50198                                  		; DOSDATA:0315h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50199                                  
 50200                                  ;PUBLIC	CritPatch
 50201                                  
 50202                                  CritPatch:	; LABEL WORD
 50203                                  
 50204                                  ;IRP sect,<critDisk,critDevice>

 50209                                  ;

 50211                                  ;       dw OFFSET DOSDATA: redir_patch
 50212                                  ;
 50213                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  E&sect
 50214                                  ;;hkn	Short_Addr  L&sect
 50215                                  ;
 50216                                  ;ELSE
 50217                                  ;	DW	0
 50218                                  ;	DW	0
 50219                                  ;ENDIF
 50220                                  ;ENDM

 50275                                  				;   GetExtendedError system calls)
 50276 0000033C 0000                    PROC_ID:	dw 0		; PID for sharing (0 = local)
 50277 0000033E 0000                    USER_ID:	dw 0		; Machine for sharing (0 = local)
 50278 00000340 0000                    FirstArena:	dw 0		; first free block found
 50279 00000342 0000                    BestArena:	dw 0		; best free block found
 50280 00000344 0000                    LastArena:	dw 0		; last free block found
 50281 00000346 0000                    ENDMEM:		dw 0		; End of memory used in DOSINIT
 50282 00000348 0000                    LASTENT:	dw 0		; Last entry for directory search
 50283 0000034A 00                      FAILERR:	db 0		; NZ if user did FAIL on I 24
 50284 0000034B 00                      ALLOWED:	db 0		; Allowed I 24 answers (see allowed_)
 50285 0000034C 00                      NoSetDir:	db 0		; true -> do not set directory
 50286 0000034D 00                      DidCTRLC:	db 0		; true -> we did a ^C exit
 50287 0000034E 00                      SpaceFlag:	db 0		; true -> embedded spaces are allowed in FC

 50403                                  ;============================================================================
 50404                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50405                                  ;============================================================================
 50406                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50407                                  
 50408                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50409                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50410                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50411                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50412                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50413                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50414                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50415                                  ; **********************************************************
 50416                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50417                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50418                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50419                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50420                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50421                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50422                                  
 50423                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50424                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50425                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50426                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50427                                  
 50428                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50429                                  
 50430                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50431                                  
 50432                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50433                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50434 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50435 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50436                                  
 50437                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50438                                  
 50439                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50440                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50441 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50442                                  RENBUF:	
 50443 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50444                                  
 50445                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50446                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50447 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50448                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50449 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 50450                                  
 50451                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 50452

 50454                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.

 50459                                  
 50460                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 50461                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 50462                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 50463                                  
 50464                                  NAME1:	
 50465 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 50466                                  NAME2:

 50468                                  DESTSTART:

 50471                                  	;times	5  db	0
 50472 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 50473                                  
 50474                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 50475                                  
 50476 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 50477                                  EXTFCB:	
 50478 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 50479                                  SATTRIB:
 50480 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes

 51020                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 51021                                  
 51022                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51023                                  ;
 51024                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 51025                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 51026                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 51027                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 51028                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 51029                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51030                                  ; Example:
 51031                                  
 51032                                  MAP_CASE:
 51033                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 51034                                  
 51035 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 51036                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51037                                  	;RETF
 51038                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 51039                                  	;;;
 51040 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51041                                  	;;;
 51042                                  Map1:
 51043 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51044 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51045 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51046 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51047                                  FINISH:
 51048 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51049 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 51050 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51051 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 51052 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 51053                                  L_RET:	
 51054 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 51055                                  
 51056                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 51057                                  
 51058                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51059

 51402                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 51403                                  
 51404                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51405                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51406                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 51407                                  
 51408                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51409                                  ;
 51410                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51411                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51412                                  ;
 51413                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51414                                  ;
 51415                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51416                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51417                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51418                                  ;
 51419                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51420                                  
 51421                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51422                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51423                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51424                                  ;ELSE
 51425                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51426                                  ;ENDIF
 51427                                  ;ENDM
 51428

 51846                                  
 51847                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51848                                  ;
 51849                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51850                                  ;
 51851                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51852                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51853                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51854                                  ;
 51855                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51856                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51857                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51858                                  ;	   4. else 
 51859                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51860                                  ;	   6. endif
 51861                                  ;	7. else
 51862                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51863                                  ;	9. endif
 51864                                  ;
 51865                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51866                                  
 51867                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51868                                  
 51869                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51870                                  
 51871                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51872                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 51873                                  
 51874                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51875                                  ;
 51876                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51877                                  ;
 51878                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51879                                  
 51880                                  ldivov:
 51881                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51882                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51883                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51884                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51885                                  i0patch:
 51886 00000F70 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51887                                  
 51888 00000F72 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51889                                  divov_cont:
 51890 00000F75 2EFF2E[4C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51891                                  
 51892                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51893                                  ;
 51894                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 51895                                  ;
 51896                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51897                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51898                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51899                                  ; will be restored then.
 51900                                  ;
 51901                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51902                                  
 51903                                  lquit:
 51904                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51905                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51906                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51907                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51908                                  i20patch:
 51909 00000F7A EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51910                                  
 51911 00000F7C E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51912                                  quit_cont:
 51913 00000F7F 2EFF2E[500F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51914                                  
 51915                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51916                                  ;
 51917                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 51918                                  ;
 51919                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51920                                  
 51921                                  lcommand:
 51922                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51923                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51924                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51925                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51926                                  i21patch:
 51927 00000F84 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51928                                  
 51929 00000F86 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51930                                  command_cont:
 51931 00000F89 2EFF2E[540F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51932                                  
 51933                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51934                                  ;
 51935                                  ; INT 25h
 51936                                  ;
 51937                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51938                                  
 51939                                  labsdrd:
 51940                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51941                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51942                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51943                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51944                                  i25patch:
 51945 00000F8E EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51946                                  
 51947 00000F90 E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51948                                  absdrd_cont:
 51949 00000F93 2EFF2E[580F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 51950                                  
 51951                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51952                                  ;
 51953                                  ; INT 26h
 51954                                  ;
 51955                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51956                                  
 51957                                  labsdwrt:
 51958                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51959                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51960                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51961                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51962                                  i26patch:
 51963 00000F98 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 51964                                  
 51965 00000F9A E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51966                                  absdwrt_cont:
 51967 00000F9D 2EFF2E[5C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 51968

 51970                                  ;

 51972                                  ;

 51977                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51978                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51979                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51980                                  i27patch:
 51981 00000FA2 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
 51982

 51984                                  sr_cont:

 52029                                  lirett:
 52030                                  	iret
 52031                                  
 52032                                  %endif
 52033                                  
 52034                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52035                                  ;
 52036                                  ; LowIntXX:
 52037                                  ;
 52038                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 52039                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 52040                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 52041                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 52042                                  ;
 52043                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 52044                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52045                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52046                                  ;
 52047                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52048                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52049                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52050                                  ;
 52051                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52052                                  
 52053                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52054                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 52055                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 52056                                  
 52057 00000FC0 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52058 00000FC4 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52059                                  
 52060                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52061                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52062                                  %if 0
 52063                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52064                                  %endif
 52065                                  
 52066                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52067                                  LowInt23:
 52068                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52069                                  					; the stack
 52070 00000FC8 2E8F06[C00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52071 00000FCD 2E8F06[C20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52072                                  
 52073 00000FD2 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52074                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52075                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52076                                  
 52077 00000FD4 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52078                                  
 52079 00000FD7 2EFF2E[C00F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52080                                  
 52081                                  
 52082                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52083                                  LowInt24:
 52084                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52085                                  					; the stack
 52086 00000FDC 2E8F06[C40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52087 00000FE1 2E8F06[C60F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52088                                  
 52089 00000FE6 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52090                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52091                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52092                                  
 52093 00000FE8 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52094                                  
 52095 00000FEB 2EFF2E[C40F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52096                                  
 52097                                  
 52098                                   
 52099                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52100                                  LowInt28:
 52101 00000FF0 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52102                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52103                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52104                                  
 52105 00000FF2 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52106                                  
 52107 00000FF5 CB                      	retf
 52108                                  
 52109                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52110                                  
 52111                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52112                                  ;
 52113                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52114                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52115                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52116                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52117                                  ;
 52118                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52119                                  
 52120                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52121                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 52122                                  
 52123                                  disa20_xfer:
 52124 00000FF6 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52125                                  
 52126                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52127                                  
 52128                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52129                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52130                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52131                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52132                                  
 52133 00000FF9 FA                      	cli
 52134 00000FFA 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52135                                  
 52136                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52137                                  	;;;
 52138 00001000 36C606[C011]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 52139                                  	;;;
 52140                                  
 52141 00001006 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52142 00001008 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52143 0000100A FB                      	sti
 52144                                  
 52145 0000100B 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52146 0000100C 56                      	push	SI
 52147 0000100D 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52148 0000100F 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52149 00001011 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52150 00001013 CB                      	retf
 52151                                  
 52152                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52153                                  ;
 52154                                  ; M003:
 52155                                  ;
 52156                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52157                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52158                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52159                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52160                                  ; more info.
 52161                                  ;
 52162                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52163                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52164                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52165                                  ;
 52166                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52167                                  
 52168                                  disa20_iret:
 52169 00001014 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52170 00001017 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52171                                  
 52172                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52173                                  	;;;
 52174 0000101B FE0E[C011]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 52175                                  	;;;
 52176                                  
 52177 0000101F 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52178 00001023 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52179 00001027 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52180                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52181 00001029 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52182                                  	
 52183                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52184                                  %if 0
 52185                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52186                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52187                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52188                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52189                                  %else
 52190                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52191                                  	;;;
 52192                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 52193 0000102C C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 52194 00001030 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 52195 00001034 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 52196                                  	;;;
 52197                                  %endif
 52198 00001037 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52199 00001038 5B                      	pop	BX
 52200 00001039 59                      	pop	CX
 52201 0000103A 5A                      	pop	DX
 52202 0000103B 5E                      	pop	SI
 52203 0000103C 5F                      	pop	DI
 52204 0000103D 5D                      	pop	BP
 52205 0000103E 1F                      	pop	DS
 52206 0000103F 07                      	pop	ES
 52207                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52208 00001040 CF                      	iret
 52209                                  
 52210                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52211                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52212                                  ;
 52213                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52214                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52215                                  ;
 52216                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52217                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52218                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52219                                  ;
 52220                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52221                                  
 52222                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52223 00001041 53                      	push	bx
 52224 00001042 50                      	push	ax
 52225                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52226 00001043 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52227 00001045 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52228 0000104A 58                      	pop	ax
 52229 0000104B 5B                      	pop	bx
 52230 0000104C C3                      	retn
 52231                                  
 52232                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52233                                  
 52234                                  XMMcontrol:
 52235 0000104D 00000000                	dd	0
 52236                                  
 52237                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52238                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52239                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 52240                                  ;;;
 52241 00001051 00000000                	dd	0
 52242                                  SC_STATUS:
 52243 00001055 0000                    	dw	0
 52244                                  ;;;
 52245                                  
 52246                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52247                                  ;
 52248                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52249                                  ;
 52250                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52251                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52252                                  ;
 52253                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52254                                  ;
 52255                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52256                                  ;		
 52257                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52258                                  ;
 52259                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52260                                  
 52261                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52262                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52263                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52264                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52265                                  ;
 52266                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52267                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52268                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52269                                  
 52270                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52271                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 52272                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 52273                                  
 52274                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52275 00001057 9C                      	pushf
 52276 00001058 1E                      	push    ds
 52277 00001059 06                      	push	es
 52278 0000105A 51                      	push	cx
 52279 0000105B 56                      	push	si
 52280 0000105C 57                      	push	di
 52281                                  
 52282                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52283                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52284                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52285                                  
 52286                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 52287                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52288                                  	;;;
 52289 0000105D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 52290 0000105F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 52291 00001061 4E                      	dec	si
 52292 00001062 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52293 00001065 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 52294 00001067 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52295                                  	;;;	
 52296                                  
 52297 0000106A B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52298 0000106D FC                      	cld
 52299 0000106E F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52300                                  
 52301 00001070 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52302                                  EA20_RET:
 52303 00001072 5F                      	pop	di
 52304 00001073 5E                      	pop	si
 52305 00001074 59                      	pop	cx
 52306 00001075 07                      	pop	es
 52307 00001076 1F                      	pop	ds
 52308 00001077 9D                      	popf
 52309 00001078 C3                      	retn
 52310                                  
 52311                                  EA20_OFF:
 52312                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52313                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52314                                  
 52315 00001079 53                      	push	bx
 52316 0000107A 50                      	push	ax
 52317                                  
 52318                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52319                                  %if 0
 52320                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52321                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52322                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52323                                  	mov	ax,cs
 52324                                  	mov	ss,ax
 52325                                  %else
 52326                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52327                                  	;;;
 52328 0000107B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52329 0000107D 2E8C16[6C0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 52330 00001082 2E8926[6E0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52331 00001087 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52332                                  	;;;
 52333                                  %endif
 52334 00001089 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52335                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52336                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52337 0000108C B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52338 0000108E 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52339 00001093 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52340 00001095 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52341                                  
 52342                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52343                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 52344                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52345                                  	;;;
 52346 00001097 2E8E16[6C0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 52347                                  	;;;
 52348 0000109C 2E8B26[6E0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52349                                  
 52350 000010A1 58                      	pop	ax
 52351 000010A2 5B                      	pop	bx
 52352                                  
 52353 000010A3 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52354                                  
 52355                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52356 000010A5 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52357 000010A7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52358 000010A9 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52359 000010AB 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 52360                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 52361                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52362                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52363                                  	;;;
 52364 000010AD B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 52365                                  	;;;
 52366 000010B0 CD10                    	int	10h
 52367                                  XMMcont:
 52368                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52369                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 52370                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52371                                  	;;;
 52372 000010B2 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 52373                                  	;;;
 52374 000010B5 CD10                    	int	10h
 52375                                  	
 52376 000010B7 BE[1911]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52377 000010BA 0E                      	push	cs
 52378 000010BB 1F                      	pop	ds
 52379 000010BC FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52380                                  XMMprnt:
 52381 000010BD AC                      	lodsb
 52382 000010BE 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52383 000010C0 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 52384 000010C2 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52385 000010C4 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52386 000010C7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52387 000010C9 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52388                                  
 52389                                  XMMStall:
 52390 000010CB FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52391 000010CC EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 52392

 52493                                  ; DOS 3.3 F.C. 6/12/86

 52570                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 52571                                  
 52572                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52573                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52574                                  ;
 52575                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52576                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52577                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52578                                  ;
 52579                                  ;
 52580                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52581                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52582                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52583                                  
 52584                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52585                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52586                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52587                                  
 52588                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52589                                  
 52590                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52591                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52592                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52593                                  
 52594                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52595                                  
 52596                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52597                                  ;
 52598                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52599                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52600                                  ;
 52601                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52602                                  ;	push	es
 52603                                  ;	push	di
 52604                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52605                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 52606                                  ;	pop	di
 52607                                  ;	pop	es
 52608                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 52609                                  
 52610                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 52611                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 52612                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 52613                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 52614                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 52615                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 52616                                  	
 52617                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 52618                                  
 52619                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 52620                                  ;
 52621                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52622                                  ;
 52623                                  ;		push	cx
 52624                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 52625                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 52626                                  ;		jz	????
 52627                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 52628                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 52629                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 52630                                  
 52631                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 52632                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 52633                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 52634                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 52635                                  
 52636                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 52637                                  
 52638                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 52639                                  ;
 52640                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 52641                                  ;
 52642                                  ;
 52643                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 52644                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 52645                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 52646                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 52647                                  ;	inc [indos]
 52648                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 52649                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 52650                                  
 52651                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 52652                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 52653                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 52654                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 52655                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 52656                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 52657                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 52658                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 52659                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 52660                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 52661                                  
 52662                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 52663                                  
 52664                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 52665                                  ;
 52666                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 52667                                  ;
 52668                                  ;
 52669                                  ;
 52670                                  ;	push	ax
 52671                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 52672                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 52673                                  ;	pop	ax
 52674                                  ;	jz	????
 52675                                  
 52676                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 52677                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 52678                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 52679                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 52680                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 52681                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 52682                                  
 52683                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 52684                                  
 52685                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 52686                                  ;
 52687                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 52688                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 52689                                  ;
 52690                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 52691                                  ;
 52692                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 52693                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 52694                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52695                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 52696                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 52697                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 52698                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 52699                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 52700                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 52701                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 52702                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 52703                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 52704                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 52705                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 52706                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 52707                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52708                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 52709                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52710                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 52711                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52712                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 52713                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 52714                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52715                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 52716                                  ;
 52717                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 52718                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 52719                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 52720                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 52721                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 52722                                  ;
 52723                                  ;   CRDROK:
 52724                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 52725                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52726                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 52727                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 52728                                  
 52729                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 52730                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52731                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 52732                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52733                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 52734                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52735                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 52736                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52737                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 52738                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 52739                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52740                                  			db	009H,003H
 52741                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 52742                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 52743                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 52744                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52745                                  			db	05FH
 52746                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52747                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 52748                                  
 52749                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52750                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 52751                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 52752                                  
 52753                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 52754                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 52755                                  ;
 52756                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 52757                                  ;
 52758                                  ;
 52759                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 52760                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 52761                                  ;	    je l1
 52762                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 52763                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 52764                                  ;	    int 10h
 52765                                  ;	    jmp l0
 52766                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 52767                                  
 52768                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 52769                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 52770                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 52771                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 52772                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 52773                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 52774                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 52775                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 52776                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID

 52833                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 52834                                  ;
 52835                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 52836                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 52837                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 52838                                  ;

 52847                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52848                                  
 52849                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52850                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52851                                  
 52852                                  ; 17/01/2024
 52853                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52854                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52855                                  ; 09/03/2024
 52856                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52857                                  
 52858                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52859                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 52860                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 52861                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 52862                                  
 52863                                  ; country and code page information
 52864                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52865                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 52866 00001132 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 52867 0000113A 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 52867 00001143 53595300           
 52868                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 52869 00001147 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 52870                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52871                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52872                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 52873                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 52874                                  ;  endif
 52875                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 52876                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 52877                                  ;  endif
 52878                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 52879                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 52880                                  ;  endif
 52881                                  ;else
 52882 0000117A B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 52883                                  ;endif
 52884                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52885 0000117C 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 52886                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 52887 0000117E 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 52888 0000117F [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 52889 00001181 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52890 00001183 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 52891 00001184 [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 52892 00001186 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52893 00001188 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 52894 00001189 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 52895 0000118B 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52896 0000118D 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 52897 0000118E [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 52898 00001190 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52899 00001192 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 52900 00001193 [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 52901 00001195 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 52902 00001197 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 52903 00001198 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 52904                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52905                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52906                                  ;	......
 52907                                  ;else

 52912 0000119C B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 52913                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_108: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 108	
 52914 0000119E 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 52915 000011A0 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 52916 000011A5 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator

 53015                                  
 53016                                  ;============================================================================
 53017                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 53018                                  ;============================================================================
 53019                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 53020                                  
 53021                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 53022                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 53023                                  ;
 53024                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 53025                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 53026                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 53027                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 53028                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 53029                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 53030                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 53031                                  ; to call out here.
 53032                                  ;
 53033                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 53034                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 53035                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 53036                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 53037                                  ;
 53038                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 53039                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 53040                                  ;
 53041                                  ;Exported Functions
 53042                                  ;==================
 53043                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 53044                                  
 53045                                  ; DosData Segment
 53046                                  
 53047                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53048                                  
 53049                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53050                                  
 53051                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53052                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53053                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53054                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53055                                  
 53056                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53057 00001246 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53058                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53059                                  
 53060                                  ; 25/03/2024
 53061                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 53062                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 53063                                  
 53064                                  ; 07/03/2025
 53065                                  %if 0
 53066                                  MagicPatch:
 53067                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53068                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53069                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53070                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53071                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53072                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53073                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53074                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53075                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53076                                  %endif
 53077                                  
 53078                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53079                                  
 53080                                  ;DosData Ends
 53081                                  
 53082                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 53083                                  ;
 53084                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 53085                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 53086                                  
 53087                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 53088                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 53089                                  
 53090                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)
 53091

 53113                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 53114                                  
 53115                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53116                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 53117                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 53118                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 53119                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 53120                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 53121                                  					; (= 4944 for Windows ME IO.SYS)
